review.reviewText: Shame that the hotel did not recognise my birthday, despite Expedia's notes. Only 1 coffee a day in the room was very mean, had to keep asking for more which were given without any fuss. Room was comfortable and the Breakfast was good despite being the same each day - suggest you change the breakfast menu more often. I was disappointed not to receive any credits to my IHG account - I understand your reasons but did not totally agree. We enjoyed our stay overall and San Francisco but we do not plan to make a return trip as the flight duration is a big drawback.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to Fisherman's wharf and the public transport system. The receptionist 'ADY' for helping us find a room that was quiet. Concierge team.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast - more rotation of choice, it was more or less the same for the whole of our stay.

review.title: Holiday Inn Express at Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay at the Holiday Inn Express, the staff was helpful and friendly.  It is located within walking distance of the Wharf, bus stops as well as cable cars etc.  The morning breakfast was always very good.

review.title: Business Trip, great location
review.reviewText: Stayed here for 4 nights, the staff is great and easy to work with. The location is pretty good, many nice restaurants to choose from as well as cafes and nightlife. Only a 12 to 15 minute ride to Moscone Convention Center, the traffic can be hectic at rush hour give yourself enough time to get where your going. Holiday Inn only offers valet parking here and the price is steep in my opinion $55 a day including tax. There are local parking garages to choose from for less money. Overall not a bad place to stay for the price, room is comfortable and they offer a nice breakfast buffet from 6:30 to 9:30am. Fitness center is a little dated with limited space and older equipment. I would stay again for business purposes easy access to most locations with plenty to do.
review.positiveRemarks: Great Location at a very reasonable price.
review.negativeRemarks: Fitness center is dated and very limited space.
review.locationRemarks: Location is great, right on  Fisherman's Wharf with plenty of restaurants and shopping.

review.title: Awesome!
review.reviewText: Rooms are really nice, beds and pillows were very comfortable. Having a hot FREE breakfast with so many healthy options is a wonderful perk. Good location. Will definitely stay there again!!

review.title: Nice hotel close to Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Room was clean and cozy for my 4 nights and 5 day stay. I especially loved the free breakfast served daily from 6:30-9:30am! They had a variety of foods to choose from for a well balanced breakfast. This hotel is just a few blocks away from Fisherman's Wharf so we walked everywhere. Beware though for those who have cars...either find street parking or lots because the parking is only valet at the hotel and it's $45/night! Yikes! Overall, had a great time and would stay at this hotel again!

review.title: Reasonably nice hotel in the middle of it all
review.reviewText: Bed wasn't quite as comfy as most Holiday Inn Express and water pressure was terrible.  Hotel staff went above and beyond for us though so it ended up being a great experience!  This hotel is in the perfect location and I would definitely stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and staff were above expectations.
review.negativeRemarks: Matress, water pressure.
review.locationRemarks: Near tons of tourist attractions but far enough away that it isn't noisy at night.  Close to a cable car stop and within 5 minute walk to other fun.

review.title: Nice hotel, close to piers and tour buses.

Great location, walking distance to all the good places , nice staff,all good

review.positiveRemarks: Good size suite for family of 5

review.title: Very good location; close to all amenities.
review.reviewText: Enjoyed the location.  Being walking distance to the wharf gave us a good variety of restaurants.  Transportation everywhere was very accessible from the Wharf area.  Shopping in the area was good as well.  Enjoyed the unique shops in the Wharf area.  The Farmer's Market at the Ferry Building was a 30 minute walk.
review.positiveRemarks: Hotel offered a very good breakfast every morning with good variety.  Jesse at  concierge desk and Brandi at front desk went above and beyond.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping.  Water transportation to Sousolito, Angel Island, Alcatraz and Tuberon.  Accessible transportation to other parts of the city.

review.title: Good spot in close to the wharf activities.

Very nice, AC worked well, room was spotless and nice, but small. Breakfasts in the hotel were very good to excellent for this type of stay. Bed was excellent. We would stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice, clean and close to activities.
review.negativeRemarks: Expensive as is everything there.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to most activities, the bus and rail tours, bars, restaurants and museums. No car needed. Hop the shuttle from the airport.

review.title: Weekend wedding.
review.reviewText: The wedding we were attending was at Ft. Mason.  The Holiday Inn was very close to the venue and also close to the Wharf area.  It was a great location.
review.positiveRemarks: Thank you Holiday Inn for your great hospitality and service.  Everything met or exceeded our expectations.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking was expensive ($50/night).  In retrospect should have taken a shuttle to the hotel and used taxis.  Next time....
review.locationRemarks: Be sure to stop at Buena Vista Cafe (blocks away) for an Irish Coffee.

review.title: Perfect Choice for Hotel

We would definitely go there again.

review.title: Great Place to Stay

Good clean facility, comfortable bed.
Would recommend to all.

review.title: Comfortable Hotel in Fisherman's Wharf

Television (LG) included HBO channels and decent cable selection.   Unfortunately, we did not try the complimentary breakfast, as there were plenty of other places around to eat breakfast we wanted to try.
review.positiveRemarks: The pillows were awesome. Soft and Firm pillows included.  The staff was friendly and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: I usually like a softer bed, but other than that, everything was great.
review.locationRemarks: It was close enough to all the attractions in Fisherman's Wharf.  San Francisco is only a 7x7 mile city, so everything is very accessible by cab...

review.title: Excellent location.

review.positiveRemarks: The location was perfect for our needs.

Rooms were very comfortable and they have a great continental breakfast. Out view was pretty bad but it didn't matter with our short stay. Definitely would stay here again for the price.

review.title: Very nice hotel

review.title: One night in San Francisco

review.positiveRemarks: Its close proximity to many landmarks.

review.title: Nice hotel for vacationing families
review.reviewText: We stayed one night at this hotel.  It was a bit expensive but not too bad for San Francisco.  Our room was clean and the hotel staff cordial.  Breakfast area was very crowded but the hotel offered better than usual options (Greek yogurts, etc).

review.title: overall an ok experience

review.negativeRemarks: not enough seating for breakfast and lower the parking fee.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to the big bus pick up which was great, close to pier 39, Ghiradelli's and lots of places to shop.

review.title: Right by Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Was a little  worried to book because we normally stay at Ritz, Omni's, much more posh places and I haven't stayed at a Holiday Inn (express) since I was young. This was the last stop on our adventure so we were looking to save some money. Let's just say I was VERY impressed with the staff, the decor, the cleanliness of the room and I guarantee we will probably stay there again! It was two blocks from Fisherman's Wharf right in the middle of everything. There were a lot of homeless people out there strolling the streets at night as common for a large town but we felt very safe inside, especially after dark. Rooms were large and bathrooms very nice with granite. Semi comfy beds but I am hard to please with beds since most are too hard for my back. Great linens on the beds and EXCELLENT AC. That is a big deal for me. I do not like staying in a hotel when it's hot and I guarantee you it was not hot once. Concierge was helpful and we took the recommended shuttle service back to the airport. Enjoyed our stay very much!

review.title: Nice hotel close to the Wharf
review.reviewText: Clean hotel with walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf.    Parking is a little price of $51 a night

review.title: Great location to the Wharf.
review.reviewText:
We enjoyed our stay at your hotel, it's at a great location. Everyone was great in helping us with information and check in. Jessica was great at your guest services, and the other young lady that works with her. Both gave us good information and directions.
My suggestion would be to have a microwave & refrigerator in every room.  We enjoy cold beverages  available after long day of sight seeing.
review.locationRemarks: Location was good, everything was one to two blocks away. We were in the heart of everything. Our second trip to San Francisco in two years.

review.title: Excellent location to enjoy San Fransisco.
review.reviewText: Staff was very helpful and pleasant.  Rooms were clean and breakfast was good.

review.title: Wonderful
review.reviewText: Clean, breakfast was great. Had a wonderful time in a good location.
review.negativeRemarks: No improvements needed

review.reviewText:
Touristic location. Helpfull staff, nice rooms.
But no mini bar in rooms and room walls so thin, you can hear next room's phone conversations.
Best fit for a 2-3 night stay, good rates also.

review.title: Close to fisherman's wharf
review.reviewText: Central to most things we wanted to see.  Very helpful with plans for tours we wanted. Wonderful breakfast. Would definitely go there again. Clean and comfortable rooms.  Thank you!!

review.title: Great location walking distance to ferries.
review.reviewText:
First visit to San Fran great location walk to fishermans wharf walk to hire a bike or to a hop on bus. Lots of local seafood restaurants close by. Large supermarket just down road.  Wifi great 

Breakfast complimentary great also

review.title: Reasonable hotel. Good position.
review.reviewText: The hotel was nicely situated for getting to fishermens wharf. Booking in was quick and easy. The girls on the desk were very efficient and friendly.  The room was plenty big enough for the two of us. The bed was nice and soft. On the negative side, the view was non existent - straight onto other rooms. My major complaint was that the room smells and not of tobacco. I should have complained, but we were only there for two nights so didn't bother. The breakfast was a bit of a rugby scrum and the hot food was only tepid but on the whole it was quit adequate. Another downside was that there was no bar, but there are plenty within walking distance. I would not recomend this hotel solely because of the smell in the room.

review.title: Nice hotel and close to Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: The hotel is nice and a walking distance to most of the tourist attractions in the Fisherman's Wharf including Pier 39 if you want to take a 60-min boat cruise to Golden Gate Bridge and Alcatraz, cable car at Powell and Hyde, intersection of Lombard and Hyde if you want to see the famous crookedest street in the world, Trader's Joe, Safeway and Ross. Overall, we were satisfied with our stay at this hotel. We recommend that you take airport shuttle from SFO Airport to the hotel for ease of travel. We checked out at 12 noon (hotel's policy) and we walked along Columbus Street to Chinatown and Union Square which took about 30-45 minutes and then we took BART subway from Powell Station to SFO Airport.
review.negativeRemarks: Provide hotel airport shuttle for a fee, if possible.

review.title: We had a good time in San Francisco .
review.reviewText: The location of the hotel is great all the Public Transit routes are within walking distance to our hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: The location was great because it is near all the attractions we wanted to visit.
review.negativeRemarks: We found everything to our liking.
review.locationRemarks: There is lots to see and do at Fishermans Wharf, it was very accessible to the market area and AT&T park.

review.title: Nice hotel close everything
review.reviewText: Great experience. Room clean and breakfast was a great plus.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel was very clean and staff was great.
review.locationRemarks: Close to everything.  It was right in the middle of tourist area. Lots of things to do and see.

review.title: Great hotel close to the wharf
review.reviewText:
Thoroughly enjoyed stay at this hotel. Very clean rooms and friendly staff. Morning breakfast included
was great.
review.negativeRemarks: Need to dust ceiling fans in bathroom
review.locationRemarks: Easy walking distance to wharf or cable cars and lots of attractions.

review.title: Nice
review.reviewText: Just nice, the staff were very pleasant, everything was just good

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The hotel is centraly located close to the Warf. The complimentary breakfast was a big plus for us. Parking is expensive but all the hotels in that area are as well. I'd stay there again.

review.title: Clean, conveniently located hotel for tourists
review.reviewText: We had the 2 double bed room for our family of 2 adults and 2 kids. The room was comfortable. Their breakfast was great and their concierge was extremely helpful in making our trip perfect. The hotel is hardly a block away from the cable car stop and a short walk from the fisherman's wharf and many other restaurants and attractions. The rental shops for bicycles, Segway, go-carts are behind the hotel. A grocery store and pharmacy are also a block away. We walked to Lombard street, china town and the Italian area. This is the place to stay when visiting San Francisco.
Nice clean place with a great free breakfast. Even the coffee was decent.
review.positiveRemarks: great breakfast and nice clean room
review.locationRemarks: perfect location for Pier 39 and lots else

review.title: Great Location!!
review.reviewText: Literally walking distance to everything! I highly recommend this hotel - great price and excellent staff. Free breakfast and wifi, they even let us check in 3 hours early at no additional charge.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, location, location, comfortable beds - 2 types of pillows to choose from - it was an awesome stay.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf, Ghiradelli Square, Trolley stop, WalGreens, Starbucks,Pier 39, shopping, and the sea lions all just around the corner.

review.title: Within 3 blocks of fisherman's wharf
review.reviewText: Great breakfast but would suggest having coffee earlier than 630 a.m. for those that get up real early. Front desk staff very nice and helpful
review.locationRemarks: Take a tour of city and alcatraz and then went souvenir shopping places to eat are close

review.title: Good location...clean hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was very clean, and a GREAT location! The Wharf is very close, also walking distance to other sites like Gharadelli Square, Cable Cars, Lombard St and North Beach. The breakfast was simple but adequate for a quick stop before starting the day.
review.positiveRemarks: Great for the price. Location was great. Room size was sufficient for 2.

review.title: Very family friendly
review.reviewText: We had 2 families traveling together. It was within walking distance to wharf n pier 39 no complaints from kids 11,10,9,8 yrs old. Downfall was its expensive. And then parking was $45 plus tax on top of that. No fridge in room but it was available for another $10. The breakfast was great! The best out of all the hotels we stayed at on our trip. Pool was at their property across the street. Altho u have access to it, we felt like that was a giant pain to even bother with...

review.title: Good location, walk to Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, good location, good breakfast included. Not sure if we knew about the $45 parking fee, in addition to high room price.
review.negativeRemarks: Less expensive rates or free parking
review.locationRemarks: Walk to Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39, etc.

review.title: 1 week of bliss in San Francisco!
review.reviewText:
Our first time visit to SF turned out beyond expectations primarily due to our choice of hotel - the Holiday Inn Express at Fisherman's Wharf! First and foremost, Location, Location, Location! Within walking distance to nearby hot spots and an excellent team of staff that are very service oriented and helpful - espacially Ady at reception who helped up with restaurant selections, making special arrangements etc.
The hot breakfast every morning is the second reason we booked here - great convenience and good value for the price! No regrets whatsoever with this hotel and location!
review.negativeRemarks: Serve breakfast till 10am
review.locationRemarks: Pier 39, Ghiradelli Square, cable cars stop, union square, crooked street, big buss tours for the city, wineries and goldengate bridge. Walgrens near.

review.title: Great hotel with a great location
review.reviewText: Great place to stay. I've stayed here 3 times now, and the hotel has been refitted since I was there last. Looks great! Nice and clean and comfy! Location is excellent. Highly recommend. Good breakfast selection too.

review.title: Hotel
review.reviewText: Room was Nice and the staff was very friendly. Great location, close to so many restaurants and shops. We didn't need a taxi.

review.title: Good location near wharf
review.reviewText: The hotel is pricey for what it us and parking is valet only and expensive....but it's San Francisco. The location was great and the breakfast was pretty good for a free breakfast :). The only thing odd was where our room was. I think it was room 177 and it was a funky location. The window looked out to an ugly area (like a dead center for the hotel) that could easily made a little more appealing.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: The location of this hotel is convenient, no on-site restaurant but continental breakfast was fairly good & included hot items like eggs, sausage & pancakes. Rooms are quite small but clean & comfortable. Some, (including mine), have windows that just stare at another wall.
review.negativeRemarks: Slow elveators
review.locationRemarks: Two blocks to Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Location was very convenient. Though the hotel was very basic, no amenities beyond breakfast. No coffee or sundries, though everything is within walking distance. There is no self-parking, only valet.
review.negativeRemarks: Sundries, and a more welcoming lounge area.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Fishermans Wharf, Pier 39, and trolley. Easy to get to everything in the city.

review.title: Excellent hotel, quiet, good breakfast & location
review.reviewText:
breakfast was very good, pancakes, cinnamon rolls, a variety of bread, English muffins, sausage, juice, milk, cereal, eggs. Just wished after the third day, the would change it a bit....
rooms nice and quiet, staff nice and very helpful, best stay ever!!
review.negativeRemarks: matress was little bit hard, more varieties in pillow thickness
review.locationRemarks: at Fishermans Wharf, cable car a few streets away, bus around the corner, near to pier 39, great restaurants around the corner.

review.title: Perfect location, great staff!
review.reviewText: The location of the Hotel is an excellent location to all attractions. The staff is very friendly and professional. They allowed us to have a late check out with out any issues.The Concierge went above and beyond with a flower and a fruit basket delivery within hours to the hotel. I have stayed at this same hotel several times and have been very satisfied each time and will return again. We had family and friends stay at other hotels and when they visited this hotel, they will book here the next visit.
review.positiveRemarks: I appreciated the fact that there is a breakfast buffet and staff was very friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: I would like to see the hot items on buffet alternate rather than have the same hot items on a daily basis.

review.title: Only a few blocks from the bay and great food!
review.reviewText: Very satisfied with this hotel. The free breakfast was a pleasant surprise and the staff were great! Would definitely stay here again!
review.positiveRemarks: Everything...the free internet and the ease of printing our airline tickets were especially great!
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's wharf, cable cars and outstanding seafood!

review.title: RETURNING !!!
review.reviewText: This Hotel is so User Friendly . . . from check-in to check-out. At 72. I've been in hundreds of hotels, this one is in the top 8. Loved the casual feeling to the place; breakfast (self serve} complete . . . The People; Could Hug Them All, from the front desk to the room attendants. And not to forget the security gentleman who helped me when I was getting ice at 3 am. For me, if you want to feel at home, when you're away from home, this is the place to stay . . . Love It !
review.negativeRemarks: N/A
review.locationRemarks: IT'S Close to everything. . . O.K. now being close to a Safeway and Walgreens was Special to me. Just ask the Concierge or the front desk-WONDERFUL

review.title: Close and convenient to the Wharf.
review.reviewText: We stayed four nights. The place is close to many attractions and shops so perfect for tourists. Also close to tour buses and great restaurants. Our ride to the airport on the last day wasn't due till 3pm so we had no trouble getting a later checkout and the lobby was comfortable and roomy for waiting in. The breakfast was really good with lots of options.
review.negativeRemarks: Hmmm...can't think of anything.
review.locationRemarks: .There is a great little restaurant just steps away from the from door serving breakfast and lunch.

review.title: Staff was friendly, pleasant and accommodating.
review.reviewText: Hotel staff was great, rooms were clean and comfy.

review.title: Ok - average hotel.
review.reviewText: It was ok. The crib took awhile getting to the room and we had planned on taking a nap. Staff was ok.
review.negativeRemarks: They need more toiletries in the bathroom.
review.locationRemarks: Great. Love the location.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: Awesome breakfast buffet! Very clean and well kept. Close to the wharf and Ghiradelli Square.

review.title: Fantastic Location!
review.reviewText:
This hotel was a great place to stay to be able to walk and use public transit in San Francisco. It's only a 5 minute walk away from Pier 39 and other tourist attractions are very easy to get to.
My only concern was the noise level in the room. We weren't right by any public areas but every morning could hear the sound people enjoying their breakfast at 6:30. In the evenings some groups were using the common areas and could be heard well into the night.
Other than the noise levels this hotel is a fantastic place to stay on a student budget and I would recommend it to any of my frineds.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise levels in the rooms from public areas.
review.locationRemarks: Within walking distance of Pier 39 and the Alcatraz Cruise Landing. Easy access to public transportation can take you all over the city.

review.title: Decent Hotel in Fisherman's Wharf Area.
review.reviewText: A decent, clean hotel centrally located in the Fisherman's Wharf region of San Francisco. We stayed 8 nights and had no major complaints. On the second night I noticed the heater/AC unit wasn't functioning but it was repaired while we were out for the day. We asked for a 'room with a view' and were offered one the rooms facing north onto Beach Street. That was great! Traffic can be a bit loud at times, but not horrible. The inner rooms are very quiet, if that is what you want; but no real view to speak of.
review.positiveRemarks: Front desk staff were friendly, helpful and always eager to assist. Breakfast is provided with the room charge. Concierge was very knowledgeable.
review.negativeRemarks: It was great having breakfast but a little variety in egg and meat choices would be appreciated.
review.locationRemarks: Hotel is centrally located in Fisherman's Wharf area, only minutes away from Pier 39, many good restaurants and famous cable cars.

review.title: Stay at the sherton on the fishermans wharf.
review.reviewText: Rooms are very small. Was told I had a family suite. When we got there it was the junior suite. No pull out coach. No pool or washer dryer. You have to go a block away to there sister hotel to use theirs.

review.title: Close to Fisherman's wharf and yet, room was quiet
review.reviewText: Went with expedia 40% off for unknown hotel. What a deal! Couldn't be happier with the result and the price, which included breakfast!
review.positiveRemarks: Proximity to wharf and Buena Vista!
review.negativeRemarks: Plumbing issue required a call to the front desk. Fix was fast!
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's wharf, trolley cars, great restaurants!

review.title: Nice hotel, close to pier attractions.
review.reviewText: This was a nice hotel close to all the attractions of the pier area. Easy walking distance, excellent but expensive car parking on site. Breakfast got a little too busy at peak times. I recommend you get down to breakfast early or go to Denny's at the end of the block. I would stay here again with family and on business.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, close to attractions, free wifi, excellent rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast range of foods
review.locationRemarks: Close to pier 39 and all attractions.

review.title: More than I expected
review.reviewText: Super clean, super close to Fisherman's wharf. Great price includes breakfast. Parking fee seemed high, but not much higher than all-day fees at public parking garages. If I had to fault them on something, it would be that they didn't have any non-dairy creamer for the coffee, which is petty.

review.title: Excellent location.
review.reviewText: Initially we were given a very noisy room on the ground floor. We complained about this and we were moved to a much better room the next day. We found the staff pleasant and helpful. It was a surprise to be given cardboard plates and plastic cutlery at breakfast, but we got used to them. There was a reasonable choice of food on offer. Our only complaint was that the breakfast area was very crowded and at times it was quite difficult to find somewhere to sit. I think the whole deal we had from Expedia was excellent value for money and I wouldn't hesitate to use the company again and if I were to return to San Francisco, I'd be happy to stay at the Holiday Inn Express.
review.negativeRemarks: See above
review.locationRemarks: Very convenient for Fisherman's Wharf and the cable cars for going further afield

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Poor water pressure in shower, overly crowded at breakfast, bland food, very comfy room.

review.title: Good rate, free breakfast
review.reviewText:
This was a good price. However, it's not exactly next to the nicest pier on fishermans wharf plus there were a lot of a parties going on in the hallway of the hotel on a Saturday evening!
Another negative note- all the rooms doors are unbelievably loud so be prepared to hear constant door slamming, all day, all night.

review.title: Nice hotel, horrible breakfast time
review.reviewText: It is a nice hotel, very close to Fisherman's Wharf, to cable car station, etc. Rooms are very clean, didn't like the fact that there was no refrigerator , sometimes we came late from dinner and we would've liked to save our desserts for next day. Our room (546) was very small, with a horrible view to an inner patio, they need to do something over there , maybe a nice garden. No noise, I give it that. Staff was friendly even though the day we arrived (after an 8 hrs trip) we had to wait for someone in front desk, nobody was there. Otherwise, they were very attentive. About breakfast: it is free but there is no control about the guests. Every time we went there the place was crowded, noisy, no seats available, no pancakes. We noticed people coming from the hotel next door (which has no free breakfast) and joking about that. So I guess those guys had to get up very early to sneak in the HIE's breakfast area and take the nice and hot omelettes that belonged to us :(
review.positiveRemarks: 1. Location: very close to the Piers (where most of tour operators are, like Alcatraz Cruises) 2. Quiet and clean. 3. A good Free breakfast
review.negativeRemarks: Please provide guests with wristbands so at breakfast time the hotel employees can know who the guests are. Some people who went there were not guests
review.locationRemarks: Location is great! Fisherman's Wharf is a place to spend all day at and have a lot of fun! Ghirardelli Square and the Cable Car Station are close too!

review.title: Great Location to the Wharf area!
review.reviewText: We stayed here for the weekend. Very good location easy to walk to the wharf and get on the street cars. If you rented a car take a day and go to Muir Woods, Point Reyes, and go up to Battery Spencer follow the road up to get an awesome view of the Golden Gate. I would definitely stay here again.
review.negativeRemarks: The only drawback was paying $45 bucks a night for parking your car and then they add tax on top of that. Parking is all around expensive in the area
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf Street Cars Pier 39 Golden Gate Bridge Muir Woods, Point Reyes

review.title: Nice hotel, close to Fishermans a Wharf and tours
review.reviewText:
Great location. Short walk to Fishermans Wharf and many attractions. Hotel was clean,
Comfortable, and included a full breakfast . Wished they had refrigerator and microwave in room.
Staff was friendly and helpful.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Close to the warf, comfortable and pleasing. Breakfast was convenient and very nice to wake up to. Staff very helpful, taxis always available.
review.locationRemarks: Close to warf, pier 39 and your buses

review.title: Excellent location!
review.reviewText: This was a very nice hotel. Rooms were comfortable, the full breakfast helped keep costs down, and the location was wonderful. We will definitely stay at this hotel again!

review.title: Newly updated but no fridge
review.reviewText: The hotel has recently been updated very nice, except they no longer provide a refridgerator. I had to buy a cooler.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Wonderful, felt like home from home. Very efficient check in. Great to have free local calls. Housekeeping was faultless. Really felt like home at breakfast.
review.positiveRemarks: Very clean, efficient, a lovely big rooms. Breakfast excellent
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Very central to lots of attractions

review.title: Nice, clean hotel in Fisherman's Wharf area.
review.reviewText: Room was excellent. Newly appointed. Clean. Comfortable bed. Pillows were much too large however.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean and recently updated. Portion of lobby was closed and under renovation.
review.negativeRemarks: Hotel could provide smaller pillows.
review.locationRemarks: Hotel is in heart of Fisherman's Wharf area. Many restaurants, shops, tours, and lovely scenery within blocks of hotel.

review.title: Good 2 experience S.F. within walking distance
review.reviewText: Very good price & everything is within walking distance. Room was clean & staff was very friendly

review.title: construction
review.reviewText: should have been informed of the major construction project in progress

review.title: A decent stay in SF.
review.reviewText: Had to head to San Francisco on short notice for buisiness so I had to make a quick decision on where to stay. The hotel lobby was being remodeled at the time but there was no debris in the way whatsoever & the service was still very good.
review.positiveRemarks: Food & shopping was just a walk away.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking is expensive, but that just goes with the territory.
review.locationRemarks: San francisco/ Fishermans Wharf. good food, lots of sights to see, good places to shop.

review.title: convenient location right in Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText: Great location, decent free breakfast and reasonable price
review.locationRemarks: close to trolley, cruises and transportation system

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Loved the location. Was easy to get anywhere we wanted to go via walking or cable car. The complimentary hot breakfast every morning was a great perk! Also loved the complimentary wifi. The room itself was very standard, we had a horrible view of just the neighboring hotel rooms, and the room is quite small. However it was fine for 2 people. Would recommend.

review.title: Nice, affordable hotel
review.reviewText: Though you don't get a luxurious experience, you get a just-right place to sleep/lounge feeling. Breakfast has a great selection in the morning-- quality is acceptable but variety is vast. Construction going on in the daytime in the lobby, but you can't hear it if you stay on the 3rd/4th floor. I was on the 4th floor. Centrally located! Super convenient and a downright clean place to stay. Pleased customer :D

review.title: Free breakfast
review.reviewText:
I very rarely write any reviews but could not resist to write this one and I want hotel management to take this constructive criticism and improve in that area.
Overall, I would give this hotel 4 start if it wasn't for free breakfast. In all honesty, for the number of hotels that I've been to (and also offering continental breakfast) this is by far most dreadful breakfast that I've ever had. The pancakes were from the machine, the crapes (or at least it looked like crapes) were impossible to bite on and scrambled eggs looked so dry and crumbled I though they were serving yellow cereal. Both I and my wife ended up throwing everything to the garbage can and I'm really not a picky person when it comes to food.

On the coffee front, they must have reused the same pot like 3 times as my coffee was very watered down and that found its way to the garbage as well.

review.title: Good
review.reviewText: the hotel location was very good and near the stops and the breakfast was cool

review.title: Nice hotel with great breakfast
review.reviewText: Great place to stay, especially if you are on a budget, great location close to public transportation, staff is knowledgeable about the surroundings and willing to help. Great breakfast with save you time and money.

review.title: Great location. Friendly atmosphere.
review.reviewText: Walking distance to Fisherman's wharf. Will come next time.

The hotel was very comfortable and as advertised.
The advice re renovations being undertaken during our stay had been noted but these were less disruptive than had been suggested and were no problem to us at all.
The rooms were great, the location is ideal and the complimentary breakfasts are a great idea and very well done indeed. This is particularly useful for families.
Rooms were clean and the staff very approachable.
We will definitely stay there again.
Well done.

review.title: Nice hotel, good location for North SF.
review.reviewText: Quiet, good service, clean and well located, this is a solid bet for a stay in Fisherman's Warf. The parking is $45 extra, so include that when calculating the price of your stay. Their was construction for a remodel going on that detracted a bit from the experience. Many hotels in this area have street facing rooms on a busy streets that are noisy all night. Fortunately mine was interior and very quiet.

review.title: Excellent Hotel
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed our stay. We were there during the hotel renovation. It didn't disrupt us too much however the fitness room was closed for reno's during our stay. The room had a king size very comfortable bed, excellent pillows. What really set this hotel high on our list was it's excellent location. Fishermans Wharf was a mere two blocks away, across the street was a fabulous restaurant called Knuckles. Best fish and chips I have ever had, we would recommend this hotel!
review.positiveRemarks: The king size bed was very comfortable, staff were very friendly and helpful
review.negativeRemarks: The renovations were a bit of a crappy part however they were done work well before bed time. I would recommend not staying next to the ice machine
review.locationRemarks: 2 blocks from Fishermans Wharf, a few blocks from pier 39, 100's of restaurants within walking distance

review.title: Misleading - MINI Suite
review.reviewText: I contacted the hotel regarding mini-suites prior to making a reservation. I was told that there is a sofa bed. However when we arrived at the hotel, there was not enough room to turn the sofa into a bed. I complaint to the hotel staff and I was basically ignored. If I would have known that the sofa bed is not a true sofa bed, I would have gone to a different hotel...
review.negativeRemarks: do not lie to customers - tell them that sofa bed in mini-suites are not true sofa beds.
review.locationRemarks: none

review.title: under renovation
review.reviewText: hotel did not disclose that it was under renovation
review.positiveRemarks: Once renovation is complere I am sure it will be fine

review.title: Close to pier 39
review.reviewText: Hotel staff was very friendly. Walking distance to pier 39.

review.title: Perfect location at Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: We usually stay in downtown SF around Union Square and opted for something different this visit. The location of the hotel was perfect and not nearly as congested as downtown. Hotel staff was exceptionally accommodating and friendly. Also, there is a wonderful breakfast/brunch spot next door called Hollywood Cafè! Well worth it! We definitely plan on returning!

review.title: Great value
review.reviewText: Walking distance to the wharf and cable trolley, clean room, best free breakfast I've had in a long time.

review.title: Hotel check in
review.reviewText: Overall the stay was good. The check in was lousy had to wait to check in

review.title: Excellent
review.reviewText: Hotel was very clean and comfortable. Staff were extremely helpful. Breakfast was good, although you need to get up early to get a seat, do not leave it to the last 30 mins!!!. The swimming pool was in the adjacent hotel, but we did not bother to go in there. Hotel was in a great location for getting around San Francisco. We purchased a Clipper Card (like London's Oyster Card) which gave you access to the Cable Cars, Trams and Buses, I would highly recommend getting one of these as the transportation is so easy to use, you do not need a car in SF.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to Ghiradelli Square and the Cable Car stop.

review.title: Good Value for the Location
review.reviewText:
You know what you're going to get when you book a stay at a Holiday Inn Express. A clean place to sleep without a lot of perks some of the higher end hotels offer but also less expensive.

The property was under renovation but that was not overly obvious and they did a good job of keeping up the appearance despite the construction. Overall I was pleasantly surprised...the room was quiet and comfortable. Good value for San Francisco being that close to the Wharf.

The excitement came on our last day when the fire alarm went off in the morning. We immediately walked out of the room towards the exit. Unfortunately the staff did not appear to be trained in what to do when the alarm sounds. There were many guests still sitting in the breakfast room while the alarm was going off and staff members looked dumbfounded. I asked one of the two front desk clerks who were just standing there if it was a false alarm but she had no idea and only after I asked did she suggest we exit the building. Nobody took charge.

The alarm finally shut off and the fire department showed up a few minutes later. Turns out someone really likes their toast black as a toaster set off the smoke alarm. The hotel staff should have been better prepared for something like that. Other than that, a pleasant stay!

review.title: Holiday Inn exspress near the Fishermans Warf
review.reviewText: Very nice Hotel, staff was very friendly, walking distance to everything at the Fishermans warf and tour pick-up sites. Parking was 45 dollars a night, a bit pricey, there were parking garages cheaper that were close to the hotel. Overall a good experience !! I would stay there again, but park my car in a cheaper place.

review.title: Perfect location
review.reviewText:
This hotel is located perfectly to enjoy Fisherman's Wharf.
Hotel is clean, staff is friendly, rooms comfy. Only negative during our stay was noise due to some remodeling but as we were not in our room much during the day we weren't disturbed much. I would stay here again.

review.title: Very convenient to Wharf.
review.reviewText: Enjoyed the convenience to the Wharf area. Very nice hotel

review.title: Decent hotel close to Fisherman's Wharf
review.positiveRemarks: The lady at the front desk was very friendly and cheery. The room (2 double suite) was a decent size and comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: The breakfast was not very good; the pre-made eggs and sausage were cold.. may have been due to the fact that the hotel is in the middle of a remodel
review.locationRemarks: Easy walk to Pier 39, etc.

review.title: WALKING DISTANCE TO PIER 39
review.reviewText: We were in town for the Seahawks vs 49ers game and wanted to be able to walk to the Seahawks fans gathering at Pier 39. This location was great and the hotel was very nice and the staff was friendly. We would stay here again.

review.title: Nice hotel in fishermens wharf area
review.reviewText: It's not a luxurious hotel but is clean and good for a comfortable stay.
Great location, nice staff, very helpful, great breakfast. Only complaint would be double beds instead of queens.
review.negativeRemarks: queen beds
review.locationRemarks: three blocks to the wharf. nice to be near the Pier 39 section of the wharf.

review.title: Walking distance from everything.
review.reviewText: Stayed during a moms weekend in the city with my friend. The hotel was within easy walk or public transit to nearly everywhere we wanted to go. Only had to take the car out once because we slept in due to the very comfy beds. Staff was great and helpful. The included breakfast bar was better than expected. Only thing missing was hot chocolate as I don't drink coffee.

review.title: Thin windows and a little noisy hearing the outsid
review.reviewText: Great breakfast but expensive parking over night but good location.
review.positiveRemarks: Breakfast and location were perfect for a family.
review.negativeRemarks: Thicker windows to block the outdoor noise. Otherwise, it was great.

review.title: Nancy's Comments
review.reviewText: Supplies rather cheap - stiff toilet tissue and face tissue. No magnifying mirror. Towels thin and rough. Child next door kept me awake. Would definitely try something different next time.

review.title: Fisherman's Warf yet quickly connect to downtown!
review.reviewText:
Front desk was helpful with information on places to eat and great tips on how to get around!

We arrived two hours before check in and we were immediately granted access to the non-smoking king bed we were promised!

Housekeeping was fantastic and the room was great! The safe was appreciated and lots of quality wood hangers in the closet!

You are two blocks from the wharf with lots of great restaurants and to the "F" electric trolley car that will take you downtown in less than 20 minutes for $2.00. Both cable car routes are within 2-3 blocks as well!

The breakfast buffet was great and never seemed to be overcrowded. The buffet began at 6:30 AM, but it would have been nice if coffee was available starting at 5:00 A.M. for visitors who came from the Eastern Time Zone. (6:30 AM was just too long to wait for the coffee)

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: Wonderful staff, great breakfast, friendly, safe area, two blocks from wharf and public transportation within a block. Roomy and clean.

review.title: Great Fisherman's Wharf location
review.positiveRemarks: Location Rooms were small, very few had views.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking was pretty expensive

review.title: Small rooms, but PERFECT location
review.reviewText: Small rooms, expensive, but not really compared to the other options. Cant say enough about the location. For business or vacation, no better location to stay in SF.
review.negativeRemarks: Better pillows! They really where horrible pillows.
review.locationRemarks: Everything.

review.title: Hotel in Great Fisherman's Wharf Location
review.reviewText:
The hotel is in a nice location a couple of blocks from the main Fisherman's Wharf areas. This is our 2nd time staying there and we did notice the room was a little dirty feeling. Carpet needed cleaning, shower needs caulk and showed some mold. Breakfast was very good and always very busy. Hours are 6:30 AM to 9:30 AM for breakfast which made it tough on some days to get down in time for the breakfast after being out late the night before.
All-in-all, the hotel is fine. Typical high priced per night in downtown SF.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and breakfast. Reasonably clean overall even though rooms a bit dirty.
review.negativeRemarks: Clean the hotel room carpets.
review.locationRemarks: Great location near Fisherman's Wharf attractions and restaurants. Easy to walk to the bay.

review.title: Dirty hotel with no good parking
review.reviewText: When my family first arrived we were told that the parking lot was full for larger cars and then were unhelpful about finding a lot for our car! We then went to our room that was dusty and looked like it had not been cleaned for a week! The toilet did not work well and required flushing four times to flush any amount of toilet paper! When we brought this to the hotel staff they said they were out of King bed rooms and acted like they really could care less! That night when we took a shower we found that all of our bottles of hotel amenities were half used and had someone else's hair stuck to them! How disgusting!! Do not use this hotel it is unsanitary and the hotel staff are unhelpful and uncaring!!! The next morning we arrived for breakfast thinking this must be the best part of the stay but were greeted by no supplies, no seating, and a long line! There was no edible food by the time we got to the food, except for a bannana! The juice was even watered down and disgusting!! Worst hotel stay ever!!

review.title: Hotel was good
review.reviewText: The location was good for restaurants, site seeing and shopping.

review.title: weekend in san francisco
review.reviewText: I found the location to be ideal for getting around and seeing the city. the staff was very accomodting and helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: location, location, location and the staff
review.locationRemarks: The location was very close to the fishermans wharf and transportation

review.title: perfect location for sight seeing
review.reviewText: great knowledgeable front desk staff. perfect location for the pier and various other sight seeing destinations.

review.title: close to everything
review.reviewText: We were here non vacation and enjoyed it. Near the warf's, golden gate and oter attactions.
review.negativeRemarks: n/a

review.title: Great location, value, and free breakfast/wifi.
review.reviewText: 2 blocks from Fisherman's Wharf, bar across street, coffee shop next door, and taxi stop right across the street. The room was comfortable and quiet with plenty of hot water and pressure in the shower. The bed was comfy and even offered the choice of both soft and firm pillows. The staff was friendly and allowed us to check in early since we arrived in SF before lunch. The breakfast was better than most with two choices of eggs, Greek yogurt, fruit, cereal, pancakes, biscuits and gravy, cinnamon rolls, turkey sausage, bacon, etc.
review.negativeRemarks: Stronger wifi signal.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Very convenient location. Close to transportation and restaurants.
Bed not comfortable at all.

review.title: great time great hotel
review.reviewText: We were able to get right into a room on arrival . The room and staff were excellent . I would recommend this hotel not only for itself but also for the location. If we make a return visit we wi8ll most definitely stay here
review.positiveRemarks: Cleanliness , location and a very nice breakfast
review.negativeRemarks: nothing

review.reviewText:
Hotel location was really good. Just a couple of blocks from Fisherman's Wharf & Pier 39.
Would have been nice to have queen beds instead of doubles, but evidently the hotel doesn't offer that. We were given an upgrade to a Jr. suite, but the room was still the size of a regular hotel room with a couch stuck in front of the window.
Room was clean, but air condition wasn't cooling well the majority of the stay and the movie network wasn't working. The hotel did however eventually get that fixed and gave a free movie coupon.
Free breakfast was good.

review.title: Great location on Fisherman's wharf
review.reviewText: We had not planned on renting a car in the city and therefore having tours, and sites so accessible was wonderful! We walked to many restaurants and utilized a tour bus. I will say weekends are busy and crowded in that area but so much fun. We enjoyed the breakfast buffet - great variety of breakfast food. The front desk was also very helpful and having a spot to access boarding passes for our flight home all GREAT. Thank you Holiday Inn Express.
review.negativeRemarks: Hand lotion in rooms would have been nice..
review.locationRemarks: The location was great, close to tour bus companies, pier 39, Italian section, Chinatown, Cable car, The Wharf, etc.

review.title: Convenient Location at Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: This hotel was very convenient to the wharf. The rooms were no frill, but were comfortable enough. The breakfast offered in the morning was great. More than I expected.

review.title: Nice stay
review.reviewText: Excellent! Would stay again! Whole family and friends had a good experience

review.title: Good location and breakfast
review.reviewText:
Was in the area to sightsee for 3 days so this was a good landing pad for us. Too pricey for what we got for sure, but served its purpose.
Close enough to the action without being in it. Safe neighborhood and walking distance to the wharf.
review.positiveRemarks: Breakfast was good. The room was ok, nice size little dated
review.locationRemarks: Hop on hop off open top tour bus, pier 39 where the sea lions are, the Franciscan Crab restaurant was good. Stay away from Allioto's, just bad.

review.title: Price too high for size of room
review.reviewText: Extremely small room for the price. Expected a lot more from a Holiday Inn.

review.title: Nice hotel close to everything
review.reviewText: Good breakfast. Everything within walking distance. Friendly staff.

review.title: Our 3 most important requirements......
review.reviewText:
Hotel was clean
Free Breakfast
Free Wifi

A good location, although there were many hotels in the area.

Not a luxury hotel, but the items listed above are much more important to me. Good value for the price, and no nickel&dime-ing guests with additional charges at every possible opportunity.
review.locationRemarks: Very handy to Fisherman's Wharf and close to the hop-on/hop-off bus terminal that we used.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: Without a doubt we would book this hotel again! Great location - walking distance to many of the things we had planned for our trip.
review.locationRemarks: The location to Pier 39 was fantastic!! Great walking distance to many tourist spots!

review.title: Nice hotel to stay at in San Francisco.
review.reviewText: Stayed for two nights with friends. Saw USA win the race.
review.positiveRemarks: Location was good for walking to Fisherman's Wharf and some restaurants. Friendly and helpful staff.

review.title: Holliday Inn Express
review.reviewText: Nice Hotel very good location, close to everywhere. Staff very helpful. Breafast was great.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything was good.
review.locationRemarks: Was close by all tourist attractions.

review.title: Great location near Embarcadero
review.reviewText: I was very pleased with the overall experience. I wish the rate was a bit lower but I think it was high due to the America's Cup being there. I did not stay there more than one night due to the price but for the one night I was there, I have no complaints. Location was great. I walked everywhere!
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was very nice. I was even given a complimentary bottle of water because she signed me up as a Holiday Inn member.
review.locationRemarks: Pier 39, walk the embarcadero and along the water, Alcatraz

review.title: Nice and tidy staff very friendly
review.reviewText: Great location easy walk to pier 39 would recommend.The only downfall was it didn't have fridge in the room which would of been handy.

review.title: Nice hotel, but no wireless internet in room
review.reviewText: We loved the location! The room was clean and comfortable and the only drawback was no wifi and no phone reception on Sprint and Verizon. Had to go down to the lobby to connect. They did have wired internet in the room. Everything else was great.
review.negativeRemarks: Need wifi in rooms

review.title: Central Fishermans Wharf. Two blocks back.
review.reviewText:
Good location. We had a mini suite. Stayed 10 days to watch the Americas Cup racing.
Really quite expensive for what it was.
review.positiveRemarks: W liked the location ad cleanliness. It had been recently refurbished, new carpet etc. Room size was good bit that was what we paid for.
review.negativeRemarks: No concierge or luggage to room service. No day rooms or facilities on checkout when you are on a late flight. Breakfast area inadequate.
review.locationRemarks: San Francisco Fisherman Wharf area, restaurants and tourists sights. Also close to Marina Precinct for locals restaurants. Cable cars etc.

review.title: Good rooms, well located
review.reviewText: This hotel was fine for a short stay in a fantastic location near Fisherman's Wharf. The hotel is clean and modern, and the staff was quite friendly and helpful. Our major complaint was the meager amount of bedding in the room - very thin and short - especially for such a chilly city.
review.negativeRemarks: Better (and warmer) bedding.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Pretty much as expected after reading other reviews. We had top floor room overlooking courtyard. Very quiet and the room was clean and the bed comfortable.Staff were friendly and helpful and booked us a return trip to the airport as we were badly let down by Super Shuttle when we arrived at Oakland. Breakfast was a busy time but there was plenty of choice.Good location for Fishermans Wharf and for the cable car to Union Square. Bike hire shop next door.Computer for printing out boarding passes too.As city hotels go, it was fine.Really only used for sleeping in.
review.positiveRemarks: Liked the location and thought it was good value for a city hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: New carpets perhaps on the landings
review.locationRemarks: Convenient for all the shops and restaurants at Fish Alley and Pier 39 and the ice cream at Ghirardelli Square.

review.title: Close to Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: We only had a day in San Fran and had booked to go to Alcatraz. It was the week of the America's Cup and we were 3 adults. This hotel offered us a mini suite so we had a microwave and fridge and 2 double beds. We were close enough to walk everywhere. Since our last stay they now have wifi in the rooms and it worked really well.
review.positiveRemarks: Proximity to Fisherman's Wharf and WiFi in the room
review.locationRemarks: Plenty of eating places close by - take out or eat in. Location, location, location.

review.title: hotel review
review.reviewText: Wi-Fi in lobby only, breakfast is lukewarm, tv channel choices are minimal. That was the bad. Location is the best.
review.negativeRemarks: Wi-Fi, breakfast temperature increased, increase choices for tv stations

review.title: Great Location!
review.reviewText: The hotel was wonderful, very helpful staff and well maintained. It is very expensive to stay near Fisherman's Wharf, but the hotel did not disappoint. We had a very nice room, we were checked in very quickly and the valet pulled our car out for us quickly. I would stay here again if I need to be right by the Wharf.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance of the Wharf and Ghiradelli Square.

review.title: Close to the Wharf
review.reviewText: I recently stayed here for Labor Day Holiday week and had a wonderful room. My room had a mini fridge and mini microwave which were very useful for leftovers. My only complaint was that the vending machine was constantly out of bottled water and I did not know until my last day that I could ask for free bottled water at the front desk.
review.negativeRemarks: Let people know they can get bottled water at the front desk.
review.locationRemarks: Easy walk to Piers 45 to 39, streetcar and taxis.

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: Overall excellent experience. Great location, close to wharf, buses, trolley and BART! Lots of great bars and restaurants all within walking distance. Hotel is clean, rooms are plenty big enough. Found staff to be helpful, friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: Wifi in rooms. This was a disappointment
review.locationRemarks: Close to wharf area and local transit.

review.title: "I left my heart....in San Francisco"
review.reviewText: This was our second time staying at the Holiday Inn Express. We have been very satisfied each time. It was Labor Day weekend and with America's Cup the city was very crowded with visitor - which means the hotel was full too. I'm pretty high maintenance so when the door hinge squeaked and the closet slider was off the track (even though I wasn't using it), I called the desk. Someone came up within 10 minutes and fixed the situation. The next day I had a weak battery in my TV remote so I called. Again, 5 minutes and a staff member was there to fix the issue. The room was quite comfortable and the location is great. We will come again.
review.negativeRemarks: The breatfast was good but the same each day. Maybe mix it up a bit.
review.locationRemarks: Everything is within walking distance or a Muni bus ride. Don't rent a car!

review.title: Last minute trip to SFO
review.reviewText: We were able to check in early, had a great room, clean and bright. Staff was very helpful and friendly. Lobby area was very open and attractive. Only a block from Fisherman's Wharf. Couldn't be happier with the room and location.

review.title: Great hotel on fishermans wharf
review.reviewText: Awesome time in San Francisco.rented bikes rode across golden bate to saulsilito ( a must do) ate at scomas ,took ferry back . Took taxi to Chinatown got massages, then ate in little Italy walked back to wharf. Hit ghiradellas for a really spectacular chocolate shake yum .
review.positiveRemarks: Great location, good breakfast , nice place for a great price
review.locationRemarks: Bike rentals right next door , super convienent

review.title: Poor
review.reviewText: Poor hotel could do with more facilities and better eating rooms
review.negativeRemarks: Buffet breakfast and eating off plastic plates

review.title: Good location bad ammenaties
review.reviewText: Our hotel room was tiny. It was about as big as my college dorm room. Also parking was over priced and should be included with the cost of the hotel in my opinion. The work out room was horrible. It included only cardio machines. Why would I run on a treadmill if I could run outside?! There should have been weights, etc. Finally the breakfast was less than tasty. Hard and dry English muffins, oatmeal would run out if you didn't get there right at 630a, meat that didn't taste or look like meat, and dry pastries were on the daily menu. I would not return.
review.negativeRemarks: Fitness center, breakfast, and parking.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's wharf

review.title: Wouldn't return, expensive, not value for money
review.reviewText:
During a 3 week stay travelling around California, we stayed at the Holiday Inn for 4 nights. It was the most expensive hotel per night we stayed in, and we stayed in some lovely hotels including a very very famous one in Vegas, it was without doubt the most disappointing. Firstly the positives.
The location was good for most things in San Fran, 5 mins walk from Fisherman's Wharf.
The room was clean and adequate.
The negatives.
Breakfast was awful, poor quality food and a fight to get your food and a table every morning, started the day badly.
The parking was by far the most expensive during our 3 week stay, it was $45 per night!
All you got for your money was the basic room, nothing extra like pool or other facilities, I was also disturbed to see homeless people hanging around the hotel each day when we left in The morning and when we returned in the evening, I think the hotel should discourage this. Out of 8 hotels we stayed in during our 3 week stay this is the only one I wouldn't recommend or return to.
review.negativeRemarks: Price, basic amenities, breakfast!

review.title: Close to Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: This was the first time we stayed at this hotel and were very happy to find it was so close to Fisherman's Wharf and great restaurants. Everything was within walking distance.
review.positiveRemarks: Its proximity to restaurants and the Wharf
review.negativeRemarks: When we checked in the parking facility was full so we had to park at another parking structure. It wasn't but a block away and was actually cheaper.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf is an easy walk from the hotel. Great restaurants all around.

review.title: Check Parking Prices
review.reviewText:
There's a new way for hotels to offer you a lower price accomodation and then tag you with fees. Parking. It happened twice while in the San Fran area. This hotel charges a hefty 45 dollars for you to park your car with them. Check down the street if you have a car with you. Their (hotel) parking rates are astronomical.

It's a less expensive hotel, so as I should have expected, not all of the guests were as courteous as I'd have liked. Children playing in the elevators and running them up and down floors and I was woken up at 3:00am with people yelling in the hallway.

The staff were polite and responsive to the yelling when I called. There seemed no point in saying anything about the kids playing in the elevators - that's a parental issue. The staff were always polite and it was clean. If staying in the area again I would be more inclined to pay for a more expensive hotel. The 45 for parking per day put the bill right up rates of other places nearby.

Breakfast was a pleasant suprise. It was much better than a tiny day old pastry and coffee. It was a realsonably nice spread - but there was a sign that seemed to indicate that this was some sort of trial.

Overall, not horrible, but for the price and considering the extra charges, I plan to stay elsewhere the next time I am in town. Internet functioned and was free.
review.positiveRemarks: failry, clean. Nice breakfast ok location
review.negativeRemarks: a little more security to deal with the riff raff guests reduce or eliminate the $45 parking fee
review.locationRemarks: San Francisco - the whole city. Walking distance to pier 39, the crookest street and the tourist cable cars. Tons of good restaurants, etc....

review.title: Nice hotel close to the wharf.
review.reviewText: We have stayed at this hotel many times. Excellent breakfast buffet. The location is great and close to the wharf. Car rental location across the street.
review.positiveRemarks: Location is great and you are in the middle of the wharf area. All of the tourist attractions are located around the wharf area.
review.negativeRemarks: The beds are hard as a rock. This is the only negative factor for us on this hotel.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great location, Rooms need to be UPDATED, Great Staff very friendly and helpful
review.negativeRemarks: Update rooms
review.locationRemarks: ! block from water front and shopping

review.title: Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText: We liked the location which allowed us to walk to many of the places we visited and had our meals, thus not having to fight the traffic and figure out parking.

review.title: Good location but not worth the money.

Bad part is the hotel needs some work, no wireless in the room so lobby full of people trying to use the wireless, rooms okay but need some upgrades, old TVs, small bathrooms. Lady at check in not friendly at all but rest of the staff was helpful.

review.title: Really nice hotel

review.title: Near Fisherman's Wharf

review.locationRemarks: Near Fisherman's Wharf and walking distance to Little Italy and Chinatown

review.title: Good location.

The hotel was in an excellent location,the breakfast buffet was just okay,the food temperature was not tolerable,and the serving line locatiion caused alot of conjestion.
The front desk staff,and housekeeping staff were very attentive.
review.negativeRemarks: Take the tables out of the area where the breakfast buffet line is.

review.title: Good location to wharf

review.title: Close to all things to do

review.negativeRemarks: for us it was perfect

There was no WiFi in the room, you had to go down to the lobby! There was no shuttle (I had a handicap person), we had to walk with all our luggage to the Amtrak bus stop with a handicapped individual. VERY DISAPPOINTING FOR $300/NIGHT?!!!

review.title: It was all just great!

review.title: Internet access

review.negativeRemarks: No WI FI in rooms

review.title: 100% satified!

review.positiveRemarks: It's very close to the wharf.

review.title: Good Value for Money

Free wifi was available in the lobby and breakfast was included in the tariff. Whilst no laundry was available on-site we were able to use the Holiday Inn next door which was more than adequate. Due to a plane crash at SFO we had to stay another 2 nights and we were more than happy to extend our stay at the hotel.

review.title: pricey but convenient

no room wireless internet. WHAT IS THI 19190?
sPEND THE $ AND JUST GET IT DONE LIKE EVERYONE ESLE DOES.

review.title: Great base to explore San Francisco
review.reviewText:
Really good hotel to use as a base to explore San Francisco.

The rooms were a decent size, clean and comfortable. We didn't have any issues throughout our stay.

The complimentary breakfast was really good with a good choice of food and drink. Although pretty busy at peak times we never struggled to get a table.

Free Wi-Fi is available in the lobby, its a shame its not available in the rooms.

If you stay here make sure you venture out of touristy Fisherman's Wharf!
review.positiveRemarks: Complimentary breakfast, room comfort, free Wi-Fi
review.negativeRemarks: N/A
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf is a good base to explore the Golden Gate Bridge and Alcatraz. The hotel isn't far from cable car/tram stops.

review.title: Nice hotel,
review.reviewText: Over all good room and the staff was very nice. The breakfast is ok, but the close the door's right at 930am so don't be late. the toilets are very small so if your a tall person you got a long way to sit. The rooms are a little small but we were there only to sleep. But it was nice.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff was very nice and the hotel and rooms were clean.
review.negativeRemarks: the toilet are very small, made for children

review.title: Close to tour buses, wharf and restaurants
review.reviewText: Something for everyone at the complimentary breakfast. There was plenty of food for everyone.

review.title: Wonderful stay.
review.reviewText: My mother and I had a wonderful experience and would recommend it. Close to Fisherman's Wharf. The staff was very friendly and always willing to help. We showed up around 9 in the morning and even though check-in was not until 3 pm they stored our luggage for us.
review.negativeRemarks: The pillows. They were ok.

review.title: great location,very firm bed, expensive hotel

The "breakfast buffet" was a lot of starch mostly bread, tastlist scrambled eggs, but the coffee was good The bed was very firm, no pillowtop. The room was very simple, small and clean. We could hear every single time the toilet was flushed from both sides of our room. Very expensive hotel for what you get.
review.negativeRemarks: need comfortable beds and friendlier front staff

review.title: Great location, staff, and close to shops, food...
review.reviewText: Great hotel. Staff helpful and friendly. Clean and close to shops, food and fishermans wharf as well as places to book tours etc.....
review.positiveRemarks: Staff helpful and friendly. Selection of pillows in bedroom; soft, medium, hard!!!

review.title: Close to Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Staff was nice, the room was marginal, Clean but needed to be updated. TV's the old tube style. Rooms did not have wifi as advertised, only the lobby area had it. Breakfast was very marginal; coffee sucked, juice was watered down.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText:
Our second stay with this hotel.

review.title: Cost effective San Fransisco

review.title: Nice stay

review.title: San Fran trip
review.reviewText: Everything was fine until we went to leave. The valet had a terrible attitude, He got our car, tossed us the keys and walked away. Just a lousy way to see guests off after everyone else had been so wonderful. Did not even offer to help with our bags. Was astonished by his attitude and actions.

review.title: Average hotel in a great location
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a great location just a few blocks from Fisherman's Wharf. The room was average but nice and clean. Breakfast was fine, although if you stay on a weekend, keep in mind that breakfast will be VERY busy and packed with tourists, including some small children. I checked on a Saturday morning but they let me keep my things in a locked closet so I could visit Pier 39 for a few hours before departing. That was a big plus.
review.negativeRemarks: very busy

review.title: Good location for tourists
review.reviewText: This hotel is pretty much in line with what you'd expect from a Holiday Inn Express. The lobby and rooms are clean, well maintained, and fairly new looking. The free breakfast is somewhat sparse, but adequate: pastries, muffins, bagels, fruit, yogurt, and a few hot items such as biscuits, gravy, a pancake maker, and "omelettes." There is also free internet: wired in the rooms and wireless in the lobby. The location is also good if you're a tourist, although be prepared to pay the valet parking fee (with in-and-out privileges). Parking is expensive, but it's comparable to other hotels in the area.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking fee, no wireless in rooms
review.locationRemarks: Very touristy

thank you for making our trip one to be remembered, and we plan to take the whole family in july , we felt welcomed.

review.title: Good hotel for a traveler
review.reviewText: The hotel is much as it presents itself. Clean, good basic value for cost, well located. It provides what is needed for a good night's rest and a bit of breakfast to start the day. The reception counter people were friendly and helpful. Possibly a bit pricey. The nearby Holiday Inn is less expensive and a bit more plush but no free breakfast. You take your choice.

review.title: Hotel was disappointing
review.reviewText: Arriving from out of town and looking forward to staying near the water, the hotel was hard to find, it looked good on the "computer", but the inside was uninviting and the room was tiny with a horrible view outside. I have stayed at other Holiday Inns, but from now on I will be more careful.

review.title: Nice hotel with friendly staff
review.reviewText: Met all expectations and has good proximity to the wharf, and trolley/bus routes. Would stay here again.

review.title: A Great Stay
review.reviewText:
We found this hotel ideal for our purposes as a stop-over stay from Auckland, New Zealand through to London. It was conveniently placed in Fisherman's Wharf with just a comfortable stroll down to Pier 39 with its attractions, restaurants and cafes and all the other waterfront action. It was also an easy walk from there to the cable car terminus, giving easy access to Chinatown and Union Square. It was also just a short walk to the nearby supermarket and so, together with the excellent complimentary breakfast, we were able to dine cheaply in our room, for most of our stay, in order to minimise our costs.
Personnel behind the Reception Desk were friendly and helpful and readily agreed to a late check-out, enabling us to take our late flight to London with minimum hanging around.
The hotel is good on the eye but is not over provided with expensive glitter. We were able to move our own bags without being propositioned and without feeling guilty, which is what we like, due to being from a country where tipping is not obligitory and because we are keen to help ourselves and save hard earned cash. We certainly recommend this hotel and it would be our first preference next time we stay in S F.
review.negativeRemarks: Coffee making equipment and sachets located in the toilet and no soap dish.
review.locationRemarks: The location is superb as described in my review above.

review.title: Holiday Inn Express - Fisherman's wharf
review.reviewText:
We were a little bit worried when we read some of the reviews complaining about noise from the street. Well, those reviews must have been about the Holiday Inn next door and not about the Holiday Inn Express where we stayed at. The only potentially noisy rooms are on the street front; the others all face small inside courtyards - no views but very quiet.
The hotel is clean, well kept and we could check in well before 3 PM. The breakfast is average, but satifying, perhaps more fresh fruit could be provided - there were only bananas available. The coffee is hot and there is a fresh juice machine, pancake maker, toaster etc. The room is average, but clean; the TV needs updating (no flat screen TV or digital channels) but we did not watch it too much anyway. We booked a King room and the bed was comfortable. The bathroom is clean and we had plenty of towels. Also, there was airconditioning in the room, so no worries about being too hot in the room.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location, easy access to everything
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing negative to mention
review.locationRemarks: Great location - close to a lot of the attractions or to the bus/cable car.

review.title: Great San Francisco hotel

review.title: Good for the Price
review.reviewText: Location is everything. It's near Fisherman's Wharf, the turnarounds for the cable cars, and many good restaurants. It's relatively cheap compared to others in the area and it is decently clean and quiet. No room WiFi is a pain but you can connect in the lobby. The front desk people are polite and helpful but were clueless about greater SF. For a clean place to sleep while on a tourist visit to SF, you can't beat the price.

review.title: Great Stay in San Francisco

There was no refridgerator in the room, we asked for one and within 15 minutes we received it, no problems. The staff is pleasant and helpful. The only very minor issue was the gravy at breakfast, for the biscuts/gravy was sometimes not as hot as it might be. Breakfast was good and people moved through nicely. Overall, we were pleased with our stay here and would not hesitate to stay here again.

review.title: Great for Rock 'n' Roll San Francisco Half-Maratho
review.reviewText: Booked this room for my stay during the Rock 'n' Roll San Francisco Half-Marathon and it was amazing! The hotel was located within walking distance to every public transportation we needed. Also another plus was being close by an In-N-Out. The room was great and the hotel was well kept. The staff even let us check out late without incurring a fee. This gave me ample time to finish up my race and get back to the hotel for a relaxing shower. The price of the parking fee is high, $45 per night PLUS tax, so that pushed the nightly rate to about $200... The TV selection was really limited but it had HBO, all local and ESPN/2/News/CL so it was good enough. The great location and modern look to it were well worth the price.

Hotel has wifi in the lobby and internet cable in the rooms. There are two public computers hooked up to a printer and a separate computer dedicated to printing out boarding passes.

Breakfast is OK - and available from 06:30 - 09:30.

Our stay was relatively quiet. There were some people picketing outside out hotel at 7am, but the staff were great and moved us to another room at the back of the hotel. Staff were really friendly and helpful.

This hotel has everything I look for in a hotel (it would be even better if I could get wifi in the room) but I would definitely stay here again.

We stayed here last year. We had a great view, which included alcatraz. We wanted to stay there again so we returned a week ago. We were hoping for the same or similar room. When we cheked in we got a room which faced the courtyard as it was called. A look out the window revealed nothing but inner walls and windows of other rooms. We went to front desk and asked to be moved. The guy said to come back the next morning which we did after a very good hot breakfast.
The lady (B) was very helpful and found us an outside north room. this was much appreciated and helped make our stay even better.
I would stay there again but not in one of those inside rooms.
The breakfast was a great start each morning.
Hotel was clean and the location very good.

review.reviewText: You can get better. Traveled with 87yr grandmother and 12yr son. They provided no help... with luggage, arranging transportation (taxi/cab service), general customer service. I asked for help seting up taxi service to and from a dinner reservation. I was told to go flag a cab out front.. Had to off load and load up all our luggage to/from car by myself (girl power). Tipping didn't help.. Yikes. Last time we were in town we stayed at the Hilton, a little more each night, but got help with all of the above with little effort on our side.. Would not stay again.
