review.title: Great location, busy hotel, needs updating
review.reviewText:
We chose a Holiday Inn Express from favorable past experiences in other towns. The Express hotels include continental breakfast. The breakfast area was jam packed with people. After the first morning, we tried the Hollywood cafe just down the street. It was great.

Our king bed room was by far the smallest I have seen a H.I. hotel. Overall, room was ready updating. The bathroom had noticeable wear. The TV was an old CRT and had very few channels. We spent most of the 3 night trip sightseeing, so it wasn't a huge disappointment. On the plus side, everything worked.

The room doors shut very loudly. We were woken up in the morning to neighbor guests leaving. There was no way to shut the door quietly. The cleaning crew came to our door at 8:30AM on the first day.

Location is the biggest benefit to this hotel. It was a short walk to Ghirardelli Square and cable car terminal. We were near end of the F-Market and Wharves streetcar line.

The front desk suggested a town car service to take us back to the SFO airport. I would highly recommend this instead of using a taxi. The price is within a few dollars and the quality of service is substantially better. As with any hotels in SF, parking is not free.

There is a pool, but it is outdoors. The exercise room included a few treadmills, ellipticals, and stair climber.

Overall, this hotel was decent for our vacation in SF. From past experience w/ H.I., we came in expecting a little nicer condition and amenities, but we were satisfied.

I'll definitely stay here again when I get another opportunity to visit this wonderful city.

review.title: Go to the Hyatt across the street, same price!
review.reviewText: The quality of service was poor, the first room we were given was tiny and smelled like stale body odor. The breakfast tasted like it was made of 100% recycled cardboard, and the slavering hordes of people cramming in to the small area to get at it made the breakfast experience all the more painful. The service staff kept trying to push us out of the room so they could clean it. There is NO WIRELESS IN THE ROOMS, only in the lobby. The fee for parking is exhorbitant, though despite charging almost as much to keep the car as to keep us, the attendant refused to get the car up with advanced notice and would only get the car when we were wanting to leave, making us wait 5 minutes while he got the thing (as opposed to 5 minutes earlier when I tried to call to ask it to be brought up). This hotel cares nothing about the customer, only shoving people through the pipeline. If I hadn't prepaid for this hotel though expedia I would have walked out and gone to any of the 4 other hotels within spitting distance after the first 15 minutes.

review.title: great hotel for a long holiday

review.locationRemarks: location is fantastic

review.title: Great place to stay with breakfast included.
review.reviewText: Location was fantastic-three blocks away from the waterfront and a wide variety of restaurants. Breakfast buffet was very convenient. Could have had more choices of fruit (only bananas available). I found a plastic up under the bed skirt from a previous guest. The room was very clean other than this stray cup. Staff was fast and efficient.

review.title: San Francisco December 2012
review.reviewText: Great hotel and location! Within walking distance of Fisherman's Wharf and surrounding area. The complimentary breakfast was also very good. One less meal to worry about during the day! We really enjoyed our stay and would recommend this hotel and location to others. We had a great time in San Francisco!
review.positiveRemarks: location, complimentary breakfast and fast and free high speed internet in our room
review.negativeRemarks: some street noise
review.locationRemarks: GREAT! Close to Fisherman's Wharf and surrounding area. We walked to most of the sites and did not rent a car. We also took the trolley or cable car.

review.title: Great for family
review.reviewText: Room size is great, bigger than expected. Breakfast serving is good, keep refilling. There is no view and each room's window are facing each other. Cannot open blinds.
review.negativeRemarks: View from window
review.locationRemarks: Great location. Walking distance to cable car station

review.title: Great location!!!
review.reviewText:
A couple of people has recommending this hotel and location for my first trip to San Francisco.

The location was good - two blocks from the Wharf and around the corner to the transit stop.

An unlimited transit pass was really helpful to get around the city,

The hotel was busy, as I was there during the Christmas holidays. The room was fine, there was lots to eat for Breakfast, and the location was good.

The close proximity to the Wharf, Pier 39 and tranist made this a great place to stay.

review.title: Great hotel for tourists!
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a great location! Close to all buses/trolleys etc. Close to shops, fisherman's wharf pier 39 etc! Do not need a car when staying here. The only downfall is that our room was at the back of the hotel so starting early in the morning you could hear the trolleys and buses very loudly go by. But the room is very clean, everyone is very nice there! Definite good hotel for a tourist looking to be nearby to everything!
review.negativeRemarks: noise in the morning
review.locationRemarks: perfect for foot travelers!

review.title: Great location. Lots of families touring.
review.reviewText: This is a good place to stay if you target the Fisherman's Wharf or Pier 39. The hotel includes a good and stable "wired" Internet at the room and wireless at the reception. If you plan to use a Notebook and Tablets and/or Smartphones make sure you are able to share the Internet from your notebook with the other devices. I didn't manage to do so with my Ipad and Iphone. Bringing your own router may not help because the conection with the network requires a confirmation/acceptance thru a browser. Other than that the location is excellent and have convenience stores nearby.
review.negativeRemarks: Not having wireless at the room
review.locationRemarks: Very good location virtually attached to the Fisherman's Wharf. A taxi to downtown runs about US$ 12. Cable cars available within a short walk.

review.title: The "whole package," but leave your car behind
review.reviewText: This Holiday Inn Express is the whole package: quiet, well appointed rooms; friendly staff; good free breakfast; great location; and gracious corridors and open areas. The only improvements that I could see would be quieter bathroom fans and less expensive parking (currently $45/day). Better to leave your car behind since you really don't need it here.

review.title: Great hotel for an affordable price
review.reviewText: This is a great hotel. Prime location to the wharf & North Beach.

review.title: Great hotel for tourists
review.reviewText: Perfect location. Great and real breakfast. Very clean and quiet hotel. I strongly recommended this hotel for guests of San-Francisco. Especially for fans of seafood and bay.
review.negativeRemarks: Wi-Fi
review.locationRemarks: Very convenient for tourists

review.title: Enjoyable and comfortable stay
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay - the staff were very courteous and the location was excellent
review.positiveRemarks:
ease of check in and check out
comfortable bed
quiet - sufficiently thick walls
review.negativeRemarks: not much choice for breakfast for vegetarians or vegans; have some soy milk and other options for hot breakfast for those who don't eat meat and dairy
review.locationRemarks: fantastic location for easily walking to sites on the waterfront, the maritime museum, Ghiradelli square etc.

review.title: Great for familys
review.reviewText: The staff was super accommodating and helpful we had a great experience! Great continental breakfast!
review.locationRemarks: Great spot close to fishermans warf and bus stop right in front

review.title: great hotel
review.reviewText: very clean - great location- good breakfast- would stay there again, and will

review.title: Fine hotel at Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Stayed there two nights in mid-Dec 2012, with two adults and two young children. Great location (Fisherman's Wharf, two street cars, and the historic trolley line are all right there). The room was fine (clean, quiet, not smoky), and as advertised, but nothing special. Front desk staff were friendly and efficient. We were checked-in hours before the official check-in time (11AM), and got a late checkout (2 PM) without incident. Free breakfast was surprisingly good. Not your usual inedible danishes and coffee, but a full spread, including eggs, bacon, freshly made pancakes, edible danishes, etc. I appreciated that parking was unbundled, so I didn't have to pay for that service when traveling without a car (but it's not cheap if you have one). One drawback is that few of the rooms have a view, with many rooms looking out on nondescript interior courtyards.
review.negativeRemarks: No View

review.title: San Francisco Holiday Inn Express
review.reviewText: The hotel has had an upgrade in the last 4 years because we stayed there in 2009 and there were definite improvements. The parking at $51.34 a night is over the top. There is parking available one street over at $35.00 a night. The breakfast was fast food quality but there was plenty of choice. We arrived early (noon) and they gave us a room right away. It was December, so not busy. Room was clean and the bathroom had a new curtain, and a new large overhead shower. Also there are luggage carts in the hallway and downstairs in the lobby that you can use to haul your belongings up and down. 2 streets down was the trolley and a ticket office where we purchased a 3 day ticket for $14. It was good for all buses, trams and trolleys but not the underground metro.

review.title: Great place, great location, great staff
review.reviewText: We had a great stay at Holiday Inn, perfect location. breakfast was all we needed, staff were always helpful, would recomend to all.

review.title: Holiday Inn Express Fisherman's wharf
review.reviewText: Hotel was very comfortable and well maintained. Breakfast was included and had good choices. Room was comfortable enough but maybe just a little bit on the small size for a family of 4 but manageable. We could walk to the piers and fisherman's wharf within a 5 minute period. I would recommend this hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Maybe room size
review.locationRemarks: Great, close to shops and restaurants

review.title: Excellent location & rooms, pity about breakfast
review.reviewText: Room was clean and very comfortable. Excellent location. Breakfast was very crowded and poorly organised. Same 4 basic food items on each day Why do dozens of people stand around the toaster, pancake maker etc blocking everyone elses access???
review.negativeRemarks: Feeding time at the zoo for breakfast!!!
review.locationRemarks: Excellent.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Very handy location in Fishermans Wharf about halfway between Pier 39 and Ghiradelli Square and easy to get public transport around the city.
review.negativeRemarks: No bar in the hotel

review.title: San Francisco Fun

review.negativeRemarks: Eggs at the breakfast but hey it was than nothing

review.title: Great Hotel: Clean and wonderful location!
review.reviewText: Hotel was very clean and the staff excellent! And the hotel location at Fishman's Wharf was right in the middle of everything. I would definitely stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: This hotel is extremely clean and very quiet.
review.negativeRemarks: I did not like the squatty toilets...you can almost touch the water everytime you use it!
review.locationRemarks: This hotel is in a excellent location...easy access to everything.

review.title: Great hotel for all!
review.reviewText: The location was great. It was really nice to be able to walk to all of the sights and/or jump on a bus right up the block. We were traveling with a group of 6 and really enjoyed meeting downstairs for breakfast together before heading out on our adventures for the day. Everything that we needed, we were provided by the friendly staff.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect for the traveler.

review.title: Cheap and not so cheerful
review.reviewText:
Staff were rude and unhelpful, breakfast was a free for all, messy and unappetising
Location was great and it was cheaper than other hotels around

review.title: Very enjoyable stay
review.reviewText: The hotel was in a convenient location and clean and quiet. The staff were very helpful and polite. The free breakfast was very good with a good variety it items, the only thing I would suggest is that breakfast goes until 10am instead of 930am - when on vacation it is nice to not have to rush. The only downside of the room was they were double beds not queen size, so not as much space for four people.

review.title: Good hotel
review.reviewText: Location was good. Breakfast was ok. 45 dollar parking fee is ridiculous. You can park in lot across street for cheaper.
review.negativeRemarks: 45 parking fee

review.title: Not bad, but room for improvement
review.reviewText:
The location of the hotel is handy if you want to be based in Fisherman's Wharf. There are plenty of restaurants and attractions nearby.

The staff were helpful, but I found some things about the room a little disappointing for what we paid. Firstly, there were mould spots in the shower and the tap leaked. I brought this up with reception and they apologised and did address this.

As my partner fell il, she spent a fair bit of time in the room recovering. The location of our room was beside the tram tracks, which was very noisy and made it difficult to sleep. The tv channel selection and tv were a little limited and dated. The wireless they advertised was only in the lobby and not in the rooms like other comparable hotels offer.

If you have a car, be aware that it is valet parking only and $45+tax per night. This was a cost we were unaware about. However, the valet service was very good and included as many ins and outs as you required.

The gym was limited, but the breakfast buffet was included

Overall, I found the Holiday Inn Express good, but would probably use Hampton Inn going forward, who offer a more comprehensive experience and cleaner rooms.
review.positiveRemarks: The breakfast offered was very good. great variety and friendly service.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness
review.locationRemarks: Handy to Fishermans Wharf and trams into other parts of San Fran.

review.title: Recommended.
review.reviewText:
We were impressed with everything at this hotel. No complaints. There should definetly be WiFi in the rooms not just in the lobby however. That would have been much more convenient.

We found the location to be good, close to the Wharf and the transit lines.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, friendly staff, and nice breakfast which was included.
review.negativeRemarks: No wiFi in the rooms, just in the lobby.
review.locationRemarks: Location good. Close to the Wharf and transit lines.

review.title: Nice place to stay
review.reviewText:
Very comfortable place parking is the only thing which was hurting us.
We tried other places to get better rates for parking but no luck.
Very convince place all attractions were close by,trams ,buses ,fisherman wharf.
If you don't drive than we strongly recommend this hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking
review.locationRemarks: Excellent

review.title: Great hotel experience
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a great location. Everything is nearby for tourists. The breakfast was great and there were lots of food options.
review.negativeRemarks: The high rate of parking.
review.locationRemarks: Beautiful location.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText:
Over from UK and stayed at this hotel for a week in November,got nothing but good things to say!
Myself,wife and 2 teenager daughters stayed in a family room(2 double beds) and was pleasantly surprised at the size of the room. As you could imagine,sharing with 3 females meant we needed all the space we could get!
Location of hotel was SUPERB,walking distance to the Wharf and muni transport to take you to elsewhere in the city.
Read the 'horror stories' about breakfast,6.30-9.30 if i recall,dont know about the rest of the year but while we were there there was ALWAYS somewhere to sit at various times during service and was well stocked.
Staff were excellent and helpful also,couldnt do enough for us,unlike some places ive stayed in England where everything for some people seems such a chore.
Overall i would definately recommend this hotel to anyone,have seen some reviews about this place on various sites and whilst the majority are more than favourable,some people seem to think its meant to be a 5* hotel for 3* prices.....people,it isnt,its a top notch 3* hotel at a 3* hotel price,if you want 5 stars,go stay in one and pay the price accordingly!!
Once again,GREAT place to stay in a great part of a great city,many thanks!!
review.positiveRemarks:
Pleasantly surprised about size of room.
Staff excellent.
review.locationRemarks: Couldnt be better located

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Love the location it's near almost all tourist attractions. Its clean, the room is not so big but comfy. I recommend it!
review.negativeRemarks: No rubber mat on the tub, we almost slipped

review.title: great family

The room is bigger than i think and clean.The Hotel is very near the cabel car just one block from. It will be my first chose hotel next time if I travel to San Francisco.

review.title: Great hotel for quality and location.
review.reviewText: If I ever get back to San Francisco I would definitely stay there! The room was clean and comfortable. The staff was wonderful. Everyone was nice. The people behind the desk were very helpful, and we asked for information every day. It was perfectly close to Fisherman's Wharf where we walked every morning, and dined every night. There were more than enough choices from the continental breakfast. I have already told my coworkers what a great trip it was, and that hotel truly did make the difference.
review.positiveRemarks: The friendly and helpful staff. The location to the Wharf.
review.negativeRemarks: none

review.title: Enjoyable

review.title: Holiday inn express. AWESOME.
review.reviewText:
Our stay was very good. The location of the hotel was perfect. We were within walking distance to all places. Shopping was great good selection of everything. Happy with the continental breakfast in the mornings. Staff at front desk very helpful.
Bigger lobby for gathering bigger groups or meeting place. Only down fall was that free wifi in lobby only.
review.negativeRemarks: No wifi in rooms for wireless devises

review.title: Great stay!
review.reviewText: Great location. Walking distance to everything. Staff was excellent and very accomodating with all our tourist questions. Would definetly stay again.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast is free but you wont get stuffed from it.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent. It was 4 blocks to the wharf and great shopping. Walking distance to troley.

review.title: OK hotel
review.reviewText:
Holiday Inn Express and Suites Fisherman's Wharf
Terrific Location. Friendly helpful staff. This hotel is a good, adequate hotel.Not flash but not shabby. The fact that breakfast was included is a plus, but even so the tariff we paid I think was too high.
Our initial room was on bottom floor. Newly refurbished. A coffee machine but no fridge (which will be supplied on request). View into central cement courtyard. We arranged for a change of room, which they happily did for an increase in tariff. Top floor. Great view to Alcatraz. Microwave, fridge, sink. Similar decor but not as good condition with quite a few signs of wear. Old style TV with few channels. If I went to San Francisco again I would definitely investigate other hotels.There are plenty of them in the same area and you quite possibly could do better for the price. I don't know if San Francisco is generally an expensive place or not. To clarify whether I would recommend it.....maybe, depending on the tariff you could get.
review.negativeRemarks: Price
review.locationRemarks: 5 mins from pier 39, near open top bus stop, tram terminus,( all day or multi days pass can get you anywhere), bike hire, and numerous restaurants.

review.title: good location for Fishermans Wharf

Good location, basic usa style breakfast, expensive valet parking. No hot drinks available except at breakfast.
Very quiet room at back of building, good night sleep. If you are booked into room 187 dont follow signs as it is not shown on wall marker! Took us two trips to reception before we got proper directions to room with heavy cases.
review.positiveRemarks: close to local transport links, quiet.

review.locationRemarks: Excellent location

review.title: great starting point for city access
review.reviewText:
nice hotel in a great location, you can use public transportation to get around. friendly and helpful staff who seem to be happy working there. We stayed 1 night across the Bay in Emeryville at a Marriott ( free room from points ) and 2 in " The City " at the Holiday Inn.
From a comfort point the Marriott is far nicer with typical Marriott bedding ( the best we stay in ) and quieter. The Marriott had no free breakfast while the Holiday Inn had an outstanding one , At the Marriott there is free parking while at the Holiday Inn it is $ 45 per night ( ouch ) , still the Holiday Inn Express was cheaper. Lastly , there are 2 Holiday Inns a few doors apart . We first went to to the Holiday Inn, not the Express and found out we were 2 buildings down, this review is for the Express. I dont know the difference between
the two.
review.negativeRemarks: street noise , not real bad but if your a light sleeper you may want an interior room.

review.title: Great Location on Fisherman Wharf
review.reviewText: Great location. Clean lobby, room and halls. Breakfast included every day. Friendly, eager staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast was the same every day,

review.title: Great Modern Hotel, Very Clean, Excellent Location
review.reviewText:
We looked extensively for a hotel in San Francisco. Having stayed there in the past, we knew hotels would be expensive. This hotel is an excellent value in that the location is great (only 2-3 blocks ot Pier 39 on Fisherman's Wharf), it is super clean and modern, has an excellent breakfast included, and the staff is friendly from the front desk to the housekeeping staff as well.
We would definately stay there again and highly recommend it.
review.positiveRemarks: New modern design and very clean.
review.negativeRemarks: A bit hard to catch a taxi from the lobby as no Bellman available to help flag one.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent if you want to be close to Fisherman's Wharf and also easy to get to San Francisco city locations, Golden Gate, Marina District, etc.

review.title: san francisco hotel stay
review.reviewText: Excellent location, met all our needs for a short stay. Breakfast was a nice bonus. Would def. stay here again.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Excelent location (walking distance from pier 39), very clean, would definately return. The only downside was that there was no wireless internet in the room (only cable connection for laptops), but besides from that it was a great experience.

review.title: I LEFT MY HEART IN SAN FRANCISCO
review.reviewText: WE STAYED THREE NIGHTS AT THE HOLIDAY INN EXPRESS & SUITES.IT WAS PERFECTLY LOCATED IE 5-10 MINS WALK TO FISHERMANS WHARF AND QUIET OF AN EVENING.THE HOTEL WAS NICE AND CLEAN, STAFF FRIENDLY AND THE BUFFET BREAKFAST WAS VERY WELCOMING OF A MORNING.I HAD MY MUM/DAD WITH US AGED 78/77 AND THEY THOROUGHLY ENJOYED THEIR STAY, WE HAD BEEN IN OAHU FOR 3 WEEKS AND THIS WAS A CITY BREAK FOR US ON THE WAY HOME.I WOULD HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL TO ANYONE CONSIDERING GOING TO SAN FRANCISCO. IF WANTING TO GO AND VISIT ALCATRAZ BOOK THRO ALCATRAZ CRUISES YOU PRINT OFF YOUR TICKETS AND JUST GO TO THE PRE-PAID BOOTH SAVES AN AWFUL LOT OF QUEUING AND THE BEST SEAFOOD RESTARAUNT IS SCOMAS I WAS RECOMMENDED THIS BY THE PASSENGER NEXT TO ME WHO LIVES THERE.
review.negativeRemarks: NOT REALLY APPROPIATE, HAPPY WITH EVERYTHING
review.locationRemarks: FANTASTIC, COULD'NT HAVE BEEN ANY BETTER

review.negativeRemarks: small room no view

review.title: Great

review.title: Great for access to all the sites on the bay
review.reviewText:
This hotel is ideally suited for Fisherman's Wharf and for walking to North Beach restaurants. There is a great breakfast provided each day, although it can get very busy if there are groups leaving early for tours.
Rooms are a good size ( we had a great ground floor room with a very comfortable king size bed) and are very clean. There is free plug in Internet access in the room or wi-fi in the public areas. They also have a computer and printer to print off your airline boarding cards.

All in all it is great value for money and we have now stayed here several times.
review.negativeRemarks: Unfortunately there is no swimming pool

The complimentary breakfast was surprisingly good - lots of food choices.

review.title: Weekend escape
review.reviewText: Good location with access to transit and all Fisherman's Wharf has to offer.

review.title: Very pleased we chose this gr8t location
review.reviewText:
Fussy 50yrs old kiwi travellers - last leg of 3 week USA trip taking in major cities. In my opinion location at Fishermans wharf was superb - easy walk to transport, action, fishermans wharf eateries and QUIET and ... no homeless outside the door.
The staff were second best only to Trump hotel vegas - otherwise so friendly, helpful and professional without this "tip me tip me tip me' mentality just to get the basics of service. Even the cleaning staff smiled and greeted you in the hall ways.
Bed a bit hard - only reason for not giving room a higher rating but size and cleanliness very good.
Liked coffee in room, free breakfast so so - but overall American food at that level is so so.... regardless we were well fed for start of day
Its not 5 star, but very pleased we booked it and would stay there again if going to San Fran
review.positiveRemarks: location and helpful friendly staff made for pleasant stay
review.negativeRemarks: Harde bed .. but thats just because I am a princess :-)
review.locationRemarks: Excellent, close, quiet, and not many homeless or suspect characters like other parts of city

review.title: We Loved San Francisco
review.reviewText:
We booked this hotel based on reviews and were not disappointed. The location was excellent...walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf, the Cable cars, Trams, even Lombard Street. The staff at Reception were very friendly and helpful. The Breakfast Buffet was good, but very busy...best to get there early. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel
to my friends. We loved San Francisco!

review.title: Great hotel - close to everything.
review.reviewText:
We enjoyed our stay. We were so close to Fisherman's Wharf that we could walk everywhere. The staff were very nice and helpful.

Breakfast was a nice addition since most hotels in the area do not offer it. We really took advantage of the morning meal, although the breakfast set up was a little tight when many people were in line.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff were great. Breakfast was good also.
review.negativeRemarks: There was really not anything negative.
review.locationRemarks: Close to everything - but not so close that we were disturbed by traffic.

review.title: Helpful staff
review.reviewText: Staff was very helpful and polite. We enjoyed our stay.

review.title: Excellent hotel and location.
review.reviewText: Excellent location on Fishermans Wharf, walking distance to Lombard Street and only 10 dollars for taxi to Union Square. Staff very welcoming and knowledgeable of the area, always pleasant and eager to help with enquiries. Complimentary use of computers/email and flight booking in srevices for residents, making stay and forward travel easier. Buffet breakfast catered for all needs and was always fresh and in ample supply. Overall efficiency of this hotel was excellent and I would highly recommend it.
review.positiveRemarks: The friendliness and efficiency of staff. Breakfast variety. Location.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location on Fishermans Wharf, walking distance to Lombard Street and only 10 dollars for taxi to Union Square

review.title: Pleasing stay
review.reviewText:
We stayed five nights, the breakfast buffet more than adequate. Great location. Hotel staff
very atentive.
review.negativeRemarks: no refreshment bar
review.locationRemarks: ideal

review.title: Ok but not great
review.reviewText: There was no view, the bed could have been more comfortable
review.negativeRemarks: Comfort
review.locationRemarks: Great

review.title: A quick one night stay.
review.reviewText:
Our room was very comfortable. We enjoyed the breakfast in the morning except for the scrambled eggs.. Everything we ate was good.

Helpful at the front desk. We enjoyed the closeness to the Wharf.
review.locationRemarks: Liked being close to the Wharf and trollry lines.

review.title: Great Location when staying in San Fransisco.
review.reviewText: The Holiday Inn Express at Fisherman's Wharf is conveniently located for all activities starting in the Fisherman's Wharf district. It is only a 7 minute walk to Pier 39 and a 3 minute walk to nearest cable car stop. It is a short walk to many restaurants and convenience stores. Staff are very helpfull and able to provide answers to all general tourist type enquiries.
review.positiveRemarks: Room size is very spacious. Included breakfast is a bonus.
review.negativeRemarks: Free WiFi only available in foyer. No HD televisions and limited tv channels.
review.locationRemarks: Location is great.

review.title: Quokkas Perth
review.reviewText:
Lovely hotel, perfect location. would stay there again without hesitation.
The breakfast though may not be to everyone's liking, it is busy and self serve, yet more than adequate.
review.positiveRemarks: The location is ideal, Fishermans Wharf is 5 mins away.
review.negativeRemarks: nothing
review.locationRemarks: perfect location, very close to all Fisherman's Wharf attractions

review.title: A place to stay over night
review.reviewText: Nice hotel close to everything , we had a great view of a WALL, why put a window?

review.title: Clean and convenient.
review.reviewText: Not sure it is worth the price but exceptional none-the-less.
review.negativeRemarks: Price!
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf central.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Great location close to Cable Car and Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: Fantastic location for all attractions!
review.reviewText: Beware of the car parking charges they are very expensive. But there are cheaper alternatives very close to the hotel. Only a 5 minute walk!
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast is manic!

review.title: Shower full of pubic hairs. Yuck!!
review.reviewText:
The bad! The shower was filthy and full of pubic hairs and other bodily DNA. Gross!! The bed was hard and very difficult to sleep on. The pillows were the worst ever. All in all I'll never be back to this place and I hope they get someone in there that can clean better than a three yr old.

The good. The clerk at the front desk was friendly and kind. Yeah thats about it.

review.title: Only good for location
review.reviewText: We stayed here for a quick anniversary getaway. The location was great. They charge $45 a night extra to park though, and get there early because they let non-guests park as well. By the time we checked-in at 5:00, there were no spots left so we had to park a couple blocks away. The room was small but decent. The bed was hard and uncomfortable, but the pillows were comfy. The walls were paper thin so as of 7am, we heard every conversation outside our room and the kids running up and down the halls. Overall I would not recommend this hotel for anything but the location.
review.negativeRemarks: Paper thin walls so you hear everything outside.
review.locationRemarks: Quick walk from a lot of good locations.

review.title: Reasonably priced, very convenient location
review.reviewText: Stayed here five days, four nights. Friendly, helpful staff; hot breakfast every morning; very convenient location. Walking distance to the Wharf, the ferries, Ghirardelli Square, Chinatown, many restaurants and shopping centers. Public transport available in front of hotel to get to and from AT&T Park for a Giants game. Airport shuttle reasonably priced at $15 per person. Pleasant and relaxing; would stay at this hotel again.
review.positiveRemarks: convenient location, friendly staff, complimentary breakfast, A/C, airport shuttle
review.negativeRemarks: the swimming pool is actually next door at the Holiday Inn ... not at the HI-Express
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to Wharf, ferries, Ghirardelli Square, Chinatown, restaurants, shopping. Public transport to and from AT&T Park. Airport shuttle.

review.title: Awesome service!!
review.reviewText: This hotel made our vacation something special. The front Desk staff - especailly Ady - we awesome. They were always friendly, willing to help, and concerned that we were having a great time. This is a must place to stay in San Francisco.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Nice hotel within walking distance of many area attractions. Morning breakfast was very good, more than just coffee and doughnuts.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText:
The hotel is situated in Fisherman's wharf and easy walking distance of many attractions. The breakfast buffet was above average when compared to other hotels in this class (the waffle machine was out of order). The workout room was below average when compared to other hotels. There are no service personnel inside the hotel to assist you in getting your luggage to your room; they do however, provide a cart for your convenience. Rooms quiped with two beds are standard size - no queen size beds are available in rooms with two beds.

Since we did not plan to spend our time in the room, it was appropriate for our stay. I would stay there again if circumstances were similar.
review.positiveRemarks: ladies who cleaned the rooms were very friendly and thoughtful
review.negativeRemarks: workout room
review.locationRemarks: great location - walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf and other attractions.

review.title: Adrian And Annie's Getaway
review.reviewText: Our stay at this hotel was incredible, can't wait to go back.
review.positiveRemarks: The Breakfast Buffet, the cleanliness, the comfortable rooms
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: The location was perfect

review.title: Great hotel, brilliant location & affordable.
review.reviewText:
Great hotel, well located and at reasonable price. In easy walking distance of the Fishermans Wharf area and the Cable cars but located in a quiet spot.
Simple but well stocked buffet breakfast included. Great value.
Would definitely recommend for any families visiting San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfy beds, quiet room, ample buffet breakfast
review.negativeRemarks: One of the lifts broke down, but access to stairs nearby room.
review.locationRemarks: Central location at Fishermans Wharf, but far away enough for a quiet night's rest.

review.title: San Francisco Family Stay
review.reviewText: San Francisco is an expensive city to stay in, not only the rooms but also car parking if you are travelling around. The Hotel itself was fine with a complimentary breakfast but no wi-fi in the rooms which for the price was ridiculous
review.negativeRemarks: Cost
review.locationRemarks: Near Fishermans Wharf and close to get around all the city

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: We had a king room, it was "very" basic. Unfortunately unless you get a suite you don't get a view at all. The bed was comfortable, room & bath was in good condition. Breakfast was OK, nothing to brag about but a savings over going out each morning. The location was great. Walking distance to Fisherman's Warf, Pier 39, trolley cars & buses.
review.negativeRemarks: small room, no view
review.locationRemarks: only two streets up from waterfront

review.title: Our time in San Francisco
review.reviewText: It was close to the places we wanted to go. It was close to many different forms of public transportation. After staying at the Intercontinental in Monterey, Ca., this motel seemed rather average.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice, hot breakfast with a large eating area. Staff goes out of the way to help you out.
review.negativeRemarks: View out our window. Valet parking and high parking fee.
review.locationRemarks: The location is near the water, cable cars, and many of the attractions. It is easy to find on North Point.

review.title: Great location and wonderful breakfasts!
review.reviewText:
Breakfast was great! It was nice to have it included, as meals are expensive in SF!
The staff was very helpful when asked about directions and restaurant recommendations.
When we had a problem with our toilet, they immediately put in the work order and it was fixed quickly.
review.negativeRemarks: crowded
review.locationRemarks: very convenient

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText:
I am so pleased I booked this hotel. It is in the best position for first-time visitors to San Francisco if you want the 'tourist' experience....close to Pier 39 and all the good eateries (I'd definitely recommend Joe's Crab Shack for seafood) as well as the cable cars and buses and only a short trip to Union Square area.
Our room was clean and well serviced, bed and pillows comfortable enabling a good night's sleep with no noise.
We had no issue with breakfast and whilst it was peak season we still found a table quickly each morning.
Yes, parking is expensive and could be a consideration if you are looking for economy. We were looking for location and this hotel was perfect as we flew in from overseas and hired a car to drive out of San Francisco to continue our trip. I would certainly recommend it for first time visitors. It was worth the money.
review.negativeRemarks: Expensive parking
review.locationRemarks: Location so close to the hub of Fisherman's Wharf and Pier 39 and cable cars etc was fabulous, but also just that bit away from the noisy city areas.

review.title: Holiday Inn Express Fisherman's Wharf July 2012
review.reviewText: The room was small and faced south which ment it got very hot during the day. We had to open the window at night to cool the room down. One of the lifts was broken whch ment the remaining one was very busy. We used the stairs. Breakfast is not good quality and the room is very crowded. The location is excerlent for fishermans wharf.
review.negativeRemarks: Room, breakfast, broken lift
review.locationRemarks: Excerlent location for Fisherman's wharf

review.title: Great Convenient Hotel
review.reviewText: Within walking distance to fishermans wharf. The free breakfast was a great way to start the day.
review.locationRemarks: Close to fisherman's wharf. Convenient to trolley, cable cars, bus, etc.

review.title: Great looking, needs to go the extra mile!
review.reviewText:
The hotel is beautiful and within walking distance of Pier 39 and the other attractions. The room was nicely laidout (even though a bit small on bathroom space), and the staff did a great job when interacting with them.

Here are the critisism:

1) Not enough staff. Only one person manning the front desk which meant you had to wait.
Breakfast tables did not get cleaned as often as they should have.

2) 2nd elevator was out-of-service. It was clear that the elevator had been broken for a while and that it wasn't getting fixed anytime soon. The staff didn't mention this nor tell anyone where the stairs were. Stuff breaks, openess is the best policy!
review.negativeRemarks: No wireless interent in hotel room
review.locationRemarks: Ideal location!

review.title: Close to the wharf and trolley
review.reviewText: The location to the wharf was great just a 5-10 minute walk and you were there. Nothing really negative to say on the accommodations themselves. One of the elevators did not work which was just a slight inconvenience and the rate for the parking garage seemed excessive at $45 a night plus tax but it was worth it especially after returning the rental car and seeing all of the cars that had broken windows or dents. Would stay there again.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking rates

review.title: Great location for tourists
review.reviewText: Great location for my husband and I celebrating our 29th anniversary as first time S.F. tourists. It was nice they provided breakfast but it was VERY crowded. We don't eat much breakfast but healthier options would be nice. No skim milk for cereal and no healthier yogurt options. Like many, mostly carbs and only fruit option was a banana. They gladly stored our luggage since our flight wasn't until late afternoon so we could continue with our vacation the day we checked out. We felt safe walking the area day or night. We thought it was pricey but maybe not for the area. We liked the room safe so we could keep things locked up without using their safety deposit box.
review.negativeRemarks: Price
review.locationRemarks: This hotel is only 1-2 blocks from the hustle and bustle of Fisherman's Wharf and Pier 39.

review.title: Great hotel for family--good location for the Whar
review.reviewText: Front desk staff extremely helpful. Breakfast was OK. Location was good. Overall the hotel was clean. You could add more stations on the cable. A little pricey because of the Gay Pride Weekend.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast

review.title: good location
review.reviewText:
This hotel is great for location and the staff is friendly. The room was clean although the shower had that sort of gross 'I know it's clean but it doesn't look clean' feel.

Be warned that the walls are paper thin - I could hear our neighbor coughing, snoring, talking on the phone...thankfully we only had a neighbor on one side.

I would stay here again but would skip breakfast at the hotel and would bring some ear plugs!
review.negativeRemarks: Paper thin walls

review.title: Walking Distance To Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Stayed with kids for a visit to Fisherman's Wharf (walking distance). Other than a crowded breakfast room, everything was great.
review.positiveRemarks: Free breakfast with clean and comfortable room.
review.negativeRemarks: Crowded breakfast room.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf with a cable car stop near the hotel.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: I recently visited this hotel with my husband and 4 year old daughter and was pleasantly surprised at the quality of the service and rooms. I would recommend staying here with children as it is centrally located and the free breakfast had plenty to choose from.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect base for looking around the main tourist attractions

review.title: San Francisco
review.reviewText: The location was perfect! We truly had a wonderful time. Truly appreciated the included breakfast. Wished for a little more variety. Perhaps more fresh fruit would be nice. Thank you!
review.negativeRemarks: It would have been nice to have free shuttle service from the airport and to the airport. Or at least a better rate. $15/person is quite steep.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect.

review.title: Unorganized Hotel
review.reviewText:
Both mornings of our visit the free breakfast area was dirty and unorganized. They were out of basic items like cream for coffee. The tables were all dirty. Staff watched me clean my own table. All of the vending machines in the building were out of water. I went to every floor with no luck. When I brought it to the attention of the front desk staff they suggested I try a restaurant down the street. The walls of my room were very thin and it was difficult to sleep.

The location of the hotel is excellent but parking was $45 per night plus tax.
review.negativeRemarks: Dirty food area

review.title: An ideal hotel in an ideal location.
review.reviewText: Ideal Location for the wharf area and easy to reach public transports for other areas in San Francisco. A most acceptable breakfast was a welcome inclusion in the price when nearly all hotels exclude it. Staff very friendly and most helpful.

review.title: single,father & son,express get away,
review.reviewText: my son and i stayed at this hotel, close to everything, rooms very clean, we enjoyed our stay very much,
review.positiveRemarks: the help made everything very easy, from parking, checking in, to room cleanliness
review.negativeRemarks: there were non
review.locationRemarks: great location, close to everything we wanted to do, boat rides, museum,food, transportation, ball game

review.title: Convenient and suitable hotel for a traveller
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a great location, a 5 minute walk to Fisherman's Wharf. It is also reasonably close to the cable cars and other forms of transport. The breakfast is included in the price. The rooms are spacious and the internet is free.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, free internet, good breakfast, front desk staff were friendly
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast staff could have been friendlier and more efficient
review.locationRemarks: Ideal

review.title: Hotel Info
review.reviewText: Hotel was convenient to everwhere I wanted to go. Close to stores, travel, restaurants and fisherman's wharf.
review.negativeRemarks: No refrigerator. Coffee extremely strong.
review.locationRemarks: Convenient to getting where you need to go.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The front desk clerk was friendly and checked us in early than the schedule checked in time.

review.title: Pleasant stay
review.reviewText: Very clean and well maintained. Front desk service was efficient and professional. Despite large groups staying there, it was possible to get a table during breakfast. The pancake machine was out of order, but the rest of the food was good, just wish they had more fruit to choose from than bananas. Overall a pleasant stay and excellent location close to Fishermans Wharf, Alcatraz Ferry, many restaurants/shops and the Cable car stop.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast was crowded
review.locationRemarks: Close to Fishermans Wharf area with lots of things to see and do.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Fantastic location in Fisherman's Wharf. Compact, neat, clean and tidy room. Breakfast can be busy, but a great and generous variety of food and beverages.
review.positiveRemarks: Location. No street noise in rooms. Great variety, quantity and choice at inclusive breakfast.
review.negativeRemarks: The pillows
review.locationRemarks: Great access to Fisherman's Wharf area and bay waterfront. Great variety of restaurants and supermarkets close by

review.title: Enjoyed the stay
review.reviewText: Great location; walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf and lots of great restruants. Would stay there again. Free breakfast and friendly and helpful staff.
review.negativeRemarks: bed was a little too soft and pillow too flat
review.locationRemarks: close to Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: This hotel is within a couple of blocks walking distance of the wharf, easily accessible to all the restaurants and activities there. It is also easily accessible to the cable car and bus lines.

review.title: Comfortable weekend
review.reviewText: I was visiting family and only spent the nights there. Continnential breakfast was good.
review.locationRemarks: Great location 1 block off Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel was great for our stay. We had 5 of us in a room, including one child. It was really nice for the price and the area and close to everything!

review.title: ISSUES
review.reviewText:
Night shift person at the desk(11pmto 7 am) was not helpful
PARKING WAS VERY EXPENSIVE ALMOST $51 DOLLARS A DAY
HAD ISSUES WHEN CHECKING OUT AT 500AM
TOLD MY CAR WILL BE OUT FRONT HAD TO WAIT TO UNLOCK GATE & CAR
AND TOLD I COULD WALK DOWN THE SPACE TO GET MY CAR
THIS WAS OUR SECOND TIME AT THIS HOTEL was very disappointed
would have to thinks twice about return to this hotel
review.negativeRemarks: parking was very expensive , we spent over $300 on parking
review.locationRemarks: very nice easy nice part on San Fran

review.title: Close and Very good averall
review.reviewText: Excellent! VERY close to the fishermen wharf, good rates, nice rooms. The only reason it's not 5 it's because the internet access is only wired.

review.title: Great location, great hotel, expensive parking
review.reviewText: The Hotel was great especially the location but beware of high parking costs and do not park your car on the street else you will be ticketed when street cleaners come through in the middle of the night
review.negativeRemarks: Parking
review.locationRemarks: Fishermans warf

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: A fantastic hotel with good breakfast, very modern, and best of all it is situated less that 5 minutes walk from Fishermans Wharf, the Powell Hyde and Powell Mason cable car termini are less than 10 minutes walk away, and the historic F-Line streetcar is only a few minutes walk away.
review.locationRemarks: Good location in heart of Fishermans Wharf

review.title: Basic Room- Overall decent experience
review.reviewText: Overall the hotel was fine, a basic room that was clean. If you are planning to spend a lot of time at the hotel this might not be the place for you as there are not many places to "relax" outside of the room. The lobby is nice, but very busy and there are not any separate spaces away from the bustle of those checking in. Staff were very helpful and pleasant. If you open the windows for air plan on listening to a bit of noise form the street outside.
review.positiveRemarks: The breakfast buffet in the a.m.
review.negativeRemarks: The noise from the street below.
review.locationRemarks: Very good location-Convieniently located to the restaurants and shops near the Fishman's Wharf.

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: We had a very good stay at this hotel, my only criticism is the lack of a fridge and microwave in the room, most Australian hotels have them as standard not as a first come first served basis at $20 per day. In all other respects it was a good experience, the staff were great, would recommend it to anyone
review.negativeRemarks: lack of a fridge
review.locationRemarks: Very close to fisherman's wharf and all the touristy things - eg cable cars, eating places

review.title: Great stay
review.reviewText: Perfect location. The hotel's outstanding customer service and cleanliness are more than enough to recommend it to my friends and everyone.
review.negativeRemarks: Little noise from outside

review.title: Worth staying at
review.reviewText: Good price for a clean and comfortable bed and room and breakfast was a bonus.
review.negativeRemarks: Only wired internet in room
review.locationRemarks: Perfect for Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Great location to explore San Francisco. Only bad thing I can say is that the walls were very thin and you could hear every little thing in the hallways!

review.title: Will Stay Again!
review.reviewText:
Great location for tourists. Easy walking (2 blocks) access to streetcars and trolley. Buy the City Pass if you will be be there 3 days or more. Worth the money in trolley fees alone.
Could improve with business computer center. Computer that is designated for airline check - in did not print correctly, paper hard to find, very disappointing. Breakfast area could use more tables, especially when student groups are present.
Helpful people at the desk, able to answer questions about area and make good suggestions.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: This is an excellent hotel to stay at while in San Francisco. Rooms were exceptionally clean, hotel staff is great and it is only two blocks from Fisherman Wharf. The breakfast that is included was also great.

review.title: Location, location, location (with friendly staff)
review.reviewText:
Great location. Very friendly staff, especially the cleaning staff and the valet parking staff. Room and bathroom were clean and fresh. The bed could have been more comfortable. Breakfast was adequate. I would like to have seen a few more healthier items, such as plain yogurt (without fruit -- both regular and fat free) and other fresh fruits more than bananas.

I would stay here again because of the location and price.
review.positiveRemarks: Proximity to Fisherman's Wharf and Cable Car. Free internet access.
review.negativeRemarks: Expensive parking. Breakfast did not have enough health conscious choices.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Our room was on the fourth floor. It was quiet and clean. The included buffet breakfast was adequate to our needs. They had pastries, fruit, cereals, eggs, bacon, and sausage. The location was about two blocks from Fisherman's Wharf.
review.locationRemarks: It was two blocks from Fisherman's Wharf. There were other hotels on the street, lots of souvenir shops around, good restaurants, and a Walgreen's.

review.title: could have been so much better...
review.reviewText: breakfast was awful and there were few choices on tv for kids
review.negativeRemarks: noise, breakfast & tv channel selection
review.locationRemarks: perfect

review.title: Title
review.reviewText: The location was perfect, close to the Wharf, shopping, and eating. The breakfast was good. The one thing that stunk was paying $106 for two nights of parking.
review.negativeRemarks: High prices to park WOW $ 53 a night, they told me $45 per night but added a bunch of crap on top of that.
review.locationRemarks: Close to everthing

review.title: general is good only the breakfast not that good
review.reviewText: I think that you should add more fruits other than bananas in the breakfast, or more vegetables, because you have to many breads, not balanced. yogurt ok. juice ok, but there is no more varieties.
review.negativeRemarks: the breakfast

review.title: A perfect location!
review.reviewText:
You can visit many places within easy reach from this hotel.
A free buffet breakfast is bonus as many American hotels didnt have one. Happy to go back to this hotel again.
If you plan to visit Alcatraz, I would recommend to book tickets on-line before going to San Francisco to avoid disappointment.
review.negativeRemarks: Plastic culteries and plates but you can get used it - its good quality anyway!
review.locationRemarks: You can reach many places and restaurants by foot

review.title: Excellent Location & Great Service
review.reviewText: I would highly recommend this hotel, specially for first time visitors to San Francisco. Me and my husband wanted to be in the centre of all the tourist hotspots at a walking distance and that is exactly what we got. The hotel is not super fancy but was on the upscale side with clean rooms and bathroom. We requested a bayview room when checking in and they gave us one without any hassle since they had availability for one. We requested a second set of fresh towels in one day and they were delivered to our room within 5 minutes. Overall, good service and very good value for money!!

review.title: Great location to San Fran attractions
review.reviewText: The location of the hotel was excellent for walking to all the attractions of San Francisco - Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39, Lombard Street, Alcatraz ferry, etc. The hotel was clean and the staff was very helpful and friendly. The breakfast was key to starting the day right, especially with kids! We recommend this hotel to others.

review.title: express notes
review.reviewText: very nice hotel updated and very modern colors. personnel friendly and breakfast grood

review.title: Not Happy
review.reviewText:
We arrived at about 11:00 pm and after an extremely long day we were told they had overbooked and did not have the mini suite that we reserved. The manager on duty was condescending, agumentitive and said he was giving us "better deal" than what we booked. He repeated over and over that they had no suites. Anytime I would attempt to talk, he would say "sir", "sir", "sir" with no solution. I asked him to stop it and he said "sir".

We finally had to have our children stay in a seperate room, both rooms were extremely small and had a view out the window of a wall. We received a call in the morning the next day from the manager on duty and said he was "upgrading" us to a family suite with a better view with 2 tv's. It had the same view of a wall, 1 tv, and was the room we originally booked - no upgrade. They owe us some $$ for not having the room we ordered and paid upfront for and then claimed to upgrade and did not. I would have never booked a hotel anywhere that had walls directy out the window, especially on the Bay in San Francisco.
review.locationRemarks: Location is good - view terrible. Felt like we were in a dark cell.

review.title: Great bang for the buck
review.reviewText: For the price and location of the Holiday Inn Express, we were very impressed with what they had to offer. Everything that we needed to enjoy our short holiday was well within walking distance, or at least within a short cab ride's distance away.
review.locationRemarks: Great spot to enjoy the touristy area of Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: Nice location
review.reviewText:
The hotel is perfectly located in Fisherman Wharf. It is close to Pier 39 where all the fun is and also close to Ghirardelli Square.
It is close to the fun activities like Ripleys and Wax Museum. All the City Tours start just 1 block away from the hotel and there are lots of eating options. We reached hotel at 11:30 in the night and were very hungry. Denny's which is round the corner of the hotel is 24 hrs open and it came to our rescue in the middle of the night.

Breakfast is included but it is same everyday. I think they should have more variety.

The area is safe and perfect for families with kids.
The business center is open 24hrs a day and we were able to take print out of our boarding pass just before leaving to airport.

Wired Internet is present in the room.
These small things that are present in the hotel would encourage me to go back.
review.negativeRemarks: same breakfast everyday

review.title: Basic hotel, good place to stay to visit SF
review.reviewText:
Basic hotel
Good location for visiting the city
Breakfast is crowded
Good overall condition
Nothing fancy

review.title: Great Review
review.reviewText: The only item I feel could be improved is the number of tables for breakfast. There was not a table available in the breakfast area or lobby to sit and eat.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to Pier 39 and Fisherman's Wharf. Well kept and clean.

review.title: Three day stay
review.reviewText: The breakfast that they offer is awesome, the location is amazing, and the rooms are clean and nice. The only downfall that the hotel has is that the rooms are not well insulated for noise. You can hear the people above you and to the sides of your room. The beds are very firm and I was not a fan of them. Other than that, the hotel was great. Could offer wifi in the rooms as opposed to just the business center.
review.negativeRemarks: The beds

review.title: Great location nice hotel
review.reviewText: We spent three nights here earlier in the month. We were very impressed with the Hotel, room was good size, view of other rooms, but that meant it was nice and quiet. Standard hotel bathroom everything worked. Breakfast suited us fine, good choice of cereals, yoghurts, swish pancake making machine fruit only bananas and they went quickly. Juice, coffee (nice and hot) great little cartons of milk, we took one back to room and put it in ice bucket so I could have a cup of tea (took own kettle and teabags). Staff very helpful, we used the computer daily and printed off our boarding cards etc. The best thing about the Hotel is how near it is to Fisherman's Wharf, We would return if we are ever in San Francisco again.
review.positiveRemarks: How close it was to Fisherman's Wharf
review.negativeRemarks: Cannot think of anything
review.locationRemarks: Great only a couple of blocks from the Wharf, also close to a a 'Trader Joe's if you need any snacks etc

review.title: A great overall experience
review.reviewText:
The staff was friendly and curteous. In fact we found the whole city very friendly. The staff helped us with the transit system. They recommended excellent restaurant. The hotel was full of tour groups, yet the rooms were quiet and had no trouble sleeping.

I think a little variety in the breakfast would be the only thing I could recomment. We were there for 6 days and having the same exact breakfast every day was boring. At a minimum, you might think of changing the way you fix the eggs, and/or have waffles one morning instead of pancakes.
review.positiveRemarks: Location could not have been better
review.negativeRemarks: breakfast was adequate but not great and the same every day
review.locationRemarks: the location was my favorite thing

review.title: Amazing stay
review.reviewText: It was a very comfortable room. All that we needed for our stay. Very comfortable beds. The staff of the hotel was amazing. So friendly and willing to go out of their way to please and help us. Would recommend it to anyone and would definately stay there again.
review.negativeRemarks: For the price we paid it would have been nice to have a fridge in the room.
review.locationRemarks: It was a good location. Close to the wharf and the activities around it. Close to transportation of all kinds.

review.title: A good experience
review.reviewText: Room was clean, well presented. Staff friendly and helpful. Would use this hotel again, close to all activities.. easy to walk to them from here

review.title: nice people
review.reviewText: Nice, clean, and great people that work there. they made our stay very pleasnt and the front dest was very helpful with getting us aourd town.
review.negativeRemarks: breakfast could be better
review.locationRemarks: great for what we went there for, to see the sfo playoff game vs the sanits. the stuidum was not far away from the hotel. I would stay there again!!!!

review.title: Breakfast cold
review.reviewText: Nice hotel only complaint would be the breakfast hot items were cold both days we stayed there.
review.negativeRemarks: Cold breakfast
review.locationRemarks: Great

review.title: Great Experience
review.reviewText: The continential breakfast was great and the staff was very helpful and friendly. Also, you can't beat the location. It was within close walking distance to Pier 39 and plenty of shops and restaurants. I'll definitely stay there again!
review.positiveRemarks: The continential breakfast was nice and the staff was great. You can't beat the location!

review.title: Comfortable and convenient wharf hotel
review.reviewText:
Clean and friendly hotel in a great location. Service was very good and the parking options were liberal... allowed to leave car valet parked until 6pm on the day of check out.

Overall a good experience.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking is expensive, but it'S really just a function of the location and overall parking situation throughout the city.
review.locationRemarks: Great spot, right in the middle of the Wharf -- walking distance to everything between Ghiradelli Square and Pier 39.

review.title: Nice hotel, met our expectations. Great location!
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, met our expectations. Great location! Close to the water front and pier 39. Easy walk to China town.

review.title: Family of 4
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean which was nice but our heater did not work. The room was cold all night. I would have changed but we got in late and our little ones went down fast so we were stuck just cold. Also, the noise from the street was pretty bad and my daughter is a light sleeper so that was tough. Next time I would ask for a room not on the first floor or one of their rooms that faces the courtyard.

review.title: Great Hotel!
review.reviewText: Excelent location, great hotel for anyone who wants to stay in the area.
review.negativeRemarks: None.
review.locationRemarks: Fantastic Position.

review.title: A Pleasant Stay
review.reviewText: I had a nice little room on the main floor. It was quiet and cozy with a very comfortable bed. The continental breakfast was okay, but could have had more variety. The hotel is only a block from a major stop on the F-line public transportation. I am willing to stay there again on my next trip.
review.positiveRemarks: Quiet and has a continental breakfast.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast needs variety. Internet in room, but no wi-fi.
review.locationRemarks: Convenient location for sight-seeing, but has some vagrancy nearby.

review.title: Awsome location
review.reviewText: Great Location Two cable car lines within a block one block to fishermans warf also trolley cars to just about everyware within a block couldnt be a better location.

review.title: New,location,
review.reviewText: Good location, breakfast,comfortable room, near a lot of caffe and restorants, 5min city center
review.locationRemarks: Location and breakfest

review.title: Pleasantly Surprised
review.reviewText:
I was pleasantly surprised by my stay here. I hadn't expected much from a "value" hotel, but the rooms were clean and well appointed. The staff super helpful and kind, and the hotel was excellently located between the Wharf, Ghiradelli, and the transportation options (F line/cable car). Great for a couple just doing a casual few day visit to SF for vacation.

The downsides were paper thin walls. I heard every sound or door slam in the hallway, more so than I usually expect from hotels. The complimentary breakfast was a nice feature, but the food was really pretty bad. Microwaved eggs and dry pasteries.

Over all, I was still pleasantly surprised and would stay here again. The location, nice decorations and helpful staff were really the selling point and good for a very casual short trip to SF.
review.positiveRemarks: Helpful staff, nicely designed amenities, great location.
review.negativeRemarks: Very thin walls.
review.locationRemarks: Fantastic location, right central to the F-line and cable car stops, and walking distance to both Ghiradelli Square, the Wharf, etc.

review.title: Holiday Inn Express at Fisherman's Wharf - 550 NP
review.reviewText: Staff from check in to check out went over and above to please and answer questions. Walking distance to the shops and restaurants at the wharf. Close to local bus routes.
review.positiveRemarks: Good value and proximity to wharf restaurants

review.title: Great, but slow in responding
review.reviewText: There was a brawl on our floor that lasted around two hours. The hotel was not speedy in getting this situation under control.

review.title: Great place to stay. Great service.
review.reviewText: Check-in was very quick and the room was ready early. The front desk staff could not have been more helpful with directions to those things we wanted to see. The hotel is very close to Fisherman's Wharf. Being one block away, you are away from the major noise of the street and trolleys. Our room was very clean upon arrival and the hotel cleaning staff did an exceptional job keeping the room tidy and clean. Bed was very comfortable. My wife's only criticism was that the hot water in the shower was not hot enough. It was fine for me! Breakfast was ready every day, on time. There was a very good selection -- cereal, eggs, bacon/sausage, pancakes, muffins, bagels, toast (various kinds), sausage gravy and biscuits, fruit, and muffins. Coffee was fresh. Juice was cold. I would certainly stay here should I ever return to San Francisco. Be SURE to get the MUNI (transportation) pass. You will save a lot on using the public transportation, which is excellent. No need to rent a car. Should we go back, this hotel would be our first pick.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean room. Quite. Close to transportation. Friendly and helpful staff. Good breakfast. Comp computer access in lobby and in the room.
review.negativeRemarks: As above, my wife thought the hot water in the shower was not hot enough. For me, it was fine. Sink hot water was fine for both of us.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to wharf and transportation access. Good restaurants within easy walk (Scoma's was the best) Girdello chocolate a few blocks away.

review.title: Clean & comfortable.
review.reviewText: Room was very nice, clean & stocked daily. It was a little small, so wouldn't recommend it to a family, but was fine for a couple. Our only complaints were that we could hear voices through the wall occasionally, but quiet overall and no view out window.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean & bed comfortable. Felt safe. Close to attractions on Wharf.
review.negativeRemarks: Small & thin walls.
review.locationRemarks: Loved that it was so close to attractions & tour centers to get info.

review.title: Would not be my first choice
review.reviewText:
Found that the bed was uncomfortable, the tap leaked when ran the water, and could have used an extra blanket. The cushions in the front lobby were worn and needed to be replaced. We were surprised by the generous choices for a continental breakfast, and the cleaning lady was efficient.
Calling it "Fisherman's Wharf" is misleading, as was a bit of a walk to there, not actually on the Wharf, or even across it.
review.negativeRemarks: The bed
review.locationRemarks: Is misleading to call it Fisherman's Wharf, as cannot see the Wharf from it.

review.title: Value Hotel
review.reviewText:
Location is good.
Free continental breakfast is ok but nothing to get excited about.
No refrigerator in room.
Parking is very expensive at the hotel but all hotels in SFO seem to be expensive. Best to source something else when you get settled in.
Wifi only in lobby.
Staff very helpful.
No luggage porter. You have to take your own luggage to the room but there is a trolley provided for that.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking cost
review.locationRemarks: Very good

review.title: Fisherman's wharf stay
review.reviewText:
The breakfast don't waste your time with it. All hot food and drinks were cold and no dining area. The building shared washing machines at another site up the street.
Great location for Fisherman's wharf and surrounding area. No bar fridge and the tea and coffee making machine are in the bathroom.All staff very helpful. The room was small and the view was of a the other rooms windows. Our room had a king size bed but the room was biggest enough for one person.
review.negativeRemarks: Washing facilities
review.locationRemarks: Easy walking to fishermans wharf and area surrounding

review.title: Great hotel, great price, awsome location!!
review.reviewText: Complimentary breakfast was the best i have ever had (Eggs, sausage patties, bacon, pancakes, biscuit and gravy mmmmm, and lots of other stuff). 45.00 parking per night a bit pricey but distance to pier 39 and several other places is walking distance and really convenient
review.negativeRemarks: 45.00 per night parking fee
review.locationRemarks: Awesome - walking distance to pier 39, Departure for Alcatraz tour, china town, Ghirardelli square and several food places.

review.title: A San Francisco treat...
review.reviewText: Hotel staff, to a person, were professional, courteous and competent - while at the same time respectful of and attentive to privacy requirements. our room was spotless and very well kept. Free buffet breakfast was a fantastic start to each day, and an even better surprise when we were informed of it at check-in! Hotel is steps away from Wharf and Cable Cars!! We had a great time!! You will too!!
review.negativeRemarks: we did not experience anything negative... automobile parking is $50.00 daily, but we didn't have a car... would've been a bummer if we'd had one.
review.locationRemarks: One block, literally steps, from Fishermans' Wharf. Cable cars were the same distance, too.

review.title: What's good and bad.
review.reviewText: good location, pretty good room but breakfast was the worst experience we have ever had.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast.
review.locationRemarks: Very good location. near pier 39 and Crabs.

review.title: Clean and convenient
review.reviewText: Hotel is in a great location walking distance to Fishermen's Wharf, Lombard Street, the Cable Car, hop on hop off bus and a supermarket. Beds were comfortable and the bathroom clean. The breakfast is basic and high on carbs and sugar but you will walk it off up those SF hills. Will go back.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's wharf

review.title: Lovely hotel, perfect location!
review.reviewText: Everything about our stay was perfect. It could not have been better!
review.locationRemarks: North Beach Area and the Wharf

review.title: Would go back again!
review.reviewText: Holiday Inn Express has yet to let us down in all the Cities we've been to in the past year. San Francisco was no different. We're pretty concerned over the Bed Bug infestation that seems to be on the rise, not just in Hotels, but in Library's, Retail Stores and Movie Theaters so we really check out the mattressess everywhere we stay... we were pleasantly pleased to see that the Holiday Inn Express continues to live up to it's reputation of having clean rooms. Wish we had a fridge, but other than that.. the air/heat worked wonderfully and the bath towels were the best we've ever had. The bed itself wasn't too soft or hard and the water was immediately hot in the shower and sink which is always nice not having to wait. :) The breakfast buffet each morning had such a variety of choices for everyone. Terrific value for the price of each room.. of course the parking everywhere now a days is horrible. $45 for each night so we parked our car in a nearby garage for $20 a night and walked 2 blocks to the hotel. Not a big deal. We totally recommend this hotel.

review.title: Nice Hotel but noisy
review.reviewText: Good location, can walk to most places, nice and clean, good breakfast, get up early for the bacon before it goes. Breakfast area can get a bit busy in the mornings, but good selection. Our biggest complaint was the noise in our room from other guests walking talking etc in the corridor, something we havent experienced to that extent in other hotels. May have helped to be the furthest possible from the lifts (we were not next to the lifts).

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Near or close to all the Wharf 's action, The rooms are small but nicely decorated. Parking a car was expensive.

review.title: Had a good time
review.reviewText: Good

review.title: Location, location, location!
review.reviewText:
If you're doing San Francisco as a tourist, you can't beat this hotel. Close to all tours and attractions near or on Fisherman's Wharf. Clean, comfy rooms. Decent choices for the included brakfast gets you on your way efficiently, but it can get somewhat crowded. The breakfast area is really the only big improvement. That and lacking Wi-Fi availablity, although hard wire inernet service is available in all rooms.
Would I go back or recommend it? In a heartbeat!.
review.locationRemarks: Aside from the Tenderloin, all areas in San Francisco seemed pleasant and safe to walk around in.

review.title: Great location, well maintained and very reasonable
review.reviewText: Understated hotel, dark lobby but the rest well maintained and very convenient

review.title: Disappointed
review.reviewText:
Elevators never worked.
No restaurant.
No room service.
No bellman.
No concierge.
Pretty poor service overall.

review.title: great hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel. Complementary breakfast bread was stale though.

review.title: San Francisco
review.reviewText:
Had both the lifts been working this hotel would have been rated better.
There were no lift working at all on the Sunday of our visit
review.locationRemarks: Everywhere

review.title: I would not recommend any hotel that charges more for parking than I paid for my hire car.
review.reviewText: The hotel was good on most levels, accept the breakfast times, when you are on vacation you do not want to be at breakfast before 9.30 am, especially on a Sunday! I was also very disappointed I was not advised of the parking charges at the hotel, I paid more for parking the car at the hotel than I paid to hire the car for four days, this I feel is unacceptable and I should have been made aware of this before I made the booking. I am a regular client and felt this was bad customer service.
review.locationRemarks: I would advise any traveler to go completely away from the main fisherman wharf in San Fransisco, to get a better service and better value for money.

review.title: Good location and value, breakfast is lacking
review.reviewText:
Great hotel, valet expensive (like parking in San Fran in general). Breakfast is nothing special, so don't make that a deal breaker.

Location is good, very close to fishermans wharf and pier 39.

review.title: We will go back
review.reviewText: The Holiday Inn Express is a no frills hotel with the nice perk of a hot breakfast. No the food isn't gourmet although the coffee is very good, but people go to fancier hotels if they want fancier food and rooms. The staff are pleasant, the facility and rooms are clean and we love the location. The rate is a titch high but all in all we find it good value and would return. San Francisco is such a great place.

review.title: Recommend
review.reviewText: If you are a tourist with limited time it is worth paying the premium and staying at Fisherman's Wharf. The Holiday Inn Express concept is always a reliably good standard - no surprises.

review.title: Close to the Warf and the F-Line
review.reviewText: Booked the hotel online. Was happy to find that the F-Line ran right behind it, and that it was within walking distance to Fisherman's Warf, and the Cable Cars. The staff were more than courteous and responsive. The free high speed internet in the rooms was via network cable which I thought was a bit behind times, but it was free, so can't complain too loud. The bed was firm clean and comfortable.

review.title: Great price, excellent location
review.reviewText: Hotel was conviently located, affordable, and served a normal breakfast. Eggs, biscuits and gravy, sausage, bacon, pancakes, coffee, juice, milk. Hotel staff was courteous, friendly. Two computers with printers available for guest, which made checking in at the airport quick and easy. The only down things for me was a slightly hard bed, and paper thin bacon. Other than those two, an excellent choice of hotel.

review.title: Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText:
good, clean, convenient hotel. Hot breakfast was busy but good. Beds were comfortable. ACross the street from fishermans wharf.

would definitely recommend
review.locationRemarks: fisherman wharf, union square, great highway, all along the coast line

review.title: Will NEVER go back
