review.reviewText: No high speed internet connection (WIFI) in rooms. TV out of the 1960's. Very late at night when young people were making noise in the hallway, no one answered a call to do something.

review.title: love it..will go back
review.reviewText: had a great time..can't wait til my next visit.

review.title: Love SF
review.reviewText: great location. hotel lacks a little quality. Breakfast was ok.

review.title: can' wait to go back
review.reviewText: Everything was wonderful except the parking was a high .

review.title: best location
review.reviewText: Best place if you are visiting and have no car.

review.title: Good Location, Comfy Beds
review.reviewText: Good overall value, close to fisherman's wharf & cable car.

review.title: No Complaints
review.reviewText: Quick and efficient check-in/out by friendly and courteous staff. Fantastic location for Fisherman's Wharf activities/restaurants/shopping, as well as cable car and street car stops. Hotel was clean and well kept; the daily complimentary breakfast was convenient and provided a number of choices. Our room, while not large, was a good size with a comfortable king-size bed, plenty of storage and additional seating. Perhaps a little dated, but we wanted to see the fabulous city and didn't spend much time in the room.

review.title: Great Stay at HIW Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: This is not a luxury hotel, but it is very clean, convenient and offers a great stay at a relatively affordable rate. I would absolutely stay here again. Breakfast is included and is "acceptable" given that it's a discount hotel and is offered as a buffet. If you want eggs benedict, don't look for them here.

review.title: Convenietly situated .
review.reviewText:
This hotel was extremely clean and a really good breakfast was provided.

The only downside was the high charge made for the parking of our car.

review.title: Very central location. Good value
review.reviewText:
Standard Holiday inn hotel.
Very comfortable. The breakfast was the only downer. Poor standard and selection of breakfasts.

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: Very convenient for walrf area, Room was always clean. Breakfast bar was very busy. Only problem was with an elevator that did not operate for a day.

review.title: Clean, convenient and confortable
review.reviewText: I totally loved my stay at this hotel; my only advice for future residents....get to breakfast before 8:30 am..... or risk missing out on the best items in the buffet i.e. blueberry muffins, omelets.

review.title: Superb Holiday Inn Express
review.reviewText: Stopped in this hotel for 4 nights, its pretty modern, decent size rooms with free wi-fi, breakfast is included which is pretty decent, but best thing about this hotel is its location in Fishermans Wharf, only 5 minutes walk to the coast, 5 mins to the F-line tram terminus, and 10 mins walk to 2 different Cable Car termini which take you into the heart of San Francisco.

review.title: was very happy with staff
review.reviewText: We were very pleased with the hotel and the staff.

review.title: Great stay
review.reviewText: We stayed at this hotel between September 5 - 9. Hotel was very convenient to Fisherman's Wharf and all the touristy stuff. Breakfast was good and not too crowded, though we are early risers. It did look pretty packed when we passed through around 9. Front desk (especially Steven(sp?)) was extremely helpful and polite. When we wanted to go to Oakland to catch a baseball game he was great in telling us how to get there on the BART. The room was not extravagent but it was sufficient and clean. Didn't have a view as we overlooked the inside of the hotel and all of the other windows. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel.

review.title: Nice place too stay
review.reviewText:
O.k. Men Working In Hallway @9=10 oclock.@ night Ifthey were going to work inform us
before we accept room
Rich R.

review.title: Almost ok!
review.reviewText: Been there, done that! Hotel as such was ok but it's not gonna rock your socks off. Plenty of fecken homeless and drugaddict people in the vicinity of the hotel during my stay, if you don't mind getting asked to hand out change everytime you exit this hotel then fine, be their guest!! I for one wouldn't go back!

review.title: A must to stay
review.reviewText:
As you walk in, you are greeted with a sense of class.The decor was up to date and inviting.
Friendly, professional and knowledgeable front staff.
Although there was a variety of choices for breakfast, the quality was generally average.
However, it is a great hotel and value.
Definitely would reccomend this hotel.
Will be back if we come to San Fransico again.

review.title: very good location just one block away from all the action and Piers
review.reviewText: A very nice place to stay

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText: Hotel was well maintained. Good breakfast every morning is included. Good deal considering the high room rate. Food was kept well stocked and cared for. Good location to walk to Fishermans Wharf area.

review.title: Second time staying here and would stay again and again!
review.reviewText: We love this hotel....the staff is nice...the rooms are clean and comfy....the location is superb.....they still serve a continental breakfast......we have no complaints what-so-ever!

review.title: Definitely book this hotel again
review.reviewText: Great location, able to walk down to the wharf where all the action is. Large room, huge bed and very comfortable. Brekkie wasnt fabulous, probably just the week we were there the hotel was obviously fully booked and the restaurant was packed, long queues and nowhere to sit, some people even had to resort to sitting out in the reception lounge to eat - not enough tables for everyone, but other than that we were very happy with everything and would definitely go back there.

review.title: Great Fisherman's Wharf Hotel
review.reviewText: Very satisfied with our whole experience at this hotel. Our room had plenty of space for our family of four. Hotel was very quiet and a comfortable walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf area. Staff were very friendly, accomodating, and helpful. Free breakfast was very good, but would recommend it be available until 10:00 a.m. Would definitely stay here next trip to Fisherman's Wharf area.

review.title: cant wait to go back
review.reviewText: great location staff very helpful great breakfast each morning woulg go again without question

review.title: Great location to Pier 39
review.reviewText: Holiday Inn Express is in a great location to attractions and for public transportation. The breakfast is nice but be prepared to wait if you don't get there early. We found the earlier we went the less people. The rooms are not air conditioned so tended to be a litlle stuffy but we did discover we could open the window. Very friendly employees and a nice hotel. Would recommend this hotel. My only other complaint is that the room doors closed very loudly.

review.title: Hohum
review.reviewText: Overall visit was met with a general HoHum attitude by most of the staff. Had basin faucet leaked profusely when turn on flooding back onto the bench top..clear the decks. Breakfast staff really didn't care & on our check out we were being picked up at 7:45 am sharp, we were not impressed with the 7:10 am opening of breakfast facilities, were still trying to finish coffee when pick up arrived. When approaching concierge on this matter they were reluctant to make waves due to 'Union' pressure!? We were comfortable, quite well appointed facility & enjoyed the convenience of location, but either the staff were under a lot of stress or Just didn't care about customer service. Seems they feel the Customer is an interruption to their days' duties instead of seeing the customer as the reason for their business!

review.title: Great hotel in wonderful location!
review.reviewText: You will not be disappointed in this hotel. Breakfast is so-so but gets the job done.

review.title: Great value for the money
review.reviewText: We liked it because it was close to Fisherman's warf and Pier 39, nice clean place, employees at the reception are very nice.

review.title: Friendly Staff
review.reviewText: The room was small but clean. Our floor was very noisy every night. We did not particularly care for the breakfast either. The eggs were overcooked, there was no fresh fruit, nor pancakes or French Toast. I have stayed at various other Holiday Inn Exxpress Hotels and was a bit disappointed in this one. But it was clean and convenient ot the Warf.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: Holiday Inn Expree Fishermans Wharf is a great inexpensive spot to spend you vacation in SF. Our room was comfortable and clean. It was close to all the attractions Fishermans Wharf has to offer. The free breakfast in the morning was a little bland, but hey, whataya expect for free?? Plently of fantastic resturants in the surrrounding neighbourhood to choose from.

review.title: Great location but a little noisy!
review.reviewText:
The good part: We loved the location and the staff were very nice and helpful! The bed was ok, a little firm but good enough.
We could walk to fishermans warf, the ferry for Alcatraz and to north beach and we even walked to china town and union square from here!
The free breakfast was pretty good but was always packed with people.

The bad part: The only complaint was that the cleaning staff must have had a door near our room because starting at 7am I kept waking to doors opening and closing loudly. The air conditioner cut off loudly too, enough to wake me every time it would shut off all night.

review.title: Will definetely come back
review.reviewText:
The location is fantastic, a few minute walk to Fisherman's Wharf and the main tourist strip with shops and good restaurants. The condition of the facilities is good too, it looks like it's been updated recently or it has been maintained well. Our room was very quiet, comfy and spacious with two double beds. The only downside of it is the breakfast was crowded, people had to line up to get food and some of them had to go back to their room to eat as there was no table left. They have wifi in the lobby not in the room which is OK. We didn't have a car but if you do, they have underground car park, not sure how much they charge for a day.
Overall we love the stay here and will for sure consider staying here again if we come back to SF.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Had a wonderful time. The Hotel was at a great location with in walking distance China Town, Little Italy and the Wharf. Continental Breakfast was an excellent way to start the day. Definitely would stay there again.

review.title: highly recommend
review.reviewText: We were extremely satisfied with the Holiday Inn Express FW. Staff was friendly and very helpful in time of need. They aimed to please and did. The breakfast was VERY VERY good. It was a full breakfast & hot. More than we expected and would HIGHLY recommend......

review.title: great location for san francisco
review.reviewText: Terrifice location with access to everything.....parking rates a little too pricey, but parking garage just around corner at half the rate made it ok. Hotel was perfect with full breakfast to help with meal expenses.

review.title: Very satisfied
review.reviewText:
The hotel was perfect, the surrounding neighborhood was excellent only a few steps of the Fisherman Wharf, Embarcadero and Lombard St.
Free breakfast and comfort. Yes, I would recommend this hotel.

review.title: Will stay here again!
review.reviewText: My sister and I stayed here for 2 nights on our way to Maui and 2 nights after our trip to Maui and we both liked the atmosphere and room better at Holiday Inn Express Fisherman's Wharf. This was our first trip to San Francisco and we can not wait to return again next year and stay here. The location is great and the breakfast buffet was delicious.

review.title: "Good Hotel Great location"
review.reviewText: Reception staff friendly and very helpful,Room very good, maid service excellent.Good breakfast to start the day on.Great location short walk to Fishermans Wharf.

review.title: Very nice Hotel near to the turist placeses of San Fracisco
review.reviewText: i recommend to travel to San Francisco, and stay in Holiday inn, they have a good service, very comfort room and very accessible to shopping stores of souvenirs and many other things...

review.title: Needs Updating
review.reviewText: The rooms were clean but need to be brought up to date - newer tv's, pillows and bedding. When we checked in our room wasn't ready but we were promised an upgrade. A few hours later our room with the upgrade was ready but the front desk attendant forgot my most important request - a king size bed. So our upgraded room was 2 queen size beds which we did not need or want. The front desk attendant told us their was nothing she could do; that there were no other rooms available. When we insisted on speaking with the manager, he was able to make the room change for us and apologized for the inconvenience. The free continental breakfast was very nice but they ran out of food quickly.

review.title: Within walking distance to all the attractions at Fisherman's Wharf.
review.reviewText: We stayed here for 6 nights. The only complaint would be the $44.00/day for valet parking!

review.title: Great stay
review.reviewText: San Francisco is one of my favorite cities to visit. The hotel location was good, we wanted to be near the water and walking distance up the hill to the North Beach neighborhood (Little Italy). The staff were friendly and efficient. My only criticism is that the rooms do not have WiFi, only cable internet which does not work with an IPad. Other than that, I would stay here again.

review.title: NOT IMPRESSED
review.reviewText:
ARRIVED IN SAN FRANCISCO WITH GREAT EXPECTATIONS OF THE HOLIDAY INN EXPRESSS. HOTEL WAS CLEAN AND REASONABLY COMFORTABLE BUT OH!! THE BREABFAST.
WE HAD BEEN LOOKING FORWARD TO THE "BUFFET BREAKFAST" AS PART OF THE ENJOYABLE HOLIDAY EXPERIENCE. I CAN SAY THIS IS THE WORST BUFFET BREAKFAST WE HAVE EVER HAD (POSSIBLY TO WORST BREAKFAST OF ANY KIND). THE BUFFET WAS LIMITED AND CONSISTED OF JUICE, 2 TYPES OF CEREAL (CORNFLAKES AND NEON RINGS?) EGGS (ONE DAY OMELETTE ANOTHER DAY SCRAMBLED) ALL MADE FROM POWDERED EGGS, A MEAT OR PROTIEN THAT SOMEWHAT RESEMBLED A FLAT HAMBURGER, TOAST AND TEA AND COFFEE.

OH, AND ALL THE CROCKERY WAS PAPER AND THE CUTLERY PLASTIC.

THE WHOLE EXPERIENCE DID NOTHING FOR THE SPIRITS

review.title: Value hotel in an area that makes it easy to get around to tourist attractions
review.reviewText: This hotel provided just what I was looking for: good value in an area that made it easy to get around to all of the main tourist attractions. My girlfriend and I walked to a large portion of our destinations, but had to cab, or walk and cab to some simply due to distance (Golden Gate Park, Haight-Ashbury neighborhood, etc.) The room itself was nothing special, but I expected that going in. The bed was comfortable and the room was clean. Was just a touch small and no view, again as expected. The breakfast buffet was a life saver and made it easy to get the day going. Overall, it was a nice, clean hotel that met my expectations.

review.title: Middle of the road
review.reviewText:
This hotel's location is close to the waterfront, however at night time, the area is full of homeless people. Although they tend to leave you alone, it's still a little intimidating to walk your family past the hordes.
Parking is a joke. It was about $45 (give or take a dollar) to park your car there each night. I really expected the car to be detailed and have the oil changed at that price. Wow.
The room was very clean. I give high marks to the cleaning staff. They do an excellent job.
The decorating of the hotel looks a little like Pee Wee's playhouse. It's a little odd, but then, we didn't spend a lot of time hanging around the halls or lobby.
The buffet breakfast was ok, but was extremely crowded. We chose to go out for breakfast. Oh, when booking the hotel, one of the options was to purchase the buffet. Don't do it. It's free nonetheless. Just book your room.
All in all it wasn't a bad hotel. It's close to the waterfront and it's clean. If you prefer to spend time in the hotel, I would suggest something a little higher end. If you're going to be out exploring and just need a clean place to rest your head, this isn't a bad choice.

review.title: Touristing prefered
review.reviewText: Excelent location for tourists. Easy access to attractions, walking distance for cable car stations and for alcatraz ferries and for dinner in very good restaraunts. Hotel breakfast, was basic, enough for an early start.

review.title: Wonderful place to stay!
review.reviewText: I highly recommend this hotel if you are staying in San Francisco. It is located close to restaurants, bars, shops, Fishermans Wharf, just about anything you need! The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful and didn't mind the 100 questions a day we asked!

review.title: Very nice for SF on Fisherman's Warf
review.reviewText: Liked the Hotel, liked the service, but the Continental Breakfast could have a little better. Scrambled eggs each day got a bit old. Needed more then one pancake maker. But great location to Fisherman's Warf and other SF attractions. Able to walk most anywhere.

review.title: Great location, poor breakfast
review.reviewText: The location was fantastic and the service was great. Only complaint we had was with the quality of the complimentary breakfast. The space allocated for breakfast was far too small for the number of guests. We always had to wait in line and when we got to the front, most of the food was gone. Yes, I know it's free, but we have stayed at other Holiday Inn Express hotels with great complimentary breakfasts.

review.title: Wish we could have stayed longer
review.reviewText: Hotel was in a perfect location; very clean; good breakfast; helpful staff; we loved it - if we ever get the opportunity to go back to San Francisco, we will definately stay there......

review.title: great time and very friendly
review.reviewText: Hotel conveniend - great time- very infromative group working and glad to give us lots of good advice

review.title: best location
review.reviewText: it was one block to the wharf and one block to the cable car. we had five days and not enough time to do everything.

review.title: Taking my family with me next time.
review.reviewText: Great free breakfast every morning, two blocks from the bay, everything you could want in walking distance, Staff was very friendly and helpful.

review.title: san fransisco holiday inn express
review.reviewText: convienient location, priced right,

review.title: Breakfast was too much hassle, No Wifi signal in our room but overall very SATISFIED :)
review.reviewText:
We checked in early because our flight landed since 7am. We were hang around and decided to try get a room at 11am and the front desk was nice enough to accommodate us. She warned the breakfast is closed at 9:30am, and we were just 'how is it will be "closed"?

The bed is comfy as other Holiday Inn :) the hotel provide free wifi internet access, but there's no connection in our room :( our room is in the corner, i guess that's the reason.
We managed to get down to breakfast area just right before 9:30am. As soon as the clock hit 9:30am, the staff came out and turn off the lights of whatever appliance that was warming the food. another staff came out to lock the fridge that has yogurt and milk. I don't care to just hog the food. But it just look ridiculous to me. So we didn't bother to come down for breakfast for the rest of our stay, too much drama.

But overall we love the stay. The hotel were just walking distance away from everything, the pier 39, pier 33, the turn-around of Powell-Mason cable car, trader's Joe and many other places :)

Parking though, is $44 a night (ouch!) but that's San Francisco price.

review.title: Perfect location for us
review.reviewText: Great location.

review.title: GREAT SPOT
review.reviewText: All areas from the Wharf to downtown were great with lots of activities, resturants, shopping and sightseeing oppurtunities.

review.title: More Than Fine
review.reviewText: It did not disappoint. Quality hotel with courteous staff.

review.title: For thelocation of this hotel. I will come back again.
review.reviewText: The hotel was vary busy durring our stay, but the room we were given was grate and quiet. the hotel was vary polite and frendley. the location was perfict fo the activitys I pland. Parking is to expensive but parking cheeper next door. On our second day my wife and I got stuck in an elevator. and the emergencie phone didn't work. I was able to open the door and while talking with the on duty manager and front desk agent a maintenance person hade started working on it. I will recommend this hotel to all my frends.

review.title: Great Hotel at a great price
review.reviewText: Totally remodeled. Very friendly staff. Very clean hotel, and room. No problems at all. Very close to everything.

review.title: No water view rooms. Small percentage of rooms actually have street views.
review.reviewText: This hotel is a great location but don't count on a nice water view from your room. Its a 4 story hotel. Most of the room windows face each other in a closed cement courtyard. You can tell if it is raining or not, but there is no view except for the room window that faces yours. Included breakfast was okay. Especially liked the automatic pancake machine. Scrambled eggs were icky. Hotel staff were very accommodating.

review.title: just OK
review.reviewText: The best thing was the hotel was within walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf. I found the room clean but it had a strange smell almost mouldy. The free breakfast was not good and we ended going to Denny's which was a 2 minute walk around the corner. Would I stay there again.... no.

review.title: Clean and pleasant, tourist dive
review.reviewText:
The room itself was fine, big bed, shower mounted over bath. No minibar, no view. The cleaners cleaned and reset most mornings whilst i was at breakfast. The TV selection was pretty poor, I would have liked a decent news channel (CNN 'headline news' shows just showbiz news it seems)

The 'fitness room' is a couple of exercise bikes and treadmills. It's literally a fitness room. Apparently you have use of the swimming pool in the Holiday Inn next door, but I didn't make use of that. There's a 24 Hour Fitness nearby with a day pass of $15 which you may be able to negotiate down if you're going more than once.

Breaking was plentiful - pancackes, cereal, buns, bagels, toast, egg, bacon, coffee, juice etc. You can scoff as little or as much as you like; there's also a Denny's around the corner if you fancy a pig-out.

The desk staff are helpful.

Fisherman's Wharf is a tourist dive - but then I was there as a tourist. It takes about half an hour to get to Market St (bus), longer on the cable car or the F-Line tram. If you're staying for more than a few days you'll exhaust the boat rides & tourist stuff at Fisherman's Wharf, and I found it a bit of a hassle travelling.

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText: Overall we enjoyed being in the Fisherman's Wharf location. Close to cable cars, the trolley lines, and lots of restaurants and shopping to choose from nearby. Tour operators close by, too. The Holiday Inn Express offered a lot for us. The breakfast was probably the deciding factor in choosing this hotel, and for the most part, it didn't disappoint. We kept wishing the room had a refrigerator and microwave. We stayed a week and would have liked a place to keep some soft drinks and beers cold and a place to store left overs from our meals and a way to reheat them. Room was clean and efficient otherwise. Cozy would be the operative word. The lobby was inviting, but we were on the second floor and wished for a stairway to move quickly between our room and the lobby without having to wait for the elevator each time.

review.title: Great SF Wharf location
review.reviewText: Really enjoyed our stay and the holiday inn express - free breakfast offset the price of parking $44/day plus tax. Great location to wharf. Second time we've stayed there.

review.title: great location, clean rooms, great service. Recommended!
review.reviewText: Stayed on Mar/2011. Hotel's location is great, very close to Fisherman's Wharf main attractions like Pier 39, Ghirardelli Square and other restaurants. Also, there's a Walgreens on next block. Cable Car stop is also two blocks away. Very quiet (ask for a quiet room - not a great view, but who cares?) and clean hotel . Breakfast is ok. In-room Internet is terrible: too slow. If you need better speeds, go to the lobby and use the wi-fi. Water pressure from shower is not the best around, but at least the temperature is ok. Service staff very gentle , helped us with all our needs. Tips: parking is extremely expensive in that area, but you can park at Enterprise car rental parking lot for less than half the price of hotel's. Also, if you rent a car at Enterprise, they allow late returns (until 11:00 PM), charging a little extra for that. It's just 2 blocks away from the hotel. Another cool thing to do is to rent a electric bike from Plugz, just beside the hotel entrance.

review.title: Next time I want better weather.
review.reviewText: Flight cancelled due to Tsunami, rebooked next day. Pre-paid for shuttle which got caught in LONG delays due to St. Patrick's Day parade. But, once at the hotel, all was simply great. Weather not good, raining. But location of hotel was absolutely perfect. Guest services so accommodating Spent one whole day at Golden Gate Park accessed by bus and underground. On the way back, rode on bus through Haight Ashbury then, disembarking, following close behind was a vintage trolley ... not cable car. Hotel is an EASY walk to Boduns, Fisherman's Wharf, Ghiradelli's Square and boat to Alcatraz. Breakfast was a hassle ONLY because several high school groups also visited during our stay. Food was more than sufficient. Disappointed in swimming access, next door at Holiday Inn and outside ... too rainy to use the facility. We would definitely go back!

review.title: Convenient and helpful reception
review.reviewText: Hotel and breakfast very good value but unfortunately room was shabby and smelt of stale smoke.

review.title: Highly Recommend Holiday Inn Express @ Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Holiday Inn Express at Fisherman's Wharf exceeded our expectations in many ways! Desk clerks were very friendly and helpful, the lobby was large, well decorated, and very clean and comfortable. Room rates seemed very reasonable for the location. Our room was well maintained, very clean, and our king size bed was very comfortable. It was very quiet and we did not hear outside noises. Ice and a soft drink machine were very close to our room. The complimentary breakfast was definitely the best we have ever had at a hotel offering this, and there was a large area with plenty of tables to seat all the guests. The location was ideal for access to all the tourist sites in the fisherman wharf area, being just 2 or 3 blocks away. We were also just a few blocks away from the hop on/hop off bus system we used to travel around the city. We had also booked a Napa Valley tour and discovered this tour office was located next door to the Holiday Inn Express. San Francisco is a beautiful city and if we visit again, we will definitely stay at the Holiday Inn Express!

review.title: San Francisco
review.reviewText: Can't wait to return.

review.title: Definitely not a bad choice
review.reviewText:
Staffs are very friendly. Rooms are clean. And good breakfast too!
But there's no restaurant in the hotel, so there's no room service.
One downside, the internet service is not that good, its really, really slow.
And vending machines may not work in certain floors.

review.title: Very nice stay.
review.reviewText: Employees were helpful and friendly. King room was nice and clean. Buffet breakfast was good except for the items that needed to be hot (eggs, breakfast meats, biscuits,gravy) which were warm, cold by the time you ate them. Plenty of resturants close.

review.title: Absolutely the best choice at Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Other than one of the elevators being out of order a few times, and panhandlers around the corner sleeping in the sidewalk at night, the hotel is in a perfect location, great variety in the breakfast buffet, excellent room and kept clean all times.

review.title: safe tourist neighbourhood
review.reviewText: The frontdesk counter really helps us for changing room due to vending machine noise, booking limo to airport, let us inspect the room before we switch. It tooked 3 days(long weekend) to repair 1 of 2 lift in the hotel. The free breakfast selection contains wide variety of food. The eggs are terrible, coffee is fresh and hot, line up is long. Overall is good experience.

review.title: Great hotel with breakfast on Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Great hotel, clean, convenient location, helpful and pleasant staff and the room price includes breakfast which in quire unique at Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Great Hotel Pick
review.reviewText: This hotel had everything we desired. The breakfast was a great addition to the customer service and cleaness of the hotel. It was convient for walking to any site seeing events we wanted to attend. We will return, again.

review.title: A nice family hotel
review.reviewText:
Clean and comfortable. Nice staff. Very friendly and helpful. The hotel was a good location to all forms of transportation, including F line, trolley's, and the office for the Hop on Hop off tours that we used. Walking distance to everything, and when you get tired from the hills taxi's were always going by. Great hill walking,and for the Marina and Fisherman's Wharf.
The area is good, just in the evening it seemed the characters would come out. No doubt harmless, but like anywhere, walk with purpose.
Such a nice city, and a nice place to stay.

review.title: good location
review.reviewText: Good location, hotel/room was clean and inviting, quick response for extra pillows, freely gave us several coffee packages each day. Staff quick and friendly. Only disappointment was the breakfast if you stay longer than two days - (same tasteless items)

review.title: Left my heart in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Clean and modern hotel, convenient location. It would be nice if they upgraded all rooms with flat screen tv's and work on the breakfast option. Eggs were horrible, they were dry and crumbly and they ran out of fruit. There were also no potatoes as a choice. Even better would be if they added a turkey sausage/bacon instead of pork only.

review.title: DECENT OVERALL CONDITIONS, GOOD PRICE, GREAT LOCATION.
review.reviewText: GREAT LOCATION, BEST IN SF. NOT A LUXURY HOTEL. SMALL BUT FAIRLY CLEAN ROOMS, CLEAN BATHROOM, DECENT BREAKFAST BUFFET, FRIENDLY STAFF, ALL AT A GREAT PRICE.

review.title: Good price. Good value. Great Staff
review.reviewText:
We found this hotel pleasing and comfortable. The front desk staff was particularly helpful. The room was clean and utilitarian. We would stay at this
hotel again.

review.title: Great Hotel. Great Location
review.reviewText:
Loved this hotel! Service was great. People were very friendly, professional and really went out of their way to help. Only problem is that the view is not that great - which should be expected since hotels close to the wharf can't be over 4 stories high. But still, its location and convenience to everything and everywhere we want to go to was the prime reason we chose this hotel. And it paid off well.

Go with this hotel. You save. You are close to the wharf. And the hotel is nice :) . Would recommend staying at this hotel and wouldn't mind coming back to it should we go back to SFO again!

PS.

i just hate the fact that the bacon finishes so early :)

review.title: good memory
review.reviewText: so nice,

review.title: Very good for travelers who wants to stay near the Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Very good for travelers who wants to stay near the Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: " Great location"
review.reviewText: Only thing I would change is the breakfast was pretty gross!

review.title: Good value but parking costs were high
review.reviewText: The hotel is placed well, a couple blocks from Fisherman's Wharf. The breakfast buffet gets VERY crowded between 8:30 and 9am and the line can be substantial. But the hotel was very clean and well maintained. Parking cost was ridiculous but that's the case for most of SF. It was a good hotel for the price and we would stay there again.

review.title: Definately stay again
review.reviewText: Hotel has very nice entrance, rooms very clean. The location was superb. One block from cable car which our family loved to ride to Union Square. I would definately stay again. Buffet was better than any standard complimentary breakfast.

review.title: Will definitely book again on our next visit.
review.reviewText: We were very satisfied! Great location convenient to many attractions & transportation, nice hotel, and great complimentary breakfast.

review.title: Great Wharf hotel
review.reviewText: Had a great time. The HI Express bedding is wonderful. I love the soft pillows.

review.title: Perfect vacation
review.reviewText: The hotel was perfect

review.title: Great Experience
review.reviewText: Friendly staff made for a very enjoyable stay. Perfect location.

review.title: Nice hotel for the price and location
review.reviewText: The bed was not comfortable, had a view of another hotel room and the bacon was thin as paper. All in all we made the best of it. Nice hotel for the price and location

review.title: Handy Spot at a Good price
review.reviewText: Great location. Included breakfast was a convenient plus. Exercise room was very small but I never had to wait to use it. Avery economical way to stay in an expensive city.

review.title: Holiday Inn Express and Suites - great hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is as described in Expedia review. Room was good. Asked for fridge for husbands medicine and was not charged with it. Breakfast saved us a lot of money. Lots of variety, cereal, toast ,scrambled eggs, sausage, bacon, porridge, bagels, juices, milk, coffee, yogourts. Did not have car, but everything was within walking distance, or a bus ride away. Safeway supermarket nearby and Walgreens and a 7/11. had a really good time here, and would stay at this hotel again. Only downside is a lot of beggars/undesirables in the Fishermans Wharf area, so don't make eye contact with them.

review.title: San Francisco Here We Come!
review.reviewText: Very convenient location. Friendly staff. I was very comfortable.

review.title: you don't get what you don't pay for
review.reviewText:
Holiday Inn Express? Make that "Lite." Ripped carpet in front of my room. Free breakfast not available till after 6:30am. Gym? Yeah, but just 4 treadmills? Light bulbs out in room. Internet cable was broken.

I dropped off laundry. Got back late (11pm) and while in bed realized i hadn't seen my laundry back that i needed for the next morning. Called front desk. A lady said: "we are a limited service hotel...you will have to come get it." I said that no one ever said that on check in or drop off...and no hotel...including lower end places didn't deliver laundry. She said curtly: "we don't." I asked nicely if anyone was available to deliver it anyway. She said she would ask "a guy". I asked..."could you call me either way? She agreed.

30 minutes later. no call no laundry. I got up, got dressed, Went downstairs and a male was at the desk. I asked where the lady that answered by call was. He said he didn't know. I went through it all. He got my things and offered no apology for anything including the disappearing desk clerk who was incapable of courtesy, honesty of service.

Never, never, never, never, never....did I say never again.

review.title: Liked it.
review.reviewText: The hotel is extremely well located and very convenient to the Fisherman's Wharf area. It was also convenient for getting to downtown since the cable car turn-around was only a block and a half away. One very big disappointment was the continental breakfast. The eggs were cold, even when they were first brought in. There was no way (that we could spot) to heat up muffins. Overall, that aspect, which is important to us, was a real downer. Otherwise, I would recommend the place highly.

review.title: Great price, great location, great hotel!
review.reviewText: This hotel came at a great rate for the Fisherman's Wharf area. It is two blocks from the Pier and two blocks from the F-line trolley route so you can get anywhere quickly. The hotel was very clean and the staff was very helpful with information about the area. There is a free hot breakfast every morning with eggs, muffins, bacon/sausage, biscuits and gravy, cereal, cinnamon rolls, and yogurt. Our room was comfortable and very clean. There is wifi in the lobby and a ethernet connection in the room, both of which worked quite quickly. Overall, this was one of my best hotel stays and I highly recommend it.

review.title: Great location and very clean...would stay here again and probably will
review.reviewText: The hotel was very clean and accomodating. It looked as if they had just redone alot of the interior: carpenting, walls, fixtures. Hopefully they will be doing the same to the rooms. Don't get me wrong, the rooms were nice...I just expected more from the looks of the hallways and other.

review.title: Not Luxurious but everything I needed; Great location too!
review.reviewText: This is right where it needs to be; near Fisherman's Warf, close to cable cars, bus routes, restaurants, everything. Nothing glamorous about the hotel, but was exceptionally clean. Had a pretty good breakfast buffet also. I wouldn't have to think twice about staying there again.

review.title: Enjoyed
review.reviewText:
Would recommend, reasonable price, good location, free wireless,
Breakfast was only disappointment.

review.title: I will be returning For Sure.
review.reviewText: Awesome

review.title: will probably stay somewhere else the next time we go to SF
review.reviewText: It was what we expected.

review.title: San Francisco
review.reviewText: With the exception of $49 a night parking, an excellent value.

review.title: Good deal, close to wharf
review.reviewText: Very good deal for price. Rooms have been redone, breakfast was full , not just continental all mornings. Very close to fisherman's wharf, about 2-3 blocks. Safe neighborhood, very nice for tourists. From SFO took Bart down to embarcadero, then caught F-line to wharf. F-line gets busy in afternoon, but ok in morning.

review.title: Will stay someplace else next time.
review.reviewText: Very disappointing with the manager of this hotel.

review.title: A San Francisco treat!
review.reviewText: My family and I enjoyed our time at the Holiday Inn. We were a few feet from our tour bus and two blocks or less from the Warf, restaurants and shops.

review.title: Great price (esp. when combined with plane ticket package) and location.
review.reviewText: Very nice city.

review.title: Most impressed!
review.reviewText:
We found this hotel to be excellent value and a terrific location for anyone visiting San Francisco for the first time. The spacious lobby and common areas were very clean and in good repair. Our room completely met our expectations and the king size bed was very comfortable. The breakfast buffet offered enough variety for our 4 day stay, and although busy at times, the food was always plentiful.

We were able to walk to almost all the attractions including Fisherman's Wharf, the Alcatraz Tour boat launch, cable cars, the crooked street etc.

We would highly recommend this hotel.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: Very strategically located and we will stay there again

review.title: best stay for budget watcher!!
review.reviewText:
great location, friendly staffs, clean room and FREE breakfast!! What can you ask for more?? I had great time during my stay in Holiday Inn Express in FW.
I would recommend here to my friends.

review.title: Would definitely go back!
review.reviewText: We both enjoyed our stay. Would recommend it to family and friends. Employees friendly and helpful. Front desk great. Breakfast ok.

review.title: Impressed! Highly recommended!!!!!!!!!!
review.reviewText: Everything was great! Hotel was in excellent position near Wharf, cable cars, Golden Gate Bridge and restaurants. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Room was very clean, bed was comfy and very quiet at night! Breakfast was included and an added bonus as much better than in Holiday Inn Express in the UK! We could even print off our boarding passes in the lobby. Neighbourhood was also clean and we felt safe (although weren't out very late at night).

review.title: the wharf
review.reviewText: it is a wonderful place to stay and see the city

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Hotel was nice, clean, and in a great location (only two blocks from Fisherman's Wharf, walking distance to the cable car turnarounds, walking distance to Pier 39 and to the Alcatraz tour ferry). Hotel stay includes breakfast and we took advantage of the breakfast every morning of our stay and at different times each day. Despite varying our time when going down for breakfast, it was always cold, no matter what time we went down to eat. We would not recommend the breakfast, but when it's included in the price of the room, it's worth no additional charge. Plenty of places to eat within walking distance of the hotel.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Hotel was just what we expected from a Holiday Inn Express - great location, good neighborhood, clean, modern, helpful front desk staff. A little dissapointed with breakfast...not enough hot food/toaster space. Arriving towards the end of breakfast some food items had all gone and were not replenished - so eat early !

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: We spent one night in the Holiday Inn Express at Fisherman's Wharf. The hotel was in a great location to walk everywhere.We were only a couple of blocks from the water and Ghiradelli Square. The staff was very professional and friendly. We would recommend this hotel for your stay in San Francisco.

review.title: Much better than I expected
review.reviewText: Did not realize I was so close to Waikiki Beach and the market place. You could go expensive or cheap on your food. With a full kitchen you could even cook and save more money. Free parking was great!

review.title: Very impressed and great value.
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a perfect location for a tourist, near to the ferry buildings and the cable cars and trams.

review.title: Good value for area
review.reviewText: Everything is Fisherman's Wharf is touristy and over-priced...but that is how it goes in this part of the city. This hotel had a great location and I found it to be a better value than similar hotels in the wharf. Everything was as expected... the hotel even had recycling bins and composting in the rooms! The front-desk employee was very helpful.

review.title: Kindergarten teachers in San Fran!
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful stay at the "Holiday Inn at Fisherman's Wharf."

review.title: Will definitely stay at Holiday Inn Express every time I'm in San Francisco
review.reviewText: This is the best hotel I have ever stayed in! The staff were friendly and helpful and definitely went above and beyond. The rooms were large, quiet and the furniture was all brand new. This hotel had the most services of any I have ever stayed in. Two computers to check email, an amazing free breakfast buffet (no one would ever go hungry), fitness room, in suite fridge, sink, coffee maker and microwave and for anything else you may want (swimming pool, concierge, store, etc), the Holiday Inn is a short walk down the street. I would reccomend this hotel to anyone and everyone. I would definitely stay there anytime I'm in San Francisco!

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText:
Hotel had Excellent location. Great rate.
We were absolutely miserable on the plane. Crowded, and hungry.

review.title: prime location
review.reviewText: excellent location for all main attractions. We did not hire a car so it was an brilliant choice of location for us. Standard of room excellent and very clean. breakfast a bit basic and dining room always crowded but adequate. Main reception staff very helpful and cheerful as were all the people in San Francisco. A wonderful place to visit so much to see and do.

review.title: Great location, clean & friendly hotel
review.reviewText:
This is a great choice of hotel. Nothing fancy, but unless you plan to spend
a lot of time in your room, it's great. Fancy hotel is directly across the street.

review.title: Best in the Wharf!!
review.reviewText: Great hotel, great location, fantastic rooms, fantastic breakfast, Cannot fault it. Would stay again and tell all my friends.

review.title: Wharf San Francisco
review.reviewText: Everything was good. We enjoyed breakfast, the room was fine and the location was fantastic. I would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Recommended
review.reviewText: This hotel is an excellent value for the rate. Great location, easy access to both cable car lines, and the breakfast buffet made it the easy choice for our stay.

review.title: Great Place to be
review.reviewText:
Hotel was excellent, close to all that Fisherman's Wharf has to offer.Breakfast was great, room was clean, good size, comfortable bed and great shower.
Would definitely return to this Hotel.

review.title: SAN FRANCISCO 2010
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a great location. It is very easy to access all city transportation. We selected this hotel for the warm breakfast served daily. The staff is extremley friendly and very knowledgable about the city. Our room was very clean and somewhat updated but most of all quiet at night. Internet is provided in the lobby at no cost with printing.

review.title: Would definitely stay there again.
review.reviewText: The hotel was conveniently located on Fisherman's Wharf so we could walk to our destination or to public transportation. The staff of the hotel was wonderful....everyone knew all the answers to our "out of towner" questions, and were very helpful. Would definitely stay there again.

review.title: I left my heart in San Francosco
review.reviewText: What a great trip and it couldn't have happened without the excellent accommodations of the Holiday In Express. Daily maid service, complimentary breakfast....after 5 days, we needed something different....but it does provide a good assortment of items. The only complaint was the temperature of the room. It remained at 74 no matter how low we turned the theromostat. A maintenance person came up and made some adjustments, but it didn't help. Room remained too warm, but otherwise the hotel was great. The front desk staff even recommended a place for pizza delivery...one of the best I've ever had!!! Would recommend to anyone and will definately stay there again when we visit.

review.title: Great hotel close to everything in San Francisco
review.reviewText: I would highly recommend this hotel to everyone.

review.title: Walking distance to most all attractions
review.reviewText: We enjoyed being able to walk to most all tourist attractions from the hotel as we did not rent a car for our 5 day stay. Although there are many hills to climb we enjoyed the local scenery and were never rushed in our walking. The weather was windy and at times cold but we were dressed appropriately. It did warm up unexpectedly during our last 2 days there. As the hotel did not have a restaurant we found great food at various locations especially at Fisherman's Wharf.. The continental breakfast at the holet was crowded but there was always enough food for all. It was kept warm and the staff did an excellent job in keeping up with the guests. Our room was kept clean and the staff were very pleasant. The day before we left, we were graciously assisted in securing our shuttle to the airport.

review.title: very nice
review.reviewText: very nice

review.title: Sam and Cari's Stay in San Fran.
review.reviewText: The Holiday Inn Express was awesome. Everything seemed up to date and fairly new. Rooms were clean. Maids were friendly and kept the rooms perfect. Even the breakfast was good, free too. Free internet in the rooms and wireless in the lobby. All in all I'd give it 5 stars. Would definately stay there again if in SF. It was conveniently located to the Wharf, tons of stuff to do within short walking distance.

review.title: San Francisco Holiday Inn
review.reviewText: everything was good and the breakfast was good. It was not plentiful when you came down to eat later in the morning.

review.title: Okay, a bit overpriced.
review.reviewText: The Holiday Inn Express & Fishermans Wharf was okay. In a great location. Clean and tidy and had all the usual appoinments. Probably a bit overpriced.

review.title: Great vacation
review.reviewText: Had a great time. Easy to get around.

review.title: "Loved the City by the Bay"
review.reviewText: My daughter and I traveled to San Francisco in early August. We had the BEST time. Our hotel was right there at Fisherman's Wharf and was very clean. The hotel staff helped us find alternate ways to get places and they were always friendly and willing to help us. The people who cleaned our room were so nice and did a great job.The hotel provided a free and VERY delicious breakfast, also. We just had a great time!!!!!!!!

review.title: excellent location
review.reviewText: excellent location for Fisherman's Wharf, very good continental breakfast as well

review.title: Good location to see the Wharf
review.reviewText: After the problem with the room reservation the stay was great. It is close to Fisherman's Wharf, shopping, public transportation and more.

review.title: Great Hotel Would stay again
review.reviewText:
Fabulous location close to waterfront,great restaurants (need to eat before 7pm to avoid wait for a table) great cheap shopping nearby,close to train and cable car. Staff very friendly and helpful from time of checking in until departing.
Great breakfast . Room good size with huge double bed with a range of pillows from soft to hard. Rooms serviced every day by friendly trustworthy staff.

review.title: Good hotel
review.reviewText:
Hotel was clean, comfortable and provided a good breakfast.
Very close to Fisherman's Wharf and within easy access of all local transportation.
Would stay there again.

review.title: Great experience!
review.reviewText: This hotel is perfect. Great location, Friendly professional staff. The room was very clean and comfortable. Hop on the cable cars two blocks away. The hop on hop off sightseeing stop right around the corner. Pier 39 a short walk. The breakfast buffet was very good and convenient. Would definitely go back. Thanks for everything.

review.title: Will be back
review.reviewText: Our family of six stayed in three rooms at the Holiday Inn Express when we were in San Francisco for a wedding in July and we all agreed that it was a great hotel in a wonderful location. The beds were very comfortable and we all agreed that when we return to SanFran we will stay there again. Our relatives stayed at the Hilton in Union Square and we preferred our hotel to theirs.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText:
The room was clean, the service good except it took over 30 minutes in line waiting to get into the breakfast buffet! Also the mandatory valet parking costs $42.00 per day so be ready for this.
Besides these two things, the hotel was good and the location is great. Walking distance to numerous shops and restaurants, etc.

review.title: great place to stay in San Fransico
review.reviewText:
My husband and friends went to SF for a few days and stayed at the Holiday Inn Express. They were very accomodating as we hadn't booked together and they managed to get us rooms close together.
The breakfast was great. I had read some previous reviews where people weren't impressed. I was very impressed.
Great location, great deal,plus a great breakfast. I would go back to this hotel.

review.title: Great Hotel !!
review.reviewText: This is the second time we stayed here. The staff is friendly and helpful. The location cannot be beat, within walking distance of the wharf, shops, trolly. Free continental breakfast. Other that one of the elevators being down for the time we were there, everything about this hotel is great.

review.title: Conveniently Close to Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText:
It's a Holiday Inn Express.

Great location within 3 blocks of the Wharf. Nice sized rooms that allow smoking. Within walking distance of China Town and Down town and cable cars/Busses.

Parking for the hotel is $49.00 a night after taxes but the near by parking lots close around midnight so it'ss parking on the street or the hotel underground.

Polite and courteous staff.

review.title: would go back in a heartbeat
review.reviewText: Would go back in a hearbeat

review.title: A Very Convenient Bargain
review.reviewText: Our room was clean and neat and was well kept for our 7 day stay. The breakfast buffet was excellent, with eggs, sausage or bacon, biscuits & gravy, muffins, toast, fresh-baked cinnamon rolls, cereal, fruit, juices & coffee. A fellow traveler, who stayed at a nearby hotel without a buffet said that he had paid $6.85 for a bagel, so the buffet really was a great bargain! The hotel was very convenient, with all the Fisherman's Wharf attractions close by and street car stops within a block. We will definitely choose this hotel when we return to San Francisco!!!

review.title: Great place to stay!
review.reviewText: We had a great stay in San Fran the hotel was in a great location for all the things we wanted to do. Breakfast every morning was nice, wish they would have had skim milk and more selection on yogurt. I would recommend this hotel to friends and I would stay there again.

review.title: Not what I saw on the Internet
review.reviewText: I was quite disappointed when my daughter and I opened the door to our room. It was very different than the one I saw on the Internet when I checked out the hotel before booking our trip. The room was extremely small, there was no mirror in the room, and our view was of an air conditioning unit. The staff was wonderful and the location was great, but I'm not sure if i would stay there again.

review.title: good vacation
review.reviewText: very good

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: This hotel is very conveniently located for Fishefmans Wharf just a few minutes walk to Pier 39 etc. The staff were very helpful and the included breakfast a real bonus.

review.title: Fantastic Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText: Our stay at the Holdai Inn Express on Fisherman's Wharf was a fantastic one! The location cannot be beat for getting around to everywhere you need to go via walking, bicycling, trolley cars, or muni buses. There were plenty of places to eat and things to do very easily. When the holiday weekend approached, crowd got MUCH thicker and breakfast was a little tedious waiting in the line for food but thats a holiday for you. My only complaints were that one of the two elevators remained broken the last 3 days we were there and one of the gals at the front desk forgot to leave us some information about Six Flags in Vallejo(DO NO GO THERE...WASTE OF TIME AND MONEY!)Overall, great trip for my 12 year olds!

review.title: Fantastic location, great hotel
review.reviewText: Fantastic location for the wharf. Convenient, but quiet. Hotel is in great shape with some of the nicest personnel we've encountered. If you plan ahead, and are willing to spend some serious $$, get a reservation at Gary Danko's (up the street about 2 blocks) --- it's AMAZING !!! Also, you have to check out the character-shaped bread at the bakery on the wharf (can't remember the name, but it's on the corner & you can't miss it -- you can watch them make bread through the window) -- lobsters, crabs, alligators, teddy bears. I'm shooting myself for not bringing a crab back (to Maryland!) and serving it with crab dip !

review.title: Great place to stay.
review.reviewText: Very helpful staff. Clean and close to all the sites. Everything you need at a good price.

review.title: "Very Friendly Place"
review.reviewText: It was very convient to the wharf. Everything was within walking distance.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel room could have been bigger but adequate.Breakfast popular but chaotic. Ideal Fishermans Wharf location would stay at this hotel again

review.title: Perfect Location & Price
review.reviewText: This hotel is only a short walk from Pier 45 and the F-line streetcar stop, which you will get quite used to if you do not rent a car. We received an oustanding rate through Expedia and couldn't have been happier. The rooms were clean and efficient and the beds were very comfortable. We stayed three nights and enjoyed quiet, peaceful sleep each night. The staff were friendly and knowledgable. The ONLY complaint we could make is about the quality of the eggs at breakfast. Seriously though, who should complain about a well-stocked, wide-variety, FREE breakfast? We will definitely return to this hotel in the future.

review.title: San Francisco's BEST hotel
review.reviewText: Great Vacation

review.title: Good Hotel
review.reviewText:
Overall a good stay. The only thing we were slightly disappointed with was the morning breakfast. TONS of people so there was not where to sit and the line for food extremely long. However, I am sure that is hard to figure out how to feed that many people.

Fantastic location.

review.title: Great location -
review.reviewText: Hotel is located one block off of Fishermans Wharf. The hotel is new, clean and very comfortable. Full breakfast in the morning was delicious.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Hotel was great, wonderful location, very clean. Only problem..... $43.00 a night to park my car in the parking garage!!!!!

review.title: A Gem in the Heart of San Francisco
review.reviewText:
Holiday Inn Express San Fran was in the heart of the Fisherman's Wharf. Everything was within walking distance. The only cab I had to take was from the airport. The staff were helpful and friendly and gave me great advice on getting to and from locations. Continental breakfast was great. They even had a few computers available for us to check our emails, flights, etc.
I will definitely be going back to this hotel!

review.title: Great Hotel!!!
review.reviewText: This hotel was in a great location. Close to the waterfront. Near many good restaurants. Close to tour companies and attractions. Everything was in walking distance.

review.title: what a great experience
review.reviewText: overall review it was one of our most pleasant vacations we have taken. the food and entertainment was just great.

review.title: Great location; needs updating.
review.reviewText: We were not impressed with the overall condition of this hotel - this hotel needs updating. We chose this hotel because it is in a great location and it was reasonably priced. As soon as we got off elevators, the halls smelled of stale smoke. Couldn't smell it in rooms but in the hallway. The daily maid service did not pick up, ie., empty soda cans, empty cups, etc. To top it off, valet parking was $43 a day - ouch! Total rip-off. Would not go back. One plus, the free breakfast - I guess they have to compensate since amenities are lacking.

review.title: Would stay again
review.reviewText: Would stay at this hotel again. Very nice, good breakfast, and great location. Valet parking is a little expensive, but understandable due to location.

review.title: Left my heart in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Hotel was in a very convenient location, close to public transportation. Rooms were very clean and updated. Breakfast was adequate, much better that a continental breakfast. Everything worked (elevator, ice machine, etc.) No pool or hot tub, but I guess that's common in San Francisco.

review.title: Great hotel in Fisherman's Wharf-location and comfort
review.reviewText: Holiday Inn Express was a great hotel as far as location, amenities and comfort were concerned. We had no complaints with the room or the hotel. Staff were very friendly and professional. Breakfast was so-so but it was okay for cereal and toast which is a bonus on any holiday. No fridge in the room though so bringing back cold drinks etc to the room was difficult although there was an ice machine in the corridor. Overall a very good hotel and I would definitely stay there again.

review.title: It was wanderful to be there
review.reviewText: The location was good, breakfast wae exelent and the comfort of the room was perfect

review.title: Close to everything.
review.reviewText:
We loved being on the 4th floor. We called it our Penthouse. Our view was not good (facing another building) but we didn't care because we weren't in the room that often. The housekeeping personnel was super friendly and did their jobs so efficiently. Breakfast covered everything one would need but I wish they would've changed the egg options (how 'bout hard boiled?). We really didn't mind going to the connecting Holiday Inn to do our wash but I wish there was an internal door instead of having to walk outside to get there.

Otherwise, we loved this hotel and would definitely stay there again. It was very comfortable, pleasant, clean and friendly!

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: Holiday was in the perfect area, perfect to trolley stop, the piers, establishments and quite easy to get to town and stadium by car due to where the hotel is located. Great area to be able to walk around in the evening.

review.title: VERY NICE PLACE TO STAY
review.reviewText: OUR STAY WAS EXCELLENT! THE ROOM WAS VERY CLEAN AS WAS THE BATHROOM. THE BREAKFAST WAS VERY GOOD. EGGS, BACON, TOAST, MUFFINS, BANANAS, AND AWESOME CINNAMIN ROLLS EVERYDAY. HELPED KEEP COST DOWN SINCE IT STAYED WITH US UNTIL EARLY AFTERNOON. HOTEL WAS VERY CLOSE TO ALL SIGHTS. WE WALKED TO ALMOST EVERYTHING. WOULD STAY AGAIN AND RECOMMEND IT TO OTHERS.

review.title: Good Location-Good Price!!!
review.reviewText: Loved everything about our stay in San Francisco!!! The hotel was a great location. Trolleys hit main points, Hop on hop off is a great way to get History of San Francisco. We loved Suzanne our tour guide.

review.title: I would have no reservations about staying at the Hoilday Inn Express again
review.reviewText: It was a great trip with only minor setbacks.

review.title: Will go back there in a heartbeat...very good location
review.reviewText: the hotel was in a good location to everything we wanted to see - would go back again.

review.title: Little gem of a hotel.
review.reviewText: This hotel is excellent value for money and is in a fantastic location only a few blocks from Fishermans wharf. The staff were friendly and courteous and check in was very quick. The room was a good size and included a safe, iron,board and hairdrier. I loved the huge bed which was very comfortable. I couldnt fault the cleanliness of both the bedroom and the bathroom, which was absolutely spotless. There were always plenty of fluffy towels and complimentary toiletries. Having a coffee maker available was a welcome addition and the breakfasts were good and plentiful, though these could be varied a bit more from day to day. Location couldnt be better! Trams,trolley buses and ferries all close by. So pleased we stayed here rather than in the city centre. If you want to get out and about there are plenty of tour operators nearby to book excursions. All in all a little gem of a hotel, and I would certainly recommend it.

review.title: Great stay!
review.reviewText: This is the second time we have been to San Francisco and this hotel. We loved the city and the hotel as much the second time as the first! The comp breakfast really helps with our budget and the front desk staff are friendly and helpful. Our room was quiet, clean and we didn't want to leave! We loved being able to print off our return boarding passes! Can't wait to return!

review.title: Fantastic Value for a Fantastic Location
review.reviewText:
This hotel is in a fantastic location, you are 1 block down from a historic cable car turning point and one block up from fishermans wharf where you have the historic tram lines so it makes travelling around the city really easy, and it's only a short walk (or tram ride!) to Pier 39.
The hotel couldn't have been cleaner and the staff were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast saved us a fortune for the week we were there although some day's it was so busy it was a struggle to find a chair, and by the end of the week we were becoming bored of the same choices.

review.title: Great San Fran Location
review.reviewText:
Breakfast was great, try the cinnamon buns in the buffet. It also has fruit, yogurt, cereal, bagels, eggs, bacon etc.
Great location to the wharf, helpful staff gave us directions for muni, walks etc

Clean room, comfortable bed, have no complaints at all.

review.title: Would definatley stay their again
review.reviewText: The staff were very friendly and helpful. It was nice having a hot breakfast buffet every morning. We did use some of the other services at the holiday inn a block away (such as the concien). We would have used the pool but the weather was to cool. The location is great. We were withing walking distance to fishermans wharff and the cable car station.

review.title: We will definately go back!!!!
review.reviewText: This is a very nice hotel with a good breakfast! The staff is all very friendly and helpful. We will most definately be back!

review.title: Can recommend
review.reviewText: clean well maintained hotel, didn't especially enjoy all disposable plates / cups/ cutlery etc everyday for breakfast but seems we live in a disposable world!

review.title: Perfect location for a first time trip. Worth redoing!
review.reviewText: For a last minute trip we were totally impressed and certainly feel the hotel was in a prime location for us to access all we needed for such a short stay.

review.title: good location, friendly and clean
review.reviewText: we had three nights at the Holiday Inn Express Inn. It was a short walk to the Wharf and the attractions. I would stay there again and recommend this to anyone.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: This hotel is located right on the Wharf and right on the bus line which run into town, Chinatown, or to golden gate bridge. It is a 10 minute walk either direction to the Cable car turn around. 10 Minutes to Ghiradelli and about 20 minutes to Pier 39. The complementary breakfast was one of the features our family of four was attracted to. A full arrange of coffee, juices, sweets, fruits, yogurts, cereals and a hot offering (eggs and bacon or sausage.) Not the best quality or selection, but a good start to the day. They had something for everyone. The breakfast was clear up to about 8 AM, then it was pretty busy with a line until closing. They keep refreshing the food right up to closing. They also have complementary wifi internet (24 hour usage is free) and free computers in the lobby for looking up sites and such as well as printing boarding passes. We had two double beds in our room and my complaint would be that there was not enough counter space to put things both in the room and bathroom. Good location and I have no issues with the facility or staff.

review.title: Great place to come home to after seeing San Fran all day!
review.reviewText: We would stay here again. The room was comfortable. The continental breakfast was convenient; perhaps not the best food, but worked for starting out our days of sight seeing!

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: We arrived a half hour before check in time but the hotel was ok with that. Parking is expensive, but the day you check out you dont have to pick up your car until 5 which is nice. The hotel is in an excellent location, the rooms are nice, and the breakfast was really good (they need more seating though).

review.title: On the wharf
review.reviewText: Good trip

review.title: Well placed and welcoming
review.reviewText: We were made very welcome both by the parking valet who was expecting us and by reception. Rooms are clean and modern with the standard facilities we've come to expect from a US hotel. The hotel is very well placed for Fisherman's Wharf. An added plus was the fact that there was a Safeway within walking distance. Parking a bit pricy but it is at a premium in San Francisco.

review.title: Recommend
review.reviewText:
Great location. Staff were very helpful. No refrigerator in room - which we knew when we booked. Coffee making in room - but is in bathroom.
Easy access to san francisco - trams, cable cars, tours, wharf area.

review.title: Great Location at the Wharf
review.reviewText: This hotel's location is perfect, just two blocks from Cable Car station and Muni F. Hotel's staff is very kind, rooms are very comfortable and clean. Breakfast table was great, although tables are too few for the morning rush of most tourists.

review.title: Loved San Fran
review.reviewText: Stay was very comfortable. Rooms were very clean and nice. Having complimentary breakfast was very convenient. Service was great too. Due air travel restrictions, I could not carry toothpaste/shaving cream and needed it first thing next day morning. The front desk promptly offered to help. location is great as well. Tour buses commence from/end at Fisherman's wharf and hotel is walking distance from there.

review.title: Great Hotel: Great location, Nice Room, Hearty Breakfast :)
review.reviewText: We had a great experience with this hotel- staff was friendly, room was clean and adequate & the breakfast was also quite nice- better than expected. Location was excellent- walking distance to many of the popular attractions... especially Fisherman's Wharf and Ghiraldelli Square... Highly recommend it & would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Spring Break 2010
review.reviewText: Good location. Nice breakfast buffet (family friendly). Good for sleeping and leaving. Would be nice if there were a pool & hot tub attached.

review.title: Loud rooms, no view and generally not impressed
review.reviewText: I visited the Holiday Inn Express at Fisherman's Wharf while on business. My first issue was that the computers in the "business centre" were broken the first day, so I had to truck over to the Holiday Inn and use their computers to print off my work documents (on the positive side, the printer was free!) The first night I barely slept because of how loud the hotel was. I could hear people opening and closing their doors, people running through the hallways and even the sound of the elevators. I was also upset to discover that my room looked out onto a concrete courtyard -- so I had no view at all. I probably could have asked for another room -- but I was too tired to be bothered. My final issue was the morning I was meant to check out I had ordered a shuttle to the airport. When the shuttle arrived early, the front desk called me. But the phone was broken in my room, so it seemed that no one was on the other end. I repeatedly said "hello, hello, I can't hear you" -- but when I came downstairs the front desk person said he had sent the shuttle away because I didn't come downstairs as soon as he called me. I suppose it was a misunderstanding, but I was annoyed since the broken phone meant I had no idea he was calling to tell me the shuttle was there and I had to leave right at that moment.

review.title: great stay
review.reviewText: nice, affordable, clean, convienent and a nice modern decor

review.title: can't wait to go back to San Francisco !!!!!
review.reviewText: we loved the location. very accessible to everything. the kids can not wait to go back this summer.

review.title: Good Deal on Hotel in Fisherman's Wharf, San Franisco
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice enough. The room was clean and the service people were polite and attentive. The breakfast was good but after a few days, I was bored with what they had. Wished they have more fruit.

review.title: Good except parking garage
review.reviewText:
The hotel was convenience to use transportation and seeing Fisherman's Wharf around the hotel. Pier 39 the most famous pier was two or three block off and easy to get by walking.
The room I used was looked clean but has no refrigerator, but no bothered.
The only thing annoyed was about parking that the hotel's one was too expensive, however, I used one-night street parking and one-night public garage. I don't know how people use the hotel garage with that expensive charging.
As an improvement of the service, there's no need to be valet parking and unnecessarily expensive even though SFO is the north west most expensive city.

review.title: convenient location, hotel in need of updating
review.reviewText:
The hotel is in a great location, too bad the condition of the hotel leaves much to be desired.
Although the staff is friendly, courteous, and extremely helpful, the rooms are in need of repair and updating.

review.title: Great Customer Service...
review.reviewText: The staff at the hotel was exceptional, really went out of their way to answer any questions we had. Room was nice and clean. We had a mini-suite was kind of bummed that what they did was remove the table and put a couch there, so actually room wasn't any bigger then a standard room.

review.title: San Francisco - would stay there again for sure
review.reviewText: The people at the hotel were extremely friendly and very helpful when asked how to get to certain parts of the city. Would definitely go there again. It was very convenient to Fisherman's Wharf, and Ghiradelli Square, and a short bus ride from China Town and Union Square. All and all an A+

review.title: The best location
review.reviewText: This hotel is really nice, breakfast is really good and the best of all is the location, you can find everything you need really close

review.title: Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText: I love Holidays Inn as I find them nice and clean. This one was really nice and exceeded my expectations. I read hotel reviews and thought I would try it and I am glad I did. The hotel is close to Fishermans Wharf and easy to get to anywhere. The breakfast was great, hotel was really updated and even had computers to print boarding cards. My only complaint was the vans used as airport shuttles was a bit scarey and we wont use tha service again as the van felt like it was going to fall apart and the driver was confused but this was not the hotels fault. Try this hotel if staying down at the Wharf as it is worth it but dont get ot confused with the other Holiday Inns as there are 3 in total. Take a risk here and you wont be sorry so worth it!!If you love seafood Joe's Crab Shack is a fun restaurant and Boudin is famous for Clam Choweder and fresh baked sour dough bread but the aquararium was boring!

review.title: Very happy
review.reviewText: we had a great experience. checking in was easy. the staff was pleasant and helpful. Having breakfast available every morning certainly makes our day easier. An airport to hotel shuttle would have been wonderful.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: It was good and affordable. I would recommend. Hollywood diner was great

review.title: Calgary Couple loved San Fran!!! Great Location everythings right there!
review.reviewText:
This hotel was great, awesome location, right down by the Wharf and everythings right there within walking distance, or a quick bus ride. Breakfast was ok, they offered pretty much everything but I like it a bit healthier. Not much for fruit. But still great for free breakfast.
Bed was great, a little firm which is good for our bad backs.
Overall was a great place to stay.
Only thing I didnt like was the fan in the washroom stays on as soon as you turn-on the lights, and it was loud, so for just getting ready I found it annoying to listen to that. Pretty minor though.
Loved San Fran can't wait to go again!!!
Calgary Canada.

review.title: mini vacation
review.reviewText: For the amount of time in the room, it was acceptable and clean

review.title: I'll go back again
review.reviewText:
Overall, our stay at the hotel was pleasant. The staff members were friendly & courteous. However, it seems there was only one staff covering the front desk regardless of the number of guest needing assistance. We had to wait 15 minutes at the business center for someone to add paper to the printer because there was only one staff handling both the business center area and front desk. By the way, you can print your own flight boarding pass at their business center. That saved me time at the airport.
Hotel location was perfect for us. After long days of sightseeing & wine country tour, we just went back to the room, rest for an hour and were able to casually walk down to the Fisherman's Wharf. It was a short walk and we felt comfortable in the neighborhood.
Served breakfast needed some minor improvement. There was a day when there was no hot water or decaf tea and the counter where the beverages were being served needed cleaning (beverage spills all over). What I liked about their breakfast was the number of options (cereal, yogurt, scramble eggs, cheese omelet, sausage patty, bacon, fruits, bagel, muffins,etc.) for the guest to choose from.
Our room was clean and the bed/pillows were comfortable. I liked having a locked safe in the room as well as an iron with ironing board, hair dryer and a radio/alarm clock.
I issues I found were very minor. I would stay in this hotel the next time I’m in San Francisco.

review.title: Good quality for a good price - awesome location to explore the Fisherman's Wharf area.
review.reviewText: This hotel was very lovely - from the friendly staff, clean rooms and lobby, continental breakfast and location !

review.title: This Hotel exceeded our expectation by an easy mile
review.reviewText: Upon arrival, the staff were very courteous and helpful. We were very impressed with the hotel and the room. The breakfast area was very clean and easy to access, with an excellent selection of cereals and hot food (eggs, sausage, toast and bagels etc. The cleaning staff did an outstanding job every day. The hotel was only one block from fishermans wharf, where there was lots to do and see, and was also very close to trams and cable cars. We would definately stay at this hotel again.

review.title: Very Comfortable.
review.reviewText: The closet doors and in room safe needed a bit of attention upon arrival, however well before we settled in for the night maintenance was in to attend to both items.

review.title: very sound proof rooms
review.reviewText: will surely stay there again and again.
review.userLocation: islahujan de los membrillos, jalisco, mexico

review.title: good value
