review.reviewText: location was great, two blocks from Fishermans wharf, staff was very good and free breakfast was what you would expect from a Holiday Inn Express, just fine. We were told online room had a king size bed but was just a queen and the room was small but overall avery good value and location, I would definely stay there again

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText:
The staff was very friendly and accommodating. Our room was comfortable and clean. The biggest thing I worry about is bedbugs, but I did not have that experience here. Concierge was really helpful. They recommended different restaurant aeveryday for us and all the restaurants were great, especially Scoma's.

The area was nice. It's close to all the good restaurants, walking distance to a lot of the other neighbourhoods (e.g. North Beach, Chinatown) and the hotel was close to all the bus routes/cable cars. Also, the area is very family friendly. Lots of attractions at Fisherman's Wharf and Pier 39.

The only complaint I have is the breakfast buffet. I wish there were more of an option and the food wasn't that great. The scrambled eggs were too watered down, the muffins were too sweet, and the sausage was too greasy. I would recommend eating at the cafe just outside of the hotel or eating at Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Great location and very nice hotel. I've stayed here twice.
review.reviewText: This is a very decent hotel if you want a great location for sight seeing in San Francisco. It is not a luxury hotel, but it was definitely perfect for what we needed on this trip. We were so busy sight seeing that we only went to the hotel to sleep. The breakfast was great, too. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to SF. I've stayed here twice now.

review.title: very impressed
review.reviewText: the hotel is located blocks from all transpotation in a nice area - blocks to fishermans wharf. The staff was very helpful- the breakfast buffet just fine. Cablecars and streetcars within 2 blocks of the hotel. We felt very safe walking back to the hotel at any time.

review.title: Great location and service.
review.reviewText: The Hotel location is perfect and the staff is friendly and very helpful. I would stay here again.

review.title: Great spot by the Warf
review.reviewText: This was a great hotel for a quick visit to San Francisco. The staff was friendly, the hotel was clean and very close to the Warf. The only downside was the parking fee, but you really don't need a car! We'll definately stay there on our next visit to San Fran!

review.title: Love this Holiday Inn Express in Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: I just completed my second vacation trip to SF in 4 months and stayed both times at the Holiday Inn Express in Fisherman's Wharf. I am very pleasantly surprised with the facilities, rooms and service for a Holiday Inn Express - frankly I was just looking for a "cheap hotel" and found that this is so much more! It's pure value for your money. And a great location - can walk to cable car, Pier 39 and Bay cruises in minutes. Rooms are clean and fresh, beds are comfortable. Breakfast included. Will definitely stay here again!

review.title: great price and location
review.reviewText: The hotel is conveniently located at about 2-3 blocks from fisherman's wharf. The room was well furnished and I liked that there was a denny's restaurant situated close by for a late-night supper.

review.title: Left our hears in SF.
review.reviewText:
Hotel staff were friendly and helpful. A room away from the elevators was requested and received. The room was spacious, clean, safe and quiet. Very good value, location was excellent. Breakfast was included - a bonus - and offered something for everyone. Would definitely recommend to others and return in future. This was selected because it was Expedia's top pick.

The best tip we have is to order a City Pass on-line. It's a booklet of 5 coupons to SF's best attractions for about 40% off. Includes unlimited use of public transit for up to 9 days.

review.title: Would definitely go back
review.reviewText:
Plusses:Great location, friendly staff, hot breakfast included

Negs: Bed OK, pillows too fluffy, no shuttle service

review.title: Great Experience
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice and was in close proximity to all of the tourist attractions in San Francisco. We were extremely happy with our stay at the Holiday Inn. They served a great FREE breakfast in the morning and has a 24 hour denny's right around the corner.

review.title: Pleasant surprise!
review.reviewText: The hotel was actually a very pleasent surprise. The staff was extremely helpful. The breakfast was more than what we expected. The room itself was clean and comfortable. The neighborhood was a mixture of old San Fransisco and new San Fransisco. The only complaint was that the TV did not offer a wide variety of channel choices. But then again, we don't go on vacation to stay in the room watching TV. We wished we could stay longer.

review.title: Will go back in the fall
review.reviewText: The hotel was at a good location to sighseeing, catching a bus, or the street car, etc. It was less than 3 blocks to Pier 39. The breakfast was hot and filling.

review.title: Fantastic experience at this hotel.. 3 star hotel class that gives you more than most 4 stars hotels
review.reviewText:
Very clean, very quick check in and out. We arrived around 9:30am and they already have a room for us and let us check in without any problems.

Rooms are very clean, a tad on the small side for a queen bed type room. Non-smoking room really meant non-smoking rooms, not a hint of smoke smell in the room.

Parking is a little bit expensive ($49 with tax) but around the fisherman's wharf area, they can get away with it. I only rented a car for one night (out of 4 we stayed there) so it wasn't too bad for me.

Self-service breakfast was included, selection of cinnamon buns, toast (white to multi grain), cereal, eggs, bacon (very good bacon mind you), sausages, yogurt, coffee was complimentary with your stay at the home.

2 blocks away from pretty much everywhere, fisherwharf, the mason/powell cable cars, the streetcars that takes you to the ferry buildings/market street was a block away. Safeway was 2 blocks away. Very nice and convenient location.

Close to car rental places (we rented from Enterprise and it was a block away)

review.title: Nice hotel in a wonderful location
review.reviewText: Location, location, location...

review.title: Very happy
review.reviewText: Excellent location, service and facilities. A great place to stay. Good breakfast and helpful staff. Close to all the action and family friendly.

review.title: Will stay again.
review.reviewText: Staff was very helpful and friendly. Rooms were updated and clean. Complimentary breakfasts had a good variety. Location was perfect for first-time sight-see-ers like us. Cable car, Fisherman's Wharf, trolley's and bus system were all with a couple blocks making our stay very pleasant. Enjoyed our stay very much. Will go back again in the future for a long stay.

review.title: Helpful Staff
review.reviewText: My family spent 4 days at this hotel and the one thing that we could count on were the hepful front desk people. Whenever we had questions about buses, stores, or directions, they were quick to give us exactly what we needed. They were extremely friendly. The hotel was conveniently located and we felt safe walking around the neighborhood during the late evening. I would definitely stay there again if we return.

review.title: Great hotel to stay at - enjoyed every moment
review.reviewText: Our trip was fabulous. The hotel was a great place to stay. It was clean, friendly and close to everything. We spent alot of time walking the piers and meeting friendly people. Things were clean and interesting. A great trip overall.

review.title: Would Definitely Stay There Again
review.reviewText:
Our Hotel stay was absolutely amazing...we had booked a one bed room and had asked the hotel if its possible to change it to a two bed room, they told us that it will depend on the availability upon our arrival...well we pleasantly surprised to find that they had made all the necessary arrangements before we even arrived...we didn't have to wait for anything! The hotel staff was very respectful, helpful and very nice as well as very accommodating!

The location of the Hotel from everything is great...very convenient location! Short walks to everything...even the cable cars.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: The hotel was nicely located near the San Francisco Peirs. We valet our car overnight because we were not too sure about the neighborhood at night, it cost us roughly $50 for 1 night. There are other places around that only charge $20. There are several nice places to dine within walking distance. I would not reccommend eating at Peir 39, there are much better local restaurants within the same price range that offer much better cusine.

review.title: Treated like royalty
review.reviewText:
The experience was very positive from the time we got off the airport shuttle till we hopped on it again three days later to go back to the airport. The young lady working the desk at check-in was outstanding. She seemed passionate about her job. We weren't familiar with San Francisco so she answered our questions with enthusiasm, and as we found out, with accuracy.

The location is very convenient. It's close to the Wharf where something is always going on. The free breakfast each morning was a plus. If you went as soon as it opened, it wasn't at all crowded. Later on, it was a bit crowded...but that's what you'd expect at a popular hotel! It was not a problem at all.

The rooms were very comfortable and clean and the housekeeping staff was efficient.

When we go back to San Francisco would we stay at this hotel again? In a heartbeat!

review.title: You get what you pay for.
review.reviewText: No shuttle to this Holiday Inn. Trasportation to and from the hotel was more than the cost of the hotel. Three blocks of hotel with out any direction signs where the the check in was. After stepping over the sleeping homeless we were approached by the ones that were awake. We found a lobby but for the full service Holiday Inn next door. The door man had time to lead us to the right hotel. Once in the room, it was just a run of the mill place, Clean and quiet.. Breakfast was varied but over cooked. Next time I'll pay a little more for the room that offers complimentary tranportation and not so scenic scenery.

review.title: I love SF
review.reviewText: Good location for good price. Crowed Breakfast and finished too early.

review.title: San Fran w/ the kids
review.reviewText: Great place! Great staff! Great price!

review.title: Very nice.
review.reviewText: All should be aware there is a charge for parking that is not included.

review.title: An Excellent Choice!
review.reviewText: A fantastic base from which to explore one of the most diverse and interesting cities in the world. The Holiday Inn Express on Fisherman's Wharfe is clean, comfortable, reasonably priced and in a perfect location to unwind at the end of a days sightseeing, with many restaurants and bars nearby. The complementary breakfast is what makes this hotel so special - it sets you up for the day and saves a fortune in terms of not having to pay for breakfast. I can fully recommend staying here - it will certainly be my first choice next time I visit the wonderful San Francisco!

review.title: Off-Season Visit
review.reviewText: Nice location. Decent continental breakfast. Clean, professional staff.

review.title: Best if the valet parking isn't that expensive.
review.reviewText: Great to stay here, too bad the parking fee is pretty expensive. Otherwise, perfect.

review.title: Easy walking distance to many San Francisco attractions.
review.reviewText: Holiday Inn Express Hotel was great!! Easy walk to Fisherman's Wharf and /or bus lines. Staff was courteous and helpful with finding attractions and travel connections. Breakfast was great, but after 5 days, a little more main course variety would have been nice. Coffee in lobby all day would be nice!! Computers in lobby were convenient, but busy almost all the time!!

review.title: Decent facility but horriable experience, NEVER go back
review.reviewText:
The first surprise we had was that the hotel charged $41+tax (totally around $47) per day for parking. To be fair, it's difficult to find parking places within the area. The overall environment of the area wasn't very pleasant for people like to take a stroll in the streets -- definitely not a place for jogging after dark (at least not well illuminated).

The services was fine DURING our stay (aka no more surprises), but not until we were about to leave. The surprise came in the morning before check out -- the bill showed a list of unconnected calls, each one billed for $5.61. We were sure those were unconnected calls because all of them were made by my wife to my cellphone and I always called back each time. When I argued at the front desk, the "assistant manager" on duty used various ways to justify those charges until I told her I had evidence on my cellphone. At that time, she became very rude and said that it was AT&T (the phone carrier of the hotel) that should be blamed and that I would still have to pay. After heated negotiation, she offer to charge for one call, which I didn't think was reasonable at all. Her next offer was to charge all of them. By the end, I was forced into an agreement (I truly didn't want to ruin my day for $5.61) to pay for one call, which was still totally outrageous to me.

Now you see how this hotel does business or provide services. So if you want to go, watch out and be prepared for surprises.

review.title: Not lost in San Fransisco
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, very clean, the front desk was very helpful. Great (FREE) breakfast buffet.

review.title: Great Stay!
review.reviewText: Flight came in early and was able to check in early. The room was very clean, comfortable, and quiet. Appreciated the continental breakfast. Holiday Inn Express does a very nice job. Parking was expensive but price is comparable to other hotels in the area. Hotel is within walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf and Pier 39. Great location and will definitely be back.

review.title: Enjoyed our stay immensely.
review.reviewText: This hotel was very clean and the staff was very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was the same every day, but it was hot and tasty. We asked the front desk staff for directions several times, they were always very helpful. The locations was great. We would definitely stay again.

review.title: I loved this hotel so much!!! great location
review.reviewText: this hotel was so worth it for the money!!!! the food for breakfast was good. the location was great!! staff was very helpful

review.title: I will choose this hotel if I go to San Fran again.
review.reviewText: Nice staff, clean room and very good location, but they don't have free shuttle to the airport and the paid shuttle sevice is once an hour.

review.title: Great value for money
review.reviewText: Great location and amenities were as listed. Room was bigger than expected. The complimentary breakfast was okay, if you don't mind having the same food every day.

review.title: What a deal!! Great place - superb value!!
review.reviewText:
We stayed at this Holiday Inn express in January. We got to check in early around 10:00 am with out any delay what so ever. The hotel is clean, quiet and in a great area of SF. Within a short walk of Pier 39, plenty of shops and eateries, the Buena Vista and their world famous Irish coffee, China Town and and Little Italy.
A short bus or taxi ride will also get you to Golden gate bridge and many other area attractions. Why pay double the price for the same quality here? Free breakfast is always a plus!

review.title: Perfect place to stay while in SF.
review.reviewText: Had a more upscale feeling than I expected for a Holiday Inn Express. The free breakfast was an added bonus with everything that you could possibly imagine on the menu. Perfect location, within walking distance to Pier 39, Chinatown, Ghiradelli Square, etc. I would definitely stay here again on future trips and certainly would recommend this hotel to friends and family.

review.title: SF
review.reviewText:
The hotel itself is nicely appointed and very close to the Pier sights and activities. We enjoyed our stay.
We did incur a few issues.
A. Be aware, the parking fee is much higher than you're expecting - YOWSA.
B. The elevators broke on Sunday AM and we had to use the stairs w/o direction from the staff. (Grateful the fire alarm wasn't tripped)
C. The medical examiner came into the lobby with a gurney to investigate an incident -AKA declare someone dead. (Perhaps using a service entrance would have been less disconcerting?)

review.title: our new regular hotel
review.reviewText: We had stayed here before when there was a particularly attractive rate offered. We repeated because of several factors that made it particularly attractive. The location is central to cable cars, busses and street cars. Another selling point is the included breakfast which although not five star had a reasonable amount of selections and something for most anyone. The staff have always been helpful and accomidating. The rooms are nice enough. We will stay there again.

review.title: Excellent quality/price.
review.reviewText: Excellent location. Lots of things to do around. Cable car at the corner. Good services. Quiet. Honest breakfast. I highly recommand it.

review.title: High marks, great trip.
review.reviewText:
The hotel rooms were kept very clean, and seemed to have been renovated recently. The only slight hiccup was with the alleged free wi-fi—perhaps there was free wi-fi in the lobby or something, but in the room it was an ethernet hookup, and although it was a little iffy at times, it got the job done for what we needed. As some have commented, the layout is a bit odd, and very few rooms actually have views of the street—most face to interior light courtyards. This isn't a problem though, as you're in San Francisco! Get out of the hotel and do something fun!

The complementary breakfasts were quite good, especially since it's included in the room prices. Unless one is used to elaborate breakfasts of poached eggs and salmon, he should find the typical breakfast fare more than acceptable (cereal, bagels, scrambled eggs, sausage or bacon, toast, warm cinnamon rolls, yogurt, fruit). Space in the dining area can be a bit limited depending on the time and the day (less busy in the middle of the week and on the earlier half of the 6:30-9 breakfast window).

The staff was in general courteous and helpful, and check-in as well as check-out went very quickly.

Although there is no pool or jacuzzi at this location, a nice thing we learned was that they have an agreement with another Holiday Inn nearby (within walking distance) at which you are permitted to use the aquatic facilities. There is a gym at this location, however.

review.title: Lack of Facilities
review.reviewText: This hotel was in a great location but service was lacking. It is great if all you are looking for is a bed for the night. Whilst the all day parking was at a special rate the overnight rate for guests was unreasonably high.

review.title: Very happy with express no frills
review.reviewText: The location of this hotel was perfect for us. We had a room on the inside and was very quiet, no view, but I preferred quiet. The breakfast was nothing special.

review.title: Favorable impression with some hesitation
review.reviewText: The main problem with this hotel is that there was no restaurant available at the hotel. It is a problem to not be able to order food in the comfort of your own hotel. There was also no refrigerator available in the room. However, the employees were all friendly and helpful. The hotel was also clean and convenient.

review.title: Excellent location, but be carefull!!
review.reviewText:
The hotel is in excellent location, if you stay there you have many things close as Denny's restaurant 24 hours, the wharf at 2 blocks, Ghirardeli square at 3 blocks, also walgreens and many shops and restaurants are minus 5 minutes walk, Pier 39 is less than 10 minutes walk. The cable car and trolley stop are 1 block and they are a Barns and Noble bookstore minus 1 block.
The hotel offers everymorning a brakfaast buffet and is free so is an excellent extra that save your money. But we have a bad experience with housekeeping, they stolen a jacket a jeans and one night when we came back for all day tour we found our room open, and no one from the front desk come to help and check they only said that if there's something more else missing please report, but that's no the idea.

review.title: Would go back in a heart beat. Holiday Inn Express and Suites Fisherman's Wharf.
review.reviewText: We were very please with the Holiday Inn Express and Suites at the Fisherman's Wharf. Good location. Clean. Very helpful Front DesK Staff. Good Breakfast with lots of choices.

review.title: We will be back....Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel. Great location. Public transportation only 1/2 block away. Two blocks from Fisherman's Wharf. Hotel is very good. Very clean. Free breakfast was good. Lot's of restaurants within walking distance. For those who prefer to have breakfast outside the hotel, there is a very good cafe next door to hotel. Front desk staff very friendly and helpful. Hotel is totally remodeled.

review.title: tobi
review.reviewText: had a good time

review.title: Hotel is close to Fisherman Wharf - Highly recommended!
review.reviewText:
Hotel is close to Fisherman Wharf.
Was surprised that it came with free in-room internet service. Free wifi in the lobby area.
Room was clean.
Really helpful staff.

review.title: Great location!! Can walk almost everywhere :)
review.reviewText: I like Holiday Inn Expresses mainly because of the free breakfast. This hotel was in a good location for tourists. We walked everywhere we wanted to go. The front desk person arranged for a shuttle back to the airport for us, which was also very appreciated.

review.title: Very good
review.reviewText: Very good

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: We had a great time, the hotel was in a great location which made it easy to walk to nearby attractions.

review.title: we would stay there again. great small hotel near fisherman's wharf. good location and service.
review.reviewText: great small hotel near fisherman's wharf. good location

review.title: Very good pillows, mattress, good breakfast, very good internet conection, clean, quiet, good neighb
review.reviewText: I like the hotel. Very good pillows, mattress, good breakfast, very good internet conection, clean, quiet, good neighbourghood, kind employees, very helpful, good daily breakfast. It´s not fancy. but speaking of fancy.. San Francisco is great

review.title: Fun trip
review.reviewText: The hotel was nicely decorated and comfortable. I would have liked to have known about valet parking fees ahead of time, though.

review.title: Spot on in San Fran
review.reviewText: Excellent location and cheap. a short walk to cable car and bus stops and if you purchase a city pass this is all included. Your city pass will also give you free Harbour cruises, entry to the Aquarium and other discounts at PIer 39 which is 5 minutes walk. The room was comfortable and a decent size for the amount of time you spend in there. the hotel is also really quiet which was great as I am a light sleeper. The breakfast was not good - but i think this was a lot to do with not being used to the food in the states- however it was free so we used to just pop down get some juice, coffee and fruit and that would start us off for the day - meals in the states are so cheap and HUGE that a small breakfast wasn't an issue. we found the receptionist to be very impersonal (not so much rude) but again we didn't have a need to deal with them apart from check-in & out. Free High speed interent in room was also a bonus. Happy to stay here again.

review.title: Will stay again
review.reviewText:
Hotel was excellent and staff was helpful. Breakfast was good. Hotel has an excellent location, rooms were clean, but were small. Did not matter because the only time spent in the room was for sleeping. Rode BART and the F line to hotel from SFO and the stop was just around block from hotel and in front of a Walgreens. Also about half a block away you will find a rental cars agency, various small eateries and Fishermans Wharf. Cable car stops are about one block away. Used public transportation except for one day car rental to wine country.
Highly recommended place to stay

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: This hotel is conveniently located to local attractions. It is clean and spacious. The free breakfast is fantastic! They also have free internet access in the lobby. There are only two computers so you have to wait but most people were on and off in a timely manner. The front desk staff was most accommodating. I give this hotel five stars and thumbs up!

review.title: Fun Stay
review.reviewText:
This was our first trip to San Francisco. Our son is the person who booked this trip. We were joined by him, his wife and her parents, we all enjoyed the location of this Holiday Inn. We were within walking distance of everything we wanted to do. Fishermans Wharf was like two blocks.
I would recommend this hotels to anyone who likes to be close to all the sights SF has to offer.

review.title: Nice digs! Close to everything, would stay here again.
review.reviewText: Did the usual tourist things & had great time.

review.title: Great place to stay in great location.
review.reviewText: This was my second time staying at this hotel and I was as staisfied with it as the first time. Everyone working there is extremely friendly. They cater to your needs and the hotel is clean and quiet. The hotel is only a few blocks from Fisherman's Wharf, Ghiradelli Square and all forms of transportation (the trolley turn around is near by, too). They provide a complete breakfast that allows you to eat as much as you want with a variety of choices from eggs and bacon to cereals, bagels and great cinnamon rolls. Rooms are great and plenty clean. I highly recommend this hotel. Don't get it confused with the Holiday Inn a block away.

review.title: CLOSE TO SIGHTS, GREAT PRICE AND SERVICES
review.reviewText: HAD A GREAT TIME, WEATHER WAS GREAT AND FOOD WAS GOOD.

review.title: Good base to tour san fransisco
review.reviewText: Clean and tidy hotel,all the staff helpful with queries about hotel and San Fransisco,wouid recommend

review.title: Very impressed
review.reviewText: Room was clean. Looked like it had been recently renovated. Bed was comfortable.Bathroom was very nice. Room was good sized. No view, but we weren't there long enough to care. Bus lines run right in front of the hotel. Only a short walk to cable cars. The only complaint about breakfast was that they need more fruit than bananas. Coffee was good and very hot! We'll definitly go back.

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText: The hotel is nice, good proximity to Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39 & Pier 33-Alcatraz cruise. The concierge were very helpful & for the price,the breakfast is a plus. The room was clean; just needs more toiletries. i don't know if this is due to environmental concern but they only gave us 1 soap & there were 4 of us. They were good though in providing extra once we asked.

review.title: Perfect Location
review.reviewText: Employees were awesome and very helpful. Located between both cable cars and F-line, perfect for transit. Safe area. Being1 block from the Wharf made it quiet yet close.

review.title: Proceed With Caution
review.reviewText:
Our first surprise was the disgustingly nasty parking fee. It didn't include tax either. And there is nowhere else to park. So for the 2 nights we stayed, we paid an unexpected and painful chunk-a-change. Was my first time to SF and had not been aware of the parking crisis! Note to self: Don't rent a car next time! The public transportation is abundant.

The gal at the front desk was not very welcoming and a bit cranky. So we get to deal with that immediately after the parking thing! And of course we're given an interior room.

The hotel is rectangular with outward facing rooms and interior rooms. The interior rooms faced the other side of the hotel and other rooms' windows. We had to keep the shades closed and it was like we didn't even have a window.

The room was small, which I understand is not unusual for SF. There were no extras in the room, but that didn't matter to us since we weren't planning on spending our vacation in a hotel room.

One last negative before I get to the positives....the hot part of the complimentary breakfast was inedible. I would suggest walking up to Mama's for a really delicious breakfast that will last you until dinner!

Why I WOULD recommend this hotel...it's clean, comfortable, well maintained and within walking distance to a lot of great places.

review.title: Cant wait to go back
review.reviewText:
Had an absolutely fantastic time in San Francisco. The Holiday Inn Express at Fishermans was an excellent place to stay, due to its convenient location to lots of major attractions. The cleanliness and excellent standard of the rooms, the friendliness and excellent level of customer service given by the hotel staff.
We would definetly reccomend this hotel and would definetly return in the future.

review.title: I'll go back
review.reviewText: Good local knowledge, helpful staff, clean, big rooms...

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Express in October 2009. The location is terrific. It is only about 4 blocks from Pier 39 and within walking distance of Girardelli Square. Transportation all around town, whether by cable car, bus, streetcar or ferry were all convenient and easy to find. Breakfast at the hotel was an added bonus.

review.title: Most Convenient Hotel in San Francisco!!
review.reviewText: Lets start with the room... upgraded to a suite facing Fisherman's Wharf just for asking if the room had a refrigerator! Extra comfy beds, whitest white sheets and towels, the room was spotless. Shower was a blast! Didn't get time for the TV or Cable due to the stones throw closeness of Boudins Bakery, the Sea Lions, all the restaurants, harbor tours, submarine, Alcatraz, etc. Worth mentioning was the adjacent Walgreens ( the worlds largest) that carried all our beverage and snack needs as well as the best prices and selection of souveniers! A short walk to Cable Cars that run all over the city as well as buses right outside the door. The breakfast buffet every morning probably saved our family $20 a day. The food was good and fresh, the coffee was hot as was the eggs and bacon. Overall we were very pleased with our experience at the Holiday Inn Express and would return.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Near the Wharf/Piers, cable car accessible. Hotel staff are friendly. Comp breakfast food is good.

review.title: Ideal Location for Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText:
A good choice for exploring San Francisco. Staff very helpful and got a bay view room. No frills hotel but clean and comfortable good sized rooms.
No bar, restaurant or concierge but numerous restaurants and bars nearby. Complimentary breakfast limited and plastic and paper tableware but full buffet options available at nearby restaurants if you prefer. Reasonably priced hotel in perfect location. Would stay again.

review.title: Simple Hotel. Great Experience!!!
review.reviewText: The whole experience was better than i expected especially the people was very friendly. Fisherman´s Wharf in my very personal opinion is the best of San Fran.

review.title: Perfect location!
review.reviewText: We were extremely pleased with this hotel's location so close to the wharf, the buses and the trolley. We were able to get anywhere we wanted to very easily. The room was really nice and the breakfast was the best of any hotel breakfast we've ever had before!

review.title: Good Wharf Experience
review.reviewText: The only problem was not enough room for breakfast crowd. They need to really think how they have the food layed out. Could have been more efficent with a little tweaking of layout of food.

review.title: Hotel staff friendly and informative
review.reviewText: The Hotel staff was extremely friendly and informative. Every staff member at the front desk had a smile on their face and were genuinely happy to help us get were we wanted to be.

review.title: A great stay
review.reviewText: A great location and friendly service; excennet value for money and would recommend.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Would recommend this hotel. A nice Holiday Express and the location was the best!

review.title: Loved San Francisco
review.reviewText: Hotel was wonderful. The only thing missing was the luggage racks which would have made unpacking and packing a little more comfortable I don't like putting my luggage on the bed and I can't do the packing on the floor because I have a bad back..

review.title: Great hotel Great location
review.reviewText: This hotel was in a great location. Rooms were beautiful except no view of anything. Beds were super comfy. Breakfast was excellent. Many choices

review.title: Go elsewhere
review.reviewText: hotel was indifferent to service requests; skimped on soap; failed to provide Priority Club services.

review.title: Perfect Location For Home Base While Touring SF
review.reviewText: This is a great location as home base while touring San Francisco. A hot Breakfast has to be the most cost affective perk supplied. The dining area was packed every morning with gusts fueling up before starting thier day. Cable car, trolly, and bus line connections are close by to give you an economical option to any site on your list to visit in the city. I had a small problem with the toilet mechanism and the service personel were "Johnny on the spot" to take care it. My wife and I are planning to return and this is the place we will stay.

review.title: September Stay
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a great location, close to the wharf and is within walking distance to other city attractions. It is your typical Holiday Inn Express so I wouldn't expect bells and whistles especially when it comes to their complimentary breakfast (not that great). Because of its location and decent price I would probably stay here again.

review.title: Loved the Hotel ...The location was super!
review.reviewText: I found the Holiday Inn Express and Suites to be a great place to stay for our 7 day vacation. It was very clean, good service, good breakfast buffet, and a terrific location for good restaurants, places to set up tours, shopping, etc. I would definitely recommend it to others.

review.title: Breakfast is an experience.
review.reviewText: Spent 7 Nights Sept 2009. Good location. Breakfast is unbelievably disorganized. They have toasters holding up the entire line; rather than putting them off to the side. No place to sit and eat most mornings as Hotel was full. Breakfast staff speak Mexican only; and are of little help. Safety deposit box in room could be opened with a tire iron; however they gave me one in the lobby no charge when I complained.

review.title: Exceeded expectations
review.reviewText: We wanted a budget friendly trip to SF. For the price and quality, this was an excellent choice. Very close to public transportation and many attraction. Lobby and rooms were nicely appointed. Free breakfast is great (though I have never been to a hotel breakfast buffet where they didn't have instant oatmeal!)

review.title: I'd stay here again without thinking twice
review.reviewText: I Highly recommend this hotel, right around the corner from Fisherman's Wharf. Lobby, Breakfast buffett area, elevators, halls etc all very clean and tidy looking. The room was in good order with no peeling wall paper or mold in the bathroom like so many other hotels I've stayed at. One minor thing, the breakfast buffett is the exact same every morning, but pretty good food all the same.

review.title: Service with a smile
review.reviewText: Everything was perfect except the complimentary breakfast. They would be better having strictly continental style breakfast with at least 12 or more toasters. The front desk staff were very informative and helpful and always with a friendly smile. Excellent location close to the Wharf and transportation. Would definitely recommend to anyone. JC

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Central to everything. Good food. Excellant service. Very clean and comfortable. Reasonably priced.

review.title: Hotel needs upgrade
review.reviewText: Hotel air conditioning system was loud. While maid service was friendly, on the second day, it was late in the PM before room was made up.

review.title: It was a place to eat and sleep
review.reviewText: The hotel served it's purpose. I needed a place to sleep while I was vacationing in San Francisco. I was hardly in the room because I was out seeing the city. But when I needed to sleep, it was perfect. It was clean and comfortable. The free hot breakfast wasn't bad either. I have stayed in much more expensive hotels, and the breakfast served here was the same. I recommend it.

review.title: Fantastic location
review.reviewText: I would recommend this Hotel to my friends,the location fantastic,the staff were helpful and professional,we were just minutes from great restaurants,public transport,and pier 39.San Fransisco was a delightful holiday for us Aussies.

review.title: Overall, a very good hotel. If I return to San Fran, I'd stay here again.
review.reviewText: I stayed there from September 14-19, 2009. I found the room to be very clean; I got fresh towels every day w/o asking. The staff was very helpful. They had recommendations on which tours to take and which shuttle bus to take back to the airport. The hotel also offered breakfast as part of the deal. I've been on a health kick for a few years, so readers should take this with a grain of salt. The fruit and dry cereal were good. The fried eggs and sausages were too greasy for me. This might be impossible for the hotel to fix, but I'll put this here anyway. The street where the hotel is located is not lit up very well. It felt a little eerie returning to the hotel after each night's entertainment.

review.title: Nice, clean and the staff was very friendly
review.reviewText: We had a little trouble getting a rollaway bed. The cleaning staff was very friendle and did a great job.

review.title: Room was clean and comfortable. Breakfast could use more healthy choices.
review.reviewText: The bathroom fan was much too noisy. Always appreciate a removable shower head.

review.title: Do not stay here
review.reviewText: Reserved & confirmed a King bed a month earlier. Received a small Queen in the smallest room I have ever seen. Front desk was rude and would not accomidate original reservation. Parking at $41 a day plus $6 for tax. Breakfast was not as advertised - sweet rolls, coffee, juice, cold cereal, milk, powdered eggs, bacon one day sausage the next, bread & bagels and one toaster. There are much better hotels in the area with better rates and amenities. This is our last stay at Holiday Inn Express.

review.title: Excellent hotel, great location
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was very helpful and friendly, our rooms were always cleaned when we returned each evening. Hotel was in a great location, just a short walk to Pier 45, Pier 39, Ghiradelli Square, cable car stop...would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking to have fun in the beautiful bay city!

review.title: Great Location.
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed the Hotel, the Location to Fishermans Wharf was perfect to say the least. Everything was close by and within walking distance. Again this is an ideal spot if you are visiting San Fran. Breakfasts were good. Hotel was Very Nice and Clean. Service at the hotel was also Great. Only critique was the size of our room. It was rather tiny, but for San Fran standards it was probably considered 'Plush'.

review.title: I will come back
review.reviewText: I was alittle worried about staying because i saw that it was a three star hotel but, it should be more like a five. I loved my stay here. It was not a problem for me to check in 3hrs early. Also, my check out time was at 12 but my flight didnt leave until 4, the hotel very kindly held my luggage in a safe place. The size of the rooms were good,and the best part is the location of this hotel which is around the corner from at the wharf action. stay here!!

review.title: Excellent location!
review.reviewText: This hotel is all you need. On the positive side, it was clean, it was comfortable, the location was excellent, they provided free breakfast and the price was great! On the negative side, my wife thought the breakfast got a little tired after a few days and they didn't have a convenience shop. We didn't care for either one so we would've rather not have it if it meant the room would be less. I must stress EXCELLENT LOCATION. Everything was so close and nothing felt like it was so far away.

review.title: Great value - clean and comfortable
review.reviewText: Our room was clean and comfortable, staff were responsive and attentive. The complimentary breakfast was a pleasant surprise - good quality and variety. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel to a friend or to stay there again.

review.title: good clean hotel, great location
review.reviewText: well situated hotel for families with kids. rooms were comfortable and clean though not too big. great breakfast. very helpful staff.

review.title: Close to many attractions.
review.reviewText: Complimental breakfast was more than enough to fill you up. Need to state that there is a parking fee per night.(Valet only)

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: You can find from the hotel what you may request from a hotel. Parking charge was a lot. But Parking any place available is city center is a disaster in San Fransisco city center..

review.title: Very Nice
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice, the comp. breakfast was great, and the room was very nice in general. The cleaning staff failed to clean my room one day, but that really wasnt to big a deal.

review.title: Happy with our Choice!
review.reviewText: The room was fairly small but fine for us and looked as if it had just been remodeled with fresh paint throughout and new counters in the bathroom. We were there 6 nights and the room was kept very clean. The location was perfect we thught, and the breakfast buffet was tasty and plentiful. We would definitely stay there again!

review.title: had a blast...want to go back for longer
review.reviewText: hotel was extremely nice and clean breakfast was included and that was another plus the location the hotel was perfect too.

review.title: Don't let the Express name scare you from staying here.
review.reviewText: Conveniently located within easy walking distance to restaurants, shopping and popular tourist attractions. Courteous staff, clean, well maintained, overall nice place to stay. Parking a car on premises is an added daily expense that also includes valet only service.

review.title: A Good Stay....
review.reviewText: Just a "Good" hotel, would go there again with no worries or problems. The breakfast was very good, a little crowded, but good food.

review.title: San Francisco - Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Hotel was okay - clean - right across from the Hyatt. Night and morning front desk staff very helpful. Afternoon staff too busy with their own issues! Hotel was clean and good location for bus tours and of course Fisherman's Wharf. Breakfast was "free" and included in the room rate. The only thing is when something is "free" it seems people act like that haven't eaten before or they are not sure the nexr time they will be eating!!! Room was not set up for the number of people who used it. Everything against the wall and not enough room to use the toaster while other people were in line to pick up eggs, sausage, bacon etc. Depending on time in the morning not enough room to sit. Staff tried hard to keep the food coming. The second day we went down the street and ate breakie at an outdoor cafe with no hassle! Our room was on the main floor at the back with a window facing into other rooms - now view and room was small but functional. Cleaning staff friendly.

review.title: Excellent bang for your buck!
review.reviewText: This hotel exceeded my expectations for a Holiday Inn Express. The continental breakfast was really good. The location was great, and the free wireless was a bonus. We didn't have a car there which was a good idea. You don't really need one for touring San Fran, but if you do, the parking is very expensive.

review.title: Clean, but Tight with No View
review.reviewText: I can't recommend this hotel simply because the size and placement of the rooms. Quoting a hotel rep, "90% of our rooms are inward facing" meaning your view will be of what looks like a raquetball court inside a penitentiary. Within ten minutes of arriving, I was back downstairs asking for a different room which became problematic since the hotel was fully booked. The room size can best be described as "European", which means you'll have just enough room to display your Dutch clogs between the bathroom and bed... but that's about it. There's no fridge in the room either. If you spend little time in the room, don't bring anybody you're trying to impress, get an awesome deal on the rate, and simply have to be in the Wharf district then this hotel's cleanliness (which is very good) will be enough. Breakfast can be nice, but it's Mom's Passable Bacon and Eggs one day or Crazy Aunt's Questionable Sausage and Something Else the next. Get there either very early (it starts at 6:30am) or at 9:15 (it ends at 9:30) to avoid the crowd. Oh, and my low hotel service rating is more for the apathetic front desk people than for the lovely room crews.

review.title: Nice
review.reviewText: A nice location, excellent service, clean, the room was a little tight though.

review.title: Just right!
review.reviewText: My boyfriend and I just returned from an awesome trip to San Francisco! This hotel was just right. Nicely decorated, but not fancy. Our room was very clean, and housekeeping kept it that way for all four days we were there. Being a germ-a-fhob, I really appreciated having all white linens, which were spotless. They also wrap the comforter with a top sheet, so you have no direct contact with it, which is great!! Two soft and two firm pillows are on the bed, which is a nice feature, too! The location is perfect. It is only a short walk to EVERYTHING! I'd describe the breakfast buffet as sufficient,but try to get there early or it's extremely crowded! We went down as soon as it opened, since we never adjusted to the three hour time difference, and even though there were plenty of tables at that time, we used the provided trays and brought our breakfast up to our room. The one thing that I wished we did have in our room was a refrigerator to eliminate the need to spend $3, at the hotels vending machines, for a drink! Overall, we definitely enjoyed our stay.

review.title: Great Beds & Pillows!
review.reviewText: My family and I (six of us) stayed at the Holiday Inn Express while on vacation. We all agreed the beds a VERY comfortable and there are plenty of pillows. They are two very nice things to come home to after a day of touring. Breakfast in the morning is a nice thing to have also!

review.title: $41 a day to park
review.reviewText: This hotel was great - only issue - $41.00 a day to park. Normally, if you get validated, they waive the fee, not here, this was on top of what you paid for the room. It is valet, however, I thought the price was a little outrageous.

review.title: Would not recomend
review.reviewText: Absolutely terrible service that started before we even arrived at the hotel.

review.title: Near the Wharf
review.reviewText: This hotel was not overly fancy, but it was in a great location and nice and clean! The free hot breakfast buffet was a big time and money saver.

review.title: All staff very helpful. very clean
review.reviewText: good locationa for all tours. good location for walking or riding cable car

review.title: Holiday Inn Express Pier 39
review.reviewText: Great location, lacking some amenities, breakfast is OK, be sure to budget accordingly for parking.

review.title: i will definitly return to this hotel.
review.reviewText: i really cant think of anything about the hotel i did'nt like. everything was very organized,clean and the staff very proffesional.i will definitely stay here again.i would recommend this hotel to everyone.thi is coming from someone who works at a strip property in las vegas.

review.title: Excellent Deal
review.reviewText: We loved the fact that breakfast was included The food was excellent. It was really nice to enjoy a good breakfast and head out for early morning tours.

review.title: Very good
review.reviewText: Very comfortable hotel - good located and nice staff. Breakfast was very crowded.

review.title: Nice, clean, well located hotel
review.reviewText: Enjoyed staying here. Breakfast was good. Internet worked well. Room was clean. Bed was decent.

review.title: Nice Place
review.reviewText: Lovely employees and very confortable rooms.

review.title: Would definitely stay there again!
review.reviewText: My husband and I were visiting San Francisco for our 30th wedding anniversary. I chose this hotel because of the proximity to Fisherman's Wharf and because of the complimentary breakfast. We were not disappointed! The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. The breakfast was great! Eggs and bacon or sausage each morning along with the usual assortment of breads, cereal, fruit, etc. The eating area is large and even though mornings were very busy, we could always find a place to sit. The staff kept the food items replenished quickly. The only surprise we had was the size of the room. It was smaller than we anticipated. We had one queen bed and I was expecting a larger room. But we spent most of our time sightseeing, so it was no big deal. The room was very nice and the staff quickly supplied us with extra towels whenever we asked. And we were a very short walk to lots of attractions, including Pier 39 and the cable car turn-around. It was a great location. If we ever plan another trip to San Francisco, we would definitely stay there!

review.title: I would go back.
review.reviewText: great location. let us check in super early and check out late. breakfast was just so so.

review.title: Average hotel but great location
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice and clean. The breakfast was great. It helped to not have to pay for breakfast in San Fran because all of the other meals were pricey. The front desk staff was not overly friendly, but their demeanor is not enough for me to not recommend this hotel. It was in a great location. Many sites discourage tourists from staying down at Fisherman's Wharf but I completely disagree. It's a great hub and it's easy enough to get out of that area to visit other neighborhoods. Bicylce rentals, car rentals, shopping, Alcatraz ferry, restaurants, Ghiradelli and so much more are right there!

review.title: Comfortable stay in Fisherman's Wharf area
review.reviewText: The Holiday Inn Express - Fisherman's Wharf is conveniently located within walking distance of Fisherman's Wharf and popular Pier 39 attractions. The hotel was very clean, staff was friendly and accommodating, and the beds were comfortable. Holiday Inn's free breakfast buffet was consistent, although it was always very crowded in the mornings, and some food items ran low at times. All in all, this hotel offered a comfortable, pleasant stay for the money. A good value for families or business travelers.

review.title: great hotel
review.reviewText: Wonderful stay at this hotel. The breakfast room was very large but there were so many people staying there that it proved to be crowded during the weekend. During the rest of the week it was fine. It is far enough away from the wharf to be rather quiet. We were delighted with this choice---its location is excellent

review.title: Very Nice Place
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful time staying at this hotel. It was close to everything and the staff was very helpful in providing the information we needed. The breakfast was very nice and everything was very clean. The rooms were clean and kept up very nice. I would certainly stay in this hotel again.

review.title: Breakfast Was Great.
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay very much. Easch morning we ate a hearty breakfast and planned our day. The hotel was close to all events taking place as well as, the cable car stops. The girls at the front desk were very helpful. They gave us maps, directions, suggestions and always handy with a smile.

review.title: Parking is super expensive
review.reviewText: This is an adequate Holiday Inn property and it is certainly in a great location that is close to Fisherman's Wharf. There is a "gotcha" however if you have car. The valet-only parking garage costs $41 + tax per night!!! No discount for guests. So you might want to ditch the rental car before going there.

review.title: Reasonable
review.reviewText: very accommodating

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: was'nt expecting much because holiday inn express tend to be basic but was plesently surprised with this hotel,there is a good choice at breakfast but be early,6.30-7.30 was about the best time to avoid the mayem !! on arrival i asked for a room with view and was given #384 which is on the beach st side of hotel with views over the bay and of alcatraz, this is however a smoking room but was odour free and was has clean as any non-smoking room i've stayed in.the room itself was equipt with a microwave,fridge,coffee maker and internet access

review.title: Great value
review.reviewText: The hotel was nicely maintained, in a great location and was an overall good value. There are so many great restaurants in SF, having a restaurant in the hotel wasn't a consideration however, they did serve breakfast. I would definitely stay there again. One caution, the parking was expensive (and extra) for hotel parking but parking in Fisherman's Wharf is very expensive.

review.title: would stay there again
review.reviewText: We liked everything about our stay.

review.title: close to everything!
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, walking distance to the wharf, transportation, and food places

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText: Very good location in San Francisco. Hotel was clean and comfortable. The room was big enough and the staff was so friendly and helpfull. Breakfeast was good. I recommend Holiday Inn Express Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Fine No Frills Hotel
review.reviewText: Great location. Convenient breakfast, ends 9:30am, crowded, food OK, basic breakfast stuff. No pool but was cold for swimming even in August. No concierge, so sometimes long wait for basic info answers from hard working busy desk workeres.

review.title: Very Nice - Quiet and close to the Wharf
review.reviewText: Other than a little mix up with rooms - one king instead of two beds - the room was great. The free breakfast was good. Close to Wharf but not in the middle of the craziness. No pool or hot tub although who would have time to enjoy either. Your basic, clean, comfy hotel.

review.title: Not bad
review.reviewText: Not much to not like about my stay although it was packed with other tourists everything seemed to be well run. The breakfast bar was 'okay' as it offered enough variety for almost everyone, but if you didn't go early (0630), the small room was crowded in no time. Limited TV channel offerings.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: If you want a reasonable price clean comfortable hotel close to the Fishermans Warf this place fits the bill. The breakfest is okay but if you have kids or alot of mouths to feed it can save you money

review.title: Hotel
review.reviewText: Although there was a mix up with our reservation, Brandy was wonderful and got it straightened out and us in our room in record time.

review.title: Impressed
review.reviewText: The hotel was very clean and close to the Wharf. The air conditioner had to be turned all the way down in order for the room to be cool. The breakfast was ok, there was never any omelets or sausage, like the advertisement stated. Overall, I would stay again.

review.title: good location
review.reviewText: Hotel was very convenient to lots of fun family tourist stuff. Our room was VERY noisy; we were next to the employee exit and they let the door SLAM all night every night. They also made up the booked rooms late in the afternoon, when we were returning for a rest; as a result, we declined maid service every day of our stay. I'd recommend this hotel for families who want a family place that's centrally located and friendly. Except surprise! there's no swimming pool!

review.title: Holiday Inn @ Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Very good location and reasonable price. Good service and I would stay again at this hotel. Strongly recommend staying here when in Frisco. Clean rooms and close by to all amenities and sight seeing places. Easy to get transportation to anywhere in town.

review.title: Very nice.
review.reviewText: My daughter and I stayed here 4 nights. We had a wonderful room, bigger than normal. Staff was very accomodating and the breakfast was very good, plenty of food for hearty appetites! Would love to go back soon.

review.title: Great Hotel!
review.reviewText: This is one of the best places I have stayed! Great staff, big room and the breakfast is free! Also we were able to print our boarding passes in the lobby for free! A very nice perk!

review.title: Great location, good all-around
review.reviewText: This is a great location, 3 blocks from the wharf. Close to cable cars and the F-line (Market street) railway & bus stop. Lots of restaurants & quick eats nearby. Denny's is in the hotel although we never ate there. Free continental breakfast is helpful to start the day. Concierges are friendly and helpful. We had a Junior Suite which gives us a sofa bed, microwave oven and small frig. The room size was decent. All in all a good hotel for leisure in San Francisco.

review.title: Unlucky room
review.reviewText: The hotel is new and clean, but we had many problems during our stay. The a/c and TV did not work with very slow response from management and maintenance. They could have fixed it when we were out all day and did not. The second night they sent a fan, but could not relocate us. Though they gave us free parking in compensation, we should have gotten a free stay! Two miserable nights sweating and not sleeping!

review.title: Nice Property but issue at checkin that somewhat tarnished my opinion
review.reviewText: The room was nice; building was nice; location was great; nice breakfast. We didn't receive the type of room we had booked at first and it took a lot of time and 'discussions' to rectify it so we weren't happy at first but overall the property was very nice and again the location was great

review.title: Parking?
review.reviewText: No complaints other than the parking,, 40 dollars a day. Seemed they should have warned you about that.

review.title: Good price, nice room, great location
review.reviewText: The hotel room was comfortable and well maintained daily during our 3 night stay. There was a nice breakfast buffet included. Best feature is location which is blocks from Fisherman's Wharf, trolley cars, F line street car, and more.

review.title: Good Hotel at a better price
review.reviewText: Confort, Clean, Good instalations. A great location, near everything

review.title: excellent location
review.reviewText: The hotel is not fancy and obviously caters to families, but also to foreign travelers. It was quiet, the room was adequate and the cleaning staff was extremely curtious. The location is ideal for getting to the wharf and to all public transportation and tour transportation. The only negative we found during our stay was the overcrowding during the buffet breakfast (included with the room). Part of the congestion was caused by the location of the one toaster. I would suggest adding several toaters and reconsidering the configuration of the self-serve lines.

review.title: Perfect location
review.reviewText: The hotel was near the wharf, beach, restaurants and historic sites. The F-line was a block away; catch it and take it straight to Market street and from there, within walking distance, is museums, china town and bus lines that easily take you where you want to go.

review.title: Very clean and friendly
review.reviewText: Breakfast was good, personnel at desk was extremely friendly and helpful

review.title: needs improvment
review.reviewText: The breakfast in the mornings needs to have a little more variety to the menu. We stayed for 5 days and were offered the same thing every morning. When we looked up the hotel on lineit said it had a pool and when we got there founf out that the pool was at the other hotel a block away.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Excellent location for tourists. Hotel was clean and desk staff were helpful.

review.title: San Fran trip
review.reviewText: We stayed for 5 days in July '09 and had a wonderful time. The hotel is within walking distance to many restaurants, the Piers, and many attractions. We did not rent a car and the hotel staff were extremely helpful in showing us the best bus routes to Chinatown and the Haight/Ashbury area. The hotel was clean and the staff were very courteous and friendly. I would definitely stay at the HI Express again!

review.title: Veri Nice!
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel in great location to Fisherman's Wharf area. Would definately stay again. Very helpful at front desk for directions, travel and booking events.

review.title: Good affordable hotel
review.reviewText: Great front desk,clean,and comfortable.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: Great location just off the wharf. All the staff were very attentive. Rooms were small but nice.

review.title: Good location,price a little steep.
review.reviewText: Don't totally understand the $41.00 plus tax parking fee, as we were guest in the hotel. So goes it in this econemy. pay now or pay later.

review.title: great location fisherman's wharf
review.reviewText: Beds very comfy with soft and firm pillows provided. Rooms nice and clean and updated. The continental breakfast could be improved..same thing every day, esp. only bananas offered..and this is California!

review.title: Wonderful Stay
review.reviewText: My wife and I spent 7 days at this hotel and had a wonderful time. Just a few blocks from the action at Pier 39 and Fisherman's Wharf. The front desk staff was very helpful in meeting our travel needs. Both cold and hot breakfast options were available each morning, which was nice. We would definitely stay here again!

review.title: Excellent Hotel to stay
review.reviewText: This hotel is at a great location where you can walk to most attractions and most of all buffet breakfast is included with the price. At Fisherman's Wharf most activities happen so those with kids may want to stay here where it is easy to access public transportation.

review.title: Good Choice
review.reviewText: Excellent location close to Fisherman's Wharf, Cable Cars. Clean and comfortable. Very nice breakfast.

review.title: excellent service
review.reviewText: The front desk staff at this hotel are so personable, friendly and helpful. They go above and beyond to provide great service. I asked about transportation options and instead of just giving me info, the staff made the reservation for me. The location is touristy, but if that is what you are looking for, this is a great hotel.

review.title: Very Satisfied! Exactly As We Expected
review.reviewText: We stayed five nights at this hotel. We had checked the reviews and amenities on Expedia before booking and it was consistant with all the reviews. The hotel was new, extremely clean, and the the hot breakfast was not only quality but a real money saver. They didn't even mind if you brought food to your room (they provided trays). We knew we were not going to be in the hotel a great deal so for our purposes this hotel was an excellent value for the money we paid. The bed and bedding was extremely comfortable. My only complaint was that the front desk staff knew very little about the area so do not count on them to answer any questions.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Being on Fisherman's Wharf, we had good restaurants to eat, we were close to the tolleys and enjoyed walking around the pier. My wife loved the having a choice of two different pillows. It was all I could do to keep her from taking the soft pillow. She really loved it. WE had a very pleasant experience and would recommend staying there.

review.title: Very Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel - breakfast buffet a great addition to the stay. Location on Fisherman's Wharf wonderful and convenient to attractions and public transit - cable cars and the trolleys. Definitely would recommend this place to anyone wanting a nice San Francisco vaction.

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: We had no problems with this hotel. The staff at the front desk were so sweet and helpful. The beds were comfy. There were nice views from our room and my friends room down the way. I definitely recommend this place if you want to stay near Fisherman's Wharf and easy transportation to the rest of the city.

review.title: good location
review.reviewText: This hotel was in perfect walking distance of most places. The public transportation is wonderful. Very clean and friendly associates at the hotel.

review.title: It was very good.
review.reviewText: Very good.

review.title: Excellent Customer Service
review.reviewText: The room was small but clean. The breakfast was wonderful and the hotel was very central to everything the warff, trolley service etc... Excellent service and greaqt location. the staff was very helpful

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Great Hotel, Close to everything. The free breakfast in the morning was great. People were extremely friendly and nice. Can't wait to come back.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was very helpful when we arrived. Our luggage was delayed. The staff told us when to expect it and what to do if it didn't arrive - which was more than the airline did. The hotel was within walking distance to everything we wanted to see.

review.title: great location, helpful staff
review.reviewText: Stayed two nights over a weekend. Checked in early and was able to get a non-smoking room straight away. View of an empty courtyard and other room but wasn't there for the view. Very comfy king-size bed. Wireless internet in lobby (didnt use) and ethernet in room (worked perfectly). Breakfast was cereal, rolls, eggs and meat, yoghurt, tea, coffee,juice and fruit. There was always enough food to eat and although there was lots of people there was enough seating. You can take food back to the rooms. Also a coffee maker in room with tea and coffee sachets. Check out took a while as there was only one staff member on and a couple people waiting. Staff were always friendly and helpful. Housekeeping kept the hotel clean. Very close to Walgreens for food/drinks. Fishermans wharf very close, but not too close! Easy access to the cable cars, tourist buses and taxis. Got the BART from the airport and walked along the embarcadero. nice walk but not quick. $8.50 taxi ride back to the Bart station. Don't take your car if you don't have to. Hotel has valet parking costing over $40 a day. You dont need a car as San Francisco has a good public transport system. On the same street as five star hotels. This is not a 5 star. Does not have concierge (is next door at original holiday inn) or people to take your luggage, which was fine with me. Use the free maps available on the streets to get around the city. Was able to walk to Lombard street, Pier 33 for alcatraz.

review.title: Economical place to return
review.reviewText: Would be nice if they had recycling. Good value for the price. Breakfast had a good variety. Close to attractions and transportation.

review.title: Holiday Inn Express at SF Fisherman's Wharf was terrific!
review.reviewText: Great location. Clean and comfortable.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: As a visitor to SF and planning to see the area sights, the hotel was in a great location to use public transportation and get around. The staff was great and our stay was a pleasure. I would go back and stay here again.

review.title: Retired couple impressed and for sure we recommend
review.reviewText: Good location to everything. Close to tours,piers, cable cars,city buses,and eats. We walked to our tour co. which was 2 blocks. Pier 39 about 4 blocks. Had a better than average continental breakfast. Parking is expensive.

review.title: We'd go back!
review.reviewText: It was a great location, rooms were comfortable, clean and seemed to be newly furnished. Breakfast was good. We'd like to have had T.V. news channels such as MSNBC. It was most assuredly a great choice.

review.title: Our best time ever.
review.reviewText: We have stated here several times and this was the best ever. We had an early fleight and they allowed us to check in very early with no problem. The roon was in great shape. We will always stay here. I wish they would go back to boiled eggs in the morning.

review.title: Very nice hotel. I would stay there again.
review.reviewText: This hotel was clean from top to bottom. My room was clean, but the toilet needing fixing; however, I was two blocks from Fisherman's Wharf and this hotel was adjacent to major streets that took you downtown and to the Oakland Bay Bridge. The only downside was parking. Parking at a meter was from 7 a.m. to 7 p.m. Hotel has valet parking at $41.00 a night plus tax.

review.title: Average but good location
review.reviewText: Also free breadfast

review.title: GRAET HOTEL
review.reviewText: STAFF WAS GREAT BREAKFAST WAS GREAT.OVERALL GRAET LOCATION AND STAY

review.title: Will Stay Again-Great Location!!!
review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed at this hotel over spring break this year and it was our first time to San Francisco. The hotel was extremely clean and the staff was outstanding. The breakfast is phenomenal, I am still having withdrawals from those warm cinnamon buns. This hotel is close to everything, the waterfront and Pier 39, Trolleys, Cable Cars, and great dining. Avis is right behind this hotel and it made it very easy to explore out of the city as well. A+ all the way!!!!

review.title: Breakfast
review.reviewText: The breakfast tasteless and was crowded and disorganized, eat at the Hollywood Cafe next door.

review.title: Love the people at the hotel
review.reviewText: Sent before.

review.title: Woudl love to go back!!!!!
review.reviewText: Would stay here again..Staff very friendly and helpfull. Rooms was very clean and housekeepung was great,,,,

review.title: Great location and service
review.reviewText: This was a great selection. I have always been happy with this chain in general and am familiar with SF but never stayed near The Wharf. Flew into SFO, took Bart to Powell, then took the Streetcar (F-Line) to the end at Fisherman's Wharf. The hotel was 1.5 blocks from the stop, so very manageable with luggage. We arrived early (11AM) and the hotel was cleaning our room but offered to keep our bags and gave us a guest check tag to claim it later. We went, did our thing, came back and went straight to the room as we'd already had the keys. The room was quaint (it is SF) but well appointed and modern. It was easy to get back to the mass transit system so a car was not needed to do things. Had a great stay and would definitely do it again.

review.title: GOOD ALL ROUNDER
review.reviewText: GREAT POSITION,SAFE , WITH STAFF ALWAYS VERY WILLING TO ASSIST ALL NEEDS, BREAKFAST LITE BUT GOOD .

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: So close to Fisherman's Wharf, I would choose this hotel for location over and over again. Two blocks to the Wharf and two blocks to the trolly's.

review.title: Nice stay
review.reviewText: Clean rooms, accommodating staff, okay breakfast. Overall very nice stay for the price, and location couldn't be better for Wharf attractions.

review.title: Very nice place!
review.reviewText: I was very happy with the appearance of this beautiful hotel right by Fishermans wharf, walking distance to literally everything there. I had a great visit and for the price I think it was a steal =)

review.title: Ideal Location
review.reviewText: A great hotel for the price - close to Fishermen's Wharf and the bus and cable cars to get around San Francisco. Staff was helpful for directions. Mini suite very comfortable and breakfast was fine. Close to Safeway to buy supplies. Would stay here again.

review.title: Great Hotel!! Great Location!!
review.reviewText: My Daughter and I went to San Fransisco for a girls weekend and could not have been happier with our stay at this hotel!! The staff was so friendly and helpful and the breakfast buffet was great! It saved us alot of money. The hotel location was perfect,just a few blocks from Fisherman's Wharf and other sights. Our room was clean and very comfortable! I would definitely recommend this hotel! It was great!!

review.title: Great Hotel Service.
review.reviewText: It was an anniversary trip for my wife and I. We were very satisfied with the service at the hotel. We didn't like the location of our first room, and the staff gladly moved us without difficulty. They recommended a limo service that was very reasonable for transportation to the Cliff House restaurant for our anniversary dinner (which we loved) and snuck flowers in our room by my request while we were at dinner. What a great stay!!

review.title: Holiday Inn Express - Fishersman's Wharf, SF
review.reviewText: The entire team at the hotel did a great job. They were responsive to requests and promptly provided the item/service. The facility was clean, well maintained and provided an excellent breakfast bar with a wonderful array of foods. The Holiday Inn Express contributed to a wonderful vacation at Fisherman's Wharf and we would recommend the hotel to others.

review.title: very helpful staff
review.reviewText: We stayed at the holiday inn fisherman's wharf for 3 nights. It close to pier 39, wharf restaurants and to the cable car (the line going downtown is about 2 blocks away). The staff were exceptional and they were ready and happy to help us with any request. If I were to stay in the fisherman's wharf area again, I would most likely stay there.

review.title: Good value and great location
review.reviewText: Holiday Inn Express was a very nice hotel. Rooms were clean and staff were pleasant. There was a free continental breakfast each morning that was convenient. Location was great as it is near Fisherman's Wharf but still quiet at night.

review.title: Convenient and clean
review.reviewText: While our room didn't have a great view - only an inner concrete courtyard, we were close to the wharf and the accommodations were good. Breakfasts were very nicely done and service providers were pleasant. We had a terrific stay and it was was affordable, as well.

review.title: A nice place to stay, for not alot of dough!
review.reviewText: The Holiday Inn Express at Fisherman's Wharf was a good place to stay for a resonable rate. It is in walking distance to alot of the main attractions, or tour "buses". I would definately recommend it for all types of travellers and would stay there again myself.

review.title: good location small room
review.reviewText: We recently spent 5 nights at The Holiday Inn Fisherman's Wharf in San Francisco. The hotel is in a good location, close to the wharf, resturants, shops as well as the cable cars. There is a Muni stop just up the street. The staff was friendly and helpful, the breakfasts where good. The room was, however, very small. The furniture seemed very low. I am fairly tall and this made for a somewhat uncomfortable time in the room.

review.title: very nice hotel.. very accomodating'
review.reviewText: Very nice, clean hotel. Right near everything!!!! Great place to stay. Breakfast was good.

review.title: economic choice near the wharf
review.reviewText: Terrific location walking distance to fisherman's wharf shops, bars and restaurants. Room was very nice and staff was friendly. Don't confuse this with the larger Holiday In, which is a block away. One drawback is the $30 daily parking charge, which is so prevalent in SF.

review.title: Very conviently located
review.reviewText: Almost everything was as good as it could be except hallway noise was loud, even with people just talking in the hall. Room was clean and comfortable. No swimming pool or spa. Great location and could walk to almost all of the local attractions, and close to cable cars and trolleys. Above average breakfast buffet.

review.title: would love to go back
review.reviewText: the room was a little small but had all of the essential amenities. It was very clean and the staff at the front desk very friendly.

review.title: weekend away
review.reviewText: A great location to stay and enjoy fishermans wharf area.

review.title: Adequate Accomodation
review.reviewText: This hotel is well located. It has a reasonable level of comfort with free internet access. Car Parking is expensive at $42/night

review.title: Perfect location for visitors to San Francisco
review.reviewText: Hotel was wonderful, clean, quiet and had an excellent breakfast bar. Location was best I have ever been in during trips to San Francisco. Staff was friendly and service was efficient and quick. Loved this place...

review.title: Absolutely the right choice for us
review.reviewText: We chose this hotel after a lot of research and were a little leary of some comments about poor service. I can not say enough about how great the staff and property were. My husband and I spent 6 wonderful vacation days in San Fran and this hotel kept us on budget and feeling like we didn't sacrafice anything to do so. It is a short walk to all F. Wharf attractions and SF has amazing public transit that was very accessible.

review.title: Great trip !!!!
review.reviewText: If you want a clean, safe, friendly hotel in san Francisco the holiday inn express is ideal !!!! very close to Fishermans Wharf but as the city is so compact getting aroynd shouldn't be a problem as public transport is very good and taxi's are everywhere !!! Staff are amazingly helpful and friendly,,,,,so stop reading and get booking !!!

review.title: Great Choice for Fisherman's Wharf area
review.reviewText: Highly recommend this hotel if want to be in walking distance of Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39, Ghiradelli Square, North Beach, and several of the tours.
